loans.name: Sapalleda

texts.en:
A. R. Sapalleda is from the town of Brgy.Uno, Katipunan. She is 45 years old and married with 4 school-age children.

To make a living, A. sells ice cream and seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. A. is just starting this business.

A. joined PMPC in 2007 to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her sixth loan, for 9,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional inventory. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's living conditions and to educate her children.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Virgie Caimor's Group

texts.en:
Virgie C., 51 years old, is from the village of Tubod. She is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Virgie is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living she operates a "sari-sari" store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Virgie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Virgie joined PMPC in 2005 to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loans from PMPC. Virgie is requesting her 12th loan, for 8000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family’s general living conditions.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Arsulita B., 70 years old, is from the village of Buenavista. She is is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Arsulita is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living Arsulita operates a "sari-sari" store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Arsulita has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

Arsulita joined PMPC in 2000 to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid her previous loans from PMPC. Arsulita is requesting her 14th loan, for 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en: Maria Fe L. is from the village of Poblacion, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 55 years old, is married and has four adult and school-aged children. Maria Fe owns and operates a business selling clothes and other Ready-To-Wear products called "RTW". She has been engaged in her business for eight years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. However, the family’s main source of income comes from the income of her husband. In 2007, Maria Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Maria Fe is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Visa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 9th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions. loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita R. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 59 years old, is married, and has seven adult children.

Benita owns and operates a specialized retail of firewoods, selling firewood in the local community. Benita has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Benita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizer for her garden and farm.

Benita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be additional capital for her firewoods business. This loan will be the 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

 About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

texts.en:
Rosevilla L. is from the village of Bitoon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 38 years old and married with school-aged children.

loans.name: Sheila Yvonney

texts.en:
Sheila Yvonney E. is from the village of Gusapong, Binuangan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 46 years old, married and has six school-age children. 

To make a living, Sheila teaches a grade school class in a public school. The other source of income for the family comes from her husband who is a driver and part-time fisherman. Sheila Yvonney has been engaged in her teaching for 10 years and earns approximately 18,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Sheila Yvonney joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. Sheila Yvonney has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to pay the tuition fees of her children who are in college. Sheila Yvonney is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used also for the tuition fees of her college-age children.

loans.name: Los Plata Group

texts.es:
El grupo Los P. está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, escosadas y decididas provenientes de Piedra Quemada una comarca de Nindirí, zona rural de difícil acceso. La coordinadora del grupo es María Lourdes S. P. de 26 años de edad quien desde pequeña trabaja junto con su madre en la venta de candelas y veladoras. 
 
Ella actualmente administra el negocio y con el préstamo piensa comprar  nuevos productos y candelas para su negocio. Esta joven  es madre de dos pequeños, trabaja, administra su propio negocio y estudia contabilidad.

Sus compañeros de grupo son  la señora Olga María B. P. de 65 años de edad quien se dedica al lavado y planchado de ropa además de vender algunos objetos y  Reynaldo José P. S. de 69 años de edad se dedica al comercio de ganado.
texts.en:
The Los P. group is comprised of three hard-working and determined people who put forth a lot of effort. They are from Piedra Quemada in the Nindirí district, which is a rural area with difficult access. María Lourdes S. P., age 26, is the coordinator of the group. Since she was little she has worked with her mother selling candles. She currently runs the business. She plans to use the loan to buy new products and candles for the business. This young woman has two children, works, runs her own business, and is studying accounting. Olga María B. P., age 65, is a colleague in the group. She washes and irons clothes. She also sells some objects. Reynaldo José P. S., age 69, is the other colleague in the group. He is in the livestock business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy candles

loans.name: Gagne Group

texts.fr:
GAGNE, est un groupe de solidarité composé de 07 membres tous issus du même village BAMBATO dans la région de Kolda et distant d'environs de 100 kilomètre de la capitale régionale de Ziguinchor. Elles sont toutes des femmes mariées exceptée Madame Jacqueline N. qui observe encore un veuvage. Elles sont des femmes âgées en moyenne de 45 ans et toutes mères d'au moins de 05 enfants.

Elles font partie d'un des groupes de solidarité du Banc Villageois de BAMBATO. Elles forment un groupe très solidaire et très actif dans les activités de leur Banc Villageois. Ces membres évoluent dans le même secteur d'activité commerciale et fréquentent les mêmes marchés qu'elles maîtrisent bien. 

Ce nouveau prêt leur permettra d'acheter de l'huile de palme des arachides du poisson frais et du "nététou" afin de mieux développer leur activité commerciale au niveau des marchés de leur localité. Le "nététou" est un produit alimentaire locale transformé à partir de fruits d'arbre. 

La présidente du groupe de solidarité, Madame Béatrice M. est âgée de 47 ans et mère de 8 enfants en charge et des 02 enfants de sa co-épouse décédée. Elle fait principalement la transformation de nététou qu'elle vend à Dakar, capitale du Sénégal. Par ce prêt elle espère accroître sa capacité de production et augmenter ses revenus financiers afin de mieux soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
GAGNE is a solidarity group composed of seven members, all from the same village of BAMBATO in the region of Kolda and about 100 km from the regional capital of Ziguinchor.  The group members are all married women, except Ms. Jacqueline N. continuing to live a widow's life. These women, averaging 45 years of age, are all mothers who have at least five children who make up one of the solidarity groups that form the Banc Villageois de BAMBATO.  GAGNE is a tight-knit and very active group in the activities of their Banc Villageois.  These members are involved in the same sector of commerce and frequent the same markets that they are mastering well.  This new loan will enable them to buy palm oil, peanut oil, fresh fish, and nététou in order to develop further their business at the markets of their town.  Nététou is a local food made from tree fruit.  The solidarity group's president, Ms. Béatrice M., is 47 years old and the mother of eight children to support plus two children of her deceased co-wife.  Béatrice mainly makes nététou and sells it in Dakar (capital of Senegal).  With this loan, she hopes grow her production capacity and to increase her revenues in order do more to support her husband to support the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Developing and advancing their businesses in the solidarity group

loans.name: Koute Diomboulou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité KOUTEDIOMBOULOU fait partie d'un des groupes du Banc Villageois de BAMBATO dans la région de Kolda. Le groupe est créé en octobre 2002. Le groupe est composé de 07 femmes âgée en moyenne de 35 ans, toutes mariées et mère d'au moins de 4 enfants. 

Le groupe KOUTEDIOMBOULOU est très expérimenté puisque la plus part des membres sont des anciennes dans l'institution de micro-crédit de CAURIE. Elles pratiquent la même activité qui consiste la transformation et vente de nététou. Le nététou est un produit alimentaire local très prisé, il est préparé à base de fruit d'arbre sauvage.

La présidente est âgée de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle fréquente le marché hebdomadaire de Yarang, dans sa localité, pour vendre sa production de nététou. Ce prêt lui permettra d'augmenter ses revenus financier et de soutenir son mari dans les différentes charges familiales. 

Ce nouveau prêt permettra également au groupe de s'approvisionner en grande quantité en fruits d'arbre sauvage appelé communément "néré" afin de renforcer leur production de nététou. cette activité leur offre l'occasion d'accroître leurs revenus financiers et ainsi leur permettre de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de leurs familles respectives.
texts.en:
The Koutediomboulou solidarity group is one of the Bambato Banc Villageois groups in the Kolda region. The group has been formed in October 2002. It includes seven women, who, on the average, are 35 years old and have at least four children each. The group is very experienced because most of it members are long-time clients of the Caurie microfinance institution. The group members are engaged in the same business activity: preparing and selling “nététou. Nététou is a very popular local food made from the fruits of a wild growing plant [“néré,” a leguminous shrub, the seed pods of which are transformed into a local food product by cooking and fermenting]. The group leader is 33 years old, married and the mother of five children. She regularly goes to the weekly market of Yarang in her community in order to sell the nététou she prepares. This loan will allow her to increase her income and to help her husband provide for the family needs. The new loan will also allow the group members to stock up a larger quantity of néré seed pods of in order to increase their production of nététóu. This business gives them an opportunity to boost their income and help improve the life conditions of their respective families.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boosting the group's business capital

loans.name: Anigéanne

texts.fr:
Anigéanne B. est une femme de 28 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BAMBATO depuis le 18 mars 2008. C'est une femme très dynamique et engagée dans les différentes activités de son groupe. En deux ans seulement au sein du Banc Villageois elle a mobilisé un bon niveau d'épargne. Elle fait un petit commerce de produits divers et ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter de l'huile de palme, du miel, du jus de citron et du poisson séché qu'elle revendra au niveau des marchés de sa localité. 
Son objectif est de participer au bien-être familiale en contribuant à l'amélioration de la santé et de la nourriture.
texts.en:
Anigéanne B. is a 28-year-old woman, married, and the mother of three children to support.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois de BAMBATO since March 18, 2008.  She is a very energetic women committed to the various activities of her group.  In only two years with the Banc Villageois, she has gotten together a tidy savings.  Anigéanne has a small-scale business involving various goods.  This new loan will enable her to buy palm oil, honey, lemon juice, and dried fish that she will sell at her town's markets.  Her goal is to contribute to her family's well-being by helping to make improvements with regard to health care and food.   

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her ability to invest and advancing her business

loans.name: Lechuguitas Group

texts.es:
El banco D. emprendimiento Lechuguitas se origino ante la necesidad D. crédito por parte D. las integrantes, para la inversión en sus mercaderías y así D. esta manera generar mayor utilidad el cual pueda satisfacer sus necesidades.

La directiva electa por parte D. las  socias esta a cargo D. la Señora Cristina, como presidenta del grupo, una persona D. VallegranD. que emigro a nuestra ciudad en busca D. un futuro mejor para su familia ya que el lugar no era tan comercial, la Sra. Cristina esta casada y tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, se dedica a la venta D. ropa tiene puesto fijo en un mercado D. la ciudad D. cochabamba, el dinero del credito lo utilizara en la compra D. ropa por mayor y D. temporada ya que se acerca el invierno y necesita surtir su puesto D. venta con ropa abrigada para esta temporada.

Como tesorera se encuentra la Señora Elisa, una persona con unas características D. liderazgo, responsabilidad y confianza demostrada a través D. otras organizaciones en la que estuvo presente, se dedica a la venta D. comida y con el dinero del credito comprara insumos para la elaboracion D. sus riquisimos platillos.

Todas son empresarias con un alto sentido D. superación en busca D. ser motores productivos dentro su familia y no así solo amas D. casa que dependan del esposo, es por esta razón que para llevar adelante sus emprendimientos deciden agruparse para solicitar crédito mancomunado  ya que no cuentan con garantías que la banca tradicional exige, y D. esta manera apoyarse para sacar un solo crédito, estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The “Lechugitas” (Little Heads of Lettuce) communal bank grew out of the members’ need to invest in their merchandise so that they could produce higher profits to meet their needs. The governing board elected by the members is led by Cristina, group president. She is originally from VallegranD. but she moved to our city looking for a better future for her family because the previous place wasn’t too commercial. Cristina is married and has two, school-age children. She sells clothing in a sales stall in Cochabamba’s market. She will use the funds to buy seasonal clothing at wholesale since winter is approaching and she needs to stock her stall with warm clothing for this season. Elisa is group treasurer. She is a person with strong leadership, responsibility and reliability characteristics that she has demonstrated in other organizations she’s been involved with. She sells food and will use the funds to buy ingredients to make her delicious meals. All the members are businesswomen with a high sense of self improvement; they are always looking for ways to push their families forward and not just be housewives dependent on their husbands. This is why they decided to group together to seek a group loan that will help all of them since they don’t qualify for financing from traditional banks; this way they can support each other and take out a single loan. They are very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in them by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Tessito Group

texts.fr:
TESSITO est un groupe de solidarité composé spécifiquement de femmes, il est créé en octobre 2002. c'est un groupe homogène composé de 08 femmes toutes issues du Banc Villageois de BAMBATO qui porte le même nom que village. Elles sont en moyenne âgées de 30 à 40 ans et sont au moins mère de 4 enfants. 

Leur activité est la vente de balais et d'huile de palme. Tous ces deux produits ce sont elles mêmes qui les fabriquent. Les balais sont fabriqués à partir des feuilles de palmier et l'huile à partir des noix de palmier. L'huile de palme, étant un produit rare et prisé par les populations du nord et centre du pays, est vendu à bon prix dans ces parties du Sénégal et génère pas mal de bénéfices aux productrices. 

Ce crédit leur permettra d'intensifier leur activité par l'achat en quantité suffisante de régimes de noix de palmier et assez de feuilles de palmiers en vue d'augmenter leur production. 

Quant à la présidente du groupe de solidarité, Madame Awa Pélagie S., elle est âgée de 30 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle pratique la même activité que ses compagnons, c'est-à-dire la production et vente de balais et d'huile de palme. Et son objectif est d'accroître ses revenus financiers afin de pouvoir soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge de la famille. 

En sus des remboursements réguliers de leurs prêts, les membres parviennent à verser une épargne mensuelle au niveau du grand groupe le Banc Villageois.
texts.en:
Tessito is a solidarity group composed exclusively of women. It has been created in October 2002. It consists of eight women, all belonging to the Bambato Banc Villageois, which is named after their village. They are between 30 and 40 years old on the average, and each has at least four children. Their activity is selling brooms and palm oil--two products they make themselves. The brooms are made from palm leaves, and the oil from palm nuts. Palm oil is a rare and much appreciated product in the northern and central regions of the country and can be sold at a good price in those regions, which results in good profit margins. This loan will allow the group members to strengthen their business by purchasing a larger quantity of palm nuts as well as palm leaves in order to increase their level of production. The group leader, Mrs. Awa Pélagie S., is 30 years old, married, and the mother of four dependent children. She is engaged in the same business activity as her peers, production and sale of brooms and palm oil. Her goal is to increase her revenue in order to be able to help her husband provide for the family needs. Apart from making regular payments on their loan, the group members also put aside a monthly amount to add to their savings with the main Banc Villageois group.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boosting the business capital of the group in order to increase its revenues

loans.name: El Buen Pastor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Buen Pastor está conformado por Isabel  V., Ana María Borge R. y  Melida Rosa Guzmán tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras que en este tiempo han ido mejorando su negocio.  La coordinadora del grupo es Isabel V. de 46 años quien vende comida en el Mercado Oriental y desea poder ampliar y mejorar su negocio el cual ha mejorado poco a poco.

Las otras integrantes son Rosa María Ortiz Estrada quien vende producto Avon y fresco y Melida Rosa Guzmán quien vende ropa y cosméticos por encargo.
texts.en:
The Buen Pastor (Good Shepard) Group is composed of Isabel, Ana María, and Melida Rosa, 3 hard-working, forceful, and enterprising women who have been improving their businesses lately. Coordinator of the group is Isabel, 46 years old, who sells meals in the Oriental Market and wishes to expand and improve her business, which she has been growing little by little. The other members of the group are Rosa María, who sells soft drinks and Avon products, and Melida Rosa, who sells clothing and cosmetics by order.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING BASIC GRAINS, MEAT, SPICES, ETC. TO PREPARE MEALS TO SELL

loans.name: Tamara Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tamara está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y decididas quienes trabajan han trabajado con kiva desde su primer ciclo. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora María Francisca Z. quien hace tres años empezó a hacer y vender helados, fresco y fritanga por las noches con el fin de sacar a delante a su hijo y progresar junto a su esposo quien trabaja como afanador en la Universidad Nacional Autonoma de Nicaragua  (UNAN).

Ella con el préstamo invertirá en Tacos, helados, chicles, fresco de chicha, aceite etc. con lo cual su negocio seguirá progresando. Sus compañeras de grupo son Josefa Mercedes F. quien lucha hombro a hombro con su compañero de vida quien mientras el anda taxiando ella vende en su casa que vende fresco, helados y chocobananos y Julia Marcelina C. quien vende Nacatamales, comida típica que generalmente se comercializa los fines de semana.
texts.en:
The Tamara Group, composed of 3 hard-working, forceful and determined women, has worked with Kiva since its 1st loan cycle. The coordinator of the group is Mrs. María Francisca who, 3 years ago, began to make and sell ice cream, fermented maize drink, and Nicaraguan snacks in the evening, with the goal of advancing her son and progressing along with her husband, who works as a laborer at UNAN, the Autonomous National University of Nicaragua. With this loan she will invest in tacos, ice cream, chewing gum, fermented maize drink, cooking oil, etc., so that her business will continue to progress. Her companions in the group are Josefa Mercedes, who struggles shoulder to shoulder with her life companion who drives a taxi, while she sells fermented maize drink, ice cream, and chocolate-dipped bananas from her home; and Julia Marcelina, who sell Nacatamales, a typical local treat sold generally on weekends.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING BASIC GRAINS, MEAT, COOKING OIL, ETC., TO PREPARE MEALS TO SELL

loans.name: Fe Y Vida Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fe y Vida está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y decididas quienes llevan su segundo préstamo en Adim y Kiva con el que invertirán en sus negocios para mejorar. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Dominga H.  quien desde muy joven se dedica al comercio ropa y la realización de manualidades arte que aprendió en el colegio y  fue perfeccionando con el tiempo.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Brenda del Carmen F. quien todas las tardes saca a la acera de su casa la parrilla con los productos que comercializa y Sandra Isabel Cantero vende tortilla desde hace tres años y comprara con el préstamo un saco de maíz.
texts.en:
The Fe y Vida group is comprised of three hard-working and determined women who put forth a lot of effort. This is their second loan with Adim and Kiva. They will use it to invest in improving their businesses. Dominga H. is the coordinator of the group. Since she was very young she has been selling clothes. She also makes handicrafts. She learned this art in school, and with time she has been perfecting it. Brenda del Carmen F., a colleague in the group, takes her grill and the products she sells to the sidewalk outside her house every afternoon. Sandra Isabel Cantero, the other colleague, has been selling tortillas for three years. She will use the loan to buy a sack of corn.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and handicrafts

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia tiene 33 años, es una mujer  muy trabajadora, vive con sus 2 hijos menores en la casa de sus abuelos. Desde que tenía 7 años se dedicó al comercio, vendiendo alverjas, habas, zanahorias y demás hortalizas, de ese entonces esta en constante actividad, comprando y vendiendo en cantidad. Su madre la ayuda en el negocio y también a cuidar de sus hijos, por lo que a veces se turnan para recoger a los niños del colegio, de esa manera han logrado salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es tener un puesto fijo dentro del mercado, ya que hasta el momento sus ventas lo realiza de manera ambulatoria. Su negocio le es rentable, puesto que conoce mucha gente que acuden a su puesto de venta. Sin embargo lo más difícil y peligroso de su trabajo es que tiene que madrugar para recibir a los mayoristas, quienes le proporcionan los productos que vende, ya que se expone a que la asalten y roben su mercadería. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, por tanto se compromete a seguir pagando sus cuotas como hasta ahora. En su grupo comunal es un cliente muy dinámico y responsable. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá aumentar su capital de trabajo, para que pueda abastecer su tienda y poder captar más clientes.
texts.en:
Patricia, 33, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her two young children in her parents home. She has been working since she was seven years old selling peas, beans, carrots and other vegetables in season and ever since she has been in constant activity, buying and selling in bulk. Her mother helps with the business and also cares for her children. Sometimes she drops off and picks up the children at school which has allowed her to get ahead. Her greatest desire is to have a permanent stall within the marketplace, but so far she has done her sales as a traveling vendor. Her business is profitable, since he knows many people who come to her market stall. However, the most difficult and dangerous part of her work is the need to get up early to go to wholesalers, who will provide products to sell, but also expose her to potential assault and theft of her cargo. This is her tenth loan with MFP and she pledges to continue her payments. In her community group, she is a very dynamic and responsible participant. The loan will increase her working capital and enable her to stock her store and therefore to reach more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more inventory to stock her market stall and attract more customers

loans.name: Cajina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cajina está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas son   Blanca Azucena A. Cajina  quien venden esquimos y bisutería en su casa. Ella con el préstamo compra una caja de esquimo, cajetas de leche, chapas, pulseras y collares.

Sus compañeras de grupo son María Lydia M. Dávila hace chocobananos y reposterías e invertirá en materia prima como harina, huevo, azúcar, mantequilla etc. y Ana Virginia Pérez tiene una pequeña fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en alimentos fritos donde comercializa especialmente enchiladas y tajadas con queso.
texts.en:
The Cajina group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising working people. One of them is Blanca Azucena A. Cajina who sells ice cream and jewelry from her house. With this loan, she will buy an ice cream box, milk bowls, plates, bracelets and necklaces. Her group colleagues are Maria Lydia M. D. who makes chocobananas and pastries and will invest in basic ingredients like flour, eggs, sugar, butter, etc. and Ana Virginia P. who has a small fried food stand, a popular restaurant that consists of fried foods where she especially sells enchiladas and cheese slices.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an ice cream box, milk bowls, plates, bracelets and necklaces.

loans.name: Castulo

texts.es: Castulo, de 45 años, es un joven muy  responsable, vive en casa de sus padres, en compañía de su madre que es anciana. Su principal  sustento es la venta de ropa y lo realiza de manera ambulante, pero su perseverancia y dedicación le han dado fuerzas para aguantar largas horas de caminata. La mercadería que posee es muy solicitada por sus amistades y amigos de su barrio, puesto que saben de la calidad de prendas que tiene, además de las facilidades de pago que les da. Es así que ha logrado tener 15 años haciendo esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es negarse en dar crédito a sus clientes, debido a que se demoran en pagar. Su mayor anhelo es aumentar su negocio con la venta de zapatos, de esa manera diversifica su negocio. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP y considera que le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su negocio. Es su grupo comunal, es el encargado de poner el orden dentro de su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en el incremento de más prendas de vestir, para no perder a sus asiduos compradores.
texts.en:
Castulo, who is 45, is a responsible person who lives in his parents' house accompanying his mother who is elderly. His principal job is selling clothing and he does this on foot. However, his perseverance and dedication has given him the energy to spend long hours on foot. The merchandise that he possesses is popular with this friends and acquaintances from the neighborhood since they know of the quality of clothing he has in addition to the payment facilities that he gives them. It is in this way that he has achieved 15 years doing this activity and he considers the most difficult thing to be denying credit to his customers, since they are slow to pay. His greatest goal to expand his business by selling shoes and, this way, diversify his business. This is his tenth loan with MFP and he considers it to be beneficial for the development of his business. In his community bank, he is in charge of placing orders for the group. With the loan that he is soliciting, he will invest in an more clothing so he doesn't lose his frequent buyers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo mujeres Luchadoras está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y esforzadas como el nombre del grupo lo indica y describe.  La coordinadora del grupo es Ana Silvia Rodríguez quien tiene una pequeña venta donde vende galletas, cigarros, pan y meneíto principalmente. Ella con el préstamo piensa surtirla con otros productos de interés.

Sus compañeras de Grupo son María Natividad F. quien se dedica al comercio de ropa nueva y usada  e invertirá en camisas, calcetines, biquinis, pantalones, ropa de niño...etc.,  Marling del Carmen Rodríguez tiene una modesta venta de  pan, meneítos, café y cigarro y Nora de los Ángeles M.  es propietaria de una fritanga donde vende desde enchiladas, tacos, carne asada y pollo asado, además de vender comida.
texts.en:
The female group, Luchadores ("fighters") is made up of four working women who are hard-working and enterprising, as the group name indicates and describes. The coordinator of the group is Ana Sylvia R. who has a small store where she sells mainly cookies, cigarettes, bread and ice cream. With this loan, she is thinking of stocking up with other popular products. Her group colleagues are Maria Natividad F. who is dedicated to selling both new and used clothing and will invest in blouses, socks, bikinis, trousers, and children's clothing, etc. Marling del Carmen R. has a modest shop selling bread, ice cream, coffee and cigarettes. And Nora de los Angeles M. is the owner of a fried food stall where she sells enchiladas, tacos, roasted meat and roasted chicken, as well as selling food.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cookies, cigarettes, bread, ice cream and basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Ndèye Ndelle

texts.fr: Ndèye Ndella D. est une femme de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants en charge. elle est membre du banc Villageois de MONTAGNE SUD depuis 2 ans et a 4 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle est détentrice d'une boutique à domicile et son nouveau prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en marchandises telles du riz, de l'huile végétale, de la tomate concentrée, des boîtes de conserves etc. son objectif est de soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge de la famille par rapport à la nourriture, la santé, le payement de la scolarité des enfants et à leur habillement.
texts.en:
Ndèye Ndella D. is a 50-year-old woman, married, and the mother of seven children to support.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE SUD for two years. She has benefited from a loan four consecutive times and has never had a problem repaying.  She has a store at home, and her new loan will enable her to stock it with goods, such as rice, vegetable oil, tomato paste, canned foods, etc.  Her goal is to support her husband to support the family with regard to food, health care, and the schooling costs and clothing for the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying goods for enhancing her store

loans.name: Boye Guèye

texts.fr: Boye Guèye N. est une femme de 50 ans, Elle est célibataire avec 03 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE NORD2 depuis le 29 mars 2008 et a 3 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. C'est un membre très dynamique et plein d'ambition, en un an et demi elle a pu atteindre un encours d'épargne de 184.000 francs CFA. Cette épargne sera renforcée et sera destinée à des investissement pour sa famille, la construction de maison par exemple. Elle développe un commerce de tissu et de vêtements et son crédit lui permettra à s'approvisionner en quantité plus important en tissus et vêtements que les 6 derniers mois pour intensifier son activité. Ainsi elle réalisera plus de bénéfices et pourra participer à l'amélioration des conditions de sa famille.
texts.en:
Boye Guèye N. is a 50-year-old woman who is unmarried with three children to support.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE NORD2 since March 29, 2008.  She has benefited from a loan three consecutive times.  She is a very energetic member and full of ambition.  In 1½ years, she was able to achieve a savings of 184,000 francs CFA.  This savings will be augmented and earmarked for investments for her family, such as for building a house.  She is developing a business involving fabrics and clothing.  Her loan will enable her to stock up on fabrics and clothing in quantities greater than in the last six months in order to intensify her business.  Thus, she will make more profit and will help improve her family's living conditions. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabrics and clothing to resell

loans.name: Americas ** Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Américas**. Está ubicado en Jilotepec, en el Estado de México en México.  El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. 
Verónica R. Hernández es integrantes del grupo. Tiene 40 años, estudió hasta el sexto año de primaria, es comerciante y tiene en total 2 hijas. Ella se dedica a la venta de cerámica que inició hace 5 años, vende su producto rancheando, de casa en casa, dejándolo en pagos semanales o quincenales dependiendo de sus clientes. Solicita el préstamo para surtir más su negocio ya que como la venta es en pagos avécese su recuperación es mas lenta por lo que requiere de mayor inversión para tener más artículos que ofrecer a su clientela. Ella piensa comprar, floreros, tazas, platos, saleros, servilleteros, macetas, artesanías, etc. Según para lo que le alcance el crédito. Quiere este crédito para hacer crecer su negocio y con las ganancias que le genere quiere ahorrar para mas adelante cumplir su sueño de establecer su negocio en un local propio, pues actualmente ya tiene los muros, sin embargo aun le falta la loza y accesorios para que éste quede bien acondicionado y entonces si constituir su negocio y dejar de andar de un lugar a otro.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
- Nancy Guadalupe Z. S. (Venta de corsetería)
- Patricia R. Hernández (Venta de cerámica)
- Alejandra Hernández I. (Venta de cosméticos)
- Rebeka Jarabid R. Hernández (Venta de cosméticos)
- María del Socorro M. Gómez (Maquila de suéter)
- Julia M. Sánchez (Venta de Corsetería)
- Alejandra de Jesús Zúñiga R. (Venta de corsetería)
- Rosa Hernández Ávila (Venta de gelatinas)
- Rosa Mara T. S. (Venta de zapatos)
texts.en:
This group is called Américas. They are located in Jiltepec, in the State of Mexico in Mexico. The group is made up of 10 members. Verónica R. Hernández is a member of the group. She is 40, studied up through 6th grade of primary school. She is a businesswoman and has 2 daughters. For the past 5 years she has been selling ceramics, going from rural community to rural community, from house to house, with weekly payments or bi-weekly, depending on the customers. She is asking for the loan to supply her business more since sometimes collections are slower. Because of this she needs more money to have more inventory to offer her customers. She is planning on buying vases, cups, plates, salt shakers, napkin holders, plant pots, arts and crafts, etc-as much as the loan will cover. She wants this loan to make her business grow and with the earnings that she will generate, she wants to save so that in the future she can fulfill her dream of having her business in its own location. For now she has the walls, but is missing the dishes and accessories so that it will be set up well. She wants to stop traveling from one place to the other and stay in her own place. The other members of the group are: - Nancy Guadalupe Z. S. (lingerie sales) - Patricia R. Hernández (ceramics sales) - Alejandra Hernández I. (cosmetics sales) - Rebeka Jarabid R. Hernández ((cosmetics sales) - María del Socorro M. Gómez (sweater workshop) - Julia M. Sánchez (lingerie sales) - Alejandra de Jesús Zúñiga R. (lingerie sales) - Rosa Hernández Ávila (gelatin sales) - Rosa Mara T. S. (shoe sales)

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Maguette D. est une femme de 26 ans elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de MONTAGNE-SUD depuis le 28 mars 2008 et a 3 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n'a jamais eu de difficulté lors de ses remboursements. Elle a fait de belles performances dans le Banc Villageois par rapport à son niveau d'épargne au bout d'un an et demi. Elle est vendeuse de légumes et de poisson frais, son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité en augmentant sa quantité d'achat de légumes et de poissons frais. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus financier et prétendre participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Maguette D. is a 26-year-old woman, married, and the mother of three children.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE-SUD since March 28, 2008.  She has benefited from a loan three consecutive times and has never had problems when repaying.  She has a great record at the Banc Villageois relative to her level of savings after a year and a half.  Maguette sells vegetables and fresh fish.  She will thus be able to increase her revenues and aspire to take part in improving her family's living conditions. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling vegetables and fresh fish

loans.name: Zenita's Group

texts.en:
Zenita T. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old and is the group leader of this two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. Zenita is married and has two adult children. She owns and operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Zenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Zenita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Mazahua Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama MAZAHUA porque la comunidad en la cual habitan está muy arraigado el dialecto. Está ubicado en Atlacomulco, Estado de  México en un lugar donde las personas enfrentan diferentes  privaciones en su vida diaria; de las cuales salen avante con un gran compromiso y actitud.  El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes. 
La tesorera del grupo se llama Rocío E. Cárdenas. Tiene 25 años estudió hasta la preparatoria, comenta que desafortunadamente no pudo seguir estudiando por la responsabilidad que adquiere en su casa y con su familia se dedica a la costura, no es casada y no tiene hijos, pero se ha tenido que hacer responsable de sus 9 hermanos en conjunto con su mama; día a día buscan la manera de solventar cada una de sus necesidades. Rocio se dedica a hacer manteles y servilletas que comercializa principalmente en, San Marcos Tlazalpan, Toluca, Distrito Federal, Santiago Acutzilapan y Atlacomulco, se inicio desde muy pequeña en el negocio sin pensar que fuera a ser esta actividad una fuente de ingreso, siempre le ha gustado la costura y lo aprendió de su mama aunque al principio menciona que le costó mucho trabajo aprender, su dedicación y perseverancia hizo posible que hoy en dia realice excelentes trabajos, ha enfrentado diferentes dificultades 	como lo ha sido que la vista se le ha debilitado pero afortunadamente su familia la apoya ayudándole a hacer sus trabajos. Al momento de solicitar el crédito está pensando en lo que va a comprar y siempre que tiene oportunidad visita los negocios de hilos para ir haciendo un presupuesto de lo que necesitara de dinero para comprar material. Rocio tiene la ilusión de que con su trabajo sus hermanos tengan mejores oportunidades en otros ámbitos de la sociedad y tengan una mejor calidad de vida que hoy en dia.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
Felipa N. M. (vta. plástico), 
Graciela V. Martínez (vta. Productos de lamina), 
Catalina Cárdenas Cárdenas (vta. De plástico y lamina), 
Cristina R. Cárdenas (vta. de verdura y artesanía), 
Ana Rosa Méndez N. (Vta. de plástico), 
Diana M. N. (vta. de plástico), 
Lucia Ramírez Sánchez (abarrotes), 
Luisa N. M. ( Taller de lamina), 
Mahe Adriana Hernández M. ( Taller de Lamina).
texts.en:
This group is called “Mazahua” because the community in which they live is deeply rooted in the dialect of the same name. They live in Atlacomulco, in the State of Mexico, where the people press forward with great commitment and attitude despite facing various hardships in their daily lives. The group consists of ten members.

The group treasurer is Rocío E. Cárdenas. She is 25 years old and studied through high school. Unfortunately, she says she had to quit school because of growing responsibilities at home and having to support her family by sewing. She is single and does not have children, but she is responsible for taking care of her nine siblings together with her mother. Every day she looks for ways to meet their needs. She makes tablecloths and napkins that are mainly sold in San Marcos Tlazalpan, Toluca, Mexico City, Santiago Acutzilapan, and Atlacomulco. Rocio learned how to sew at a young age without realizing that one day this skill would become a source of income. She always enjoyed sewing and was taught by her mother. Even though she had a hard time learning how to sew at first, Rocio’s dedication and perseverance resulted in the excellent work she produces today. She faces many challenges as a result of her weakened eyesight, but fortunately her family helps her with her other jobs. Upon requesting this loan, Rocio thought about what she would be buy and had always wanted to start a business making linens, so she will use the money to acquire the necessary materials. She hopes that though her work, her siblings will find better opportunities in other areas of society and experience a better quality of life today.

The other group members are: Felipa N. M. – sells plastics Graciela V. Martínez - sells metal cookware products Catalina Cárdenas Cárdenas - sells plastics and metal cookware Cristina R. Cárdenas - sells vegetables and handicrafts Ana Rosa Méndez N. – sells plastics Diana M. N. - sells plastics Lucia Ramírez Sánchez – sells groceries Luisa N. M. – operates a metal workshop Mahe Adriana Hernández M. - operates a metal workshop

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making linens

loans.name: Maravillas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama maravillas por que las clientas se identifican con el señor de las Maravillas, está ubicado en el estado de puebla, en México, el grupo está conformado por 10 mujeres.
La presidenta del grupo se llama María de Lourdes Nieves A. L. y tiene 45 años, estudio hasta la secundaria, se dedica a la venta de peluches y es soltera, sin embargo, el negocio es su único sustento. Sus clientas opinan que la Srita Lulu es una mujer trabajadora e independiente que ha forjado su negocio en base a esfuerzo, su meta en la vida es poder contar con un patrimonio propio. Solicita el préstamo para comprar material para elaborar peluches  y así surtir sus pedidos.
La Señora Cecilia F. González tiene 39 años es casada tiene tres hijos de diecisiete, dieciséis y diez años su esposo se dedica a la hojalatería y ella estudio solo hasta la secundaria se dedica a la elaboración y venta de antojitos desde hace 11 años, el sazón de sus guisos es reconocido en la zona, solicita el préstamo para comprar un comal más grande y refresco a gran volumen que le permita dar un buen precio, sus clientes la conocen como una mujer que atiende a sus clientes con esmero y amabilidad, el éxito para ella significa darles una mejor educación a sus hijos para que en el futuro sean independientes económicamente.
Las otras integrantes del grupo que aparecen en la foto son:
Cecilia F. González
María Lidia Delfina P. A.
María Soledad C. C.
María Lourdes Nieves A. L.
Ofelia Juana P. Rodríguez
María del Carmen Lourdes A. G.
Irma A. L.
Gabriela A. L.
María Rosa Ignacia González M.
texts.en:
This group is called "the marvels" because the members identify with the gentleman from las Maravillas (the Marvels). The group is located in the state of Puebla, in Mexico, and is composed of 10 women. The president of the group is María de Lourdes Nieves A. L.. She is 45 years old and completed her education in middle school. She sells stuffed animals and is single. Nevertheless, her business is her only means of support. Her customers say that la Señorita Lulu is a hard-working, independent woman who has created her business from her effort and dedication. Her goal in life is financial security. She requests this loan to buy material for making stuffed animals and to fill the orders that she has. La Señora Cecilia F. González is 39 years old, married, and has three children who are seventeen, sixteen, and ten years old. Her husband is an auto body worker, and she completed her education in middle school. She has made and sold various snacks for 11 years. The flavor of her dishes is well-known in the area. She requests this loan to buy a larger hotplate for cooking tortillas and to buy soft drinks in larger quantities in order to sell at a good price. Her customers know her as a woman that attends to them with care and warmth. She defines success as giving a better education to her children so that they will be economically independent. The other members of the group who appear in the photo are: Cecilia F. González María Lidia Delfina P. A. María Soledad C. C. María Lourdes Nieves A. L. Ofelia Juana P. Rodríguez María del Carmen Lourdes A. G. Irma A. L. Gabriela A. L. María Rosa Ignacia González M.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase material to make stuffed animals, purchase a larger hotplate and soft drinks

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma T. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 33 years old, is married, and has four children: two of them are in high school and elementary grade while the remaining two are infants.

Irma owns and operates a business providing delivery service for her fish to sell to local community members. Irma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Irma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to sell fish in the local community.

Irma is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used for her fully payment of her motor. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is 40 years old and married with two children, ages eleven and eight. She is a member of the community bank María Auxiliadora, which is comprised of eleven people all hailing from the Cusco area. Clemencia is originally from the city of Juliaca but has been living in Cusco for over 25 years, and here she makes a living working in a small transportation business she has with her husband. The two of them own and operate a combi, a type of shared-ride van common to Peru. While he drives the van, Clemencia’s job is to collect the fare from passengers. 

Clemencia will use the loan she receives from Kiva to repair the old and wearing parts of her combi van. She says that she will also use the money to travel to Juliaca, her hometown, where she sometimes visits and sells clothing items. Clemencia is appreciative of and thankful for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Repairing combi van/trip to Juliaca to sell clothing

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne E., 47, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Eduardo, a machine operator, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been into direct selling of food supplements while managing her own jewelry business for quite some time now.

Yvonne has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her jewelry business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more quantities and designs of jewelries needed to replenish her current product stock.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying more stocks (food supplements) and various designs of jewelries to replenish her current product stock

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Mrs. Khat S. is a 53-year-ld married woman. She works very hard as a fish seller as mobile around the community typically earns around $3 per day. She currently has another financial earner in her husband, who is a local farmer. This couple is married with seven children, three of whom work in the garment industry, while other four attend school. Recently, Khat S. received orders from some people who need much fish, but she cannot satisfy the needs of her customers because she lacks capital. Because of that, Khat S. decided to pursue a loan to order fish in bulk and resells them to her client for gaining income.

loans.use: To order fish in bulk and resell them to her clients

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 47 year-old woman with four children, ages 27, 23, 20, and 17. She lives in Cusco with her spouse and two youngest children; the others have now left their childhood house and live on their own. Esther is a member of the community bank María Auxiliadora, which is comprised of eleven members all hailing from the Cusco region. 

Esther makes a living running a tienda de abarrotes, or grocery store, in the San Sebastian neighborhood of Cusco. Here she sells staples such as eggs, rice, and pasta. She will use the loan as business capital for her store, buying items that she needs to sustain the enterprise. Esther is thankful for and appreciative of the loan, and promises to pay her monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Restocking her grocery store

To make a living, Berlinda sells fish in the market and nearby Barangays. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from the income of her husband as a fisherman. 

Berlinda has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.In 2008, Berlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Berlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for the tuition fee of her daughter. Berlinda is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital and for the tuition fees of her daughter. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Berlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and for the future of her child.

She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own furniture-making business for quite some time now.

Sabina has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her furniture business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 19,000 loan. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

loans.name: Sayda

texts.en:
Sayda is a member of the María Auxiliadora community bank, which is comprised of eleven members, all hailing from the Cusco area. She is 28 years old and lives with her spouse and their six-year-old child in the neighborhood of San Sebastian. She has lived in this neighborhood for seven years now. 

Sayda makes a living by selling gas canisters to stores and has been in this business for about a year now. She will use the loan from Kiva to buy more canisters to fill with gas so she can increase the quantity of her sales. Sayda is thankful for and appreciates the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Gas Canisters

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. K., a 27-year-old mother of two young kids, is married to Soman, 30, who catches fish in the river to earn a living. K. has operated fish sale business door-to-door for the surrounding neighbors since 2000, earning a small income for serving the family. K. always finds it hard traveling, so she tried to save up her personal money for a vehicle, but her cash is not enough to buy her own vehicle. loans.name: Ruth Meri

texts.en:
Ruth Meri is a 24-year-old single woman with no children. She is a member of the María Auxiliadora community bank, which is comprised of eleven members all hailing from the San Sebastian neighborhood of Cusco. Ruth Meri says that she has been trained to work in the tourism industry, but because of the low tourist season she is now selling fruit in the Feria de Productos market in Cusco. She sells fruit that comes from the Puerto Maldonado region of Peru, and she buys the products wholesale. She says that she took over her mother’s business selling fruit when the tourism industry started going bad. Ruth Meri earns between 300 and 500 soles ($100-166 USD) each weekend in this business.

Ruth Meri will use the Kiva loan to buy more fruit to sell so that she can increase her profits from this business. She is appreciative of and thankful for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Fruit

Musaev S. is 50 years old and he is married. His wife works a teacher in rural school, she earns 2000 KGS (43.44$) per month. S. works as a head teacher in the same school, his monthly salary is 2700 KGS (58.64$). They have a son and 2 daughters. The younger daughter is a pupil, the others are students. 3 years ago, having 5000 KGS (108.6$) he bought 3 heads of small cattle. After fattening the cattle, S. sold them. As a result he increased the number of livestock and thanks to this activity he makes 1500 KGS (32.58$) per month. So they need a loan for purchasing fuel to sow wheat and barley.

Asanalieva G. is 35, she's married and has 4 children: 2 sons and 2 daughters. Both daughters study at school, others are preschool age. G.'s husband is engaged in cattle breeding. When he's free, he helps her with housework. 4 years ago, having 6000 KGS (130.32$) they bought 2 heads of small cattle. After fattening the cattle, they were sold. Thanks to this activity they could increase the number of livestock, so now they've got 15 heads of small cattle, 5 heads of cattle and 2 houses. So they make 2000 KGS (43.44$) per month. Now they want to get a loan to purchase fuel, seeds for potatoes and to pay for tractor-driver services.

Abdyldaeva S. is the treasure of the group. She's 38 and she's married. Her husband works as a driver and security guard. He earns 5000 KGS (108.6$) per month. They have 4 children: 2 daughters and 2 sons. All the children study at school. After school, the older son helps S. with housework. 3 years ago, having 5000 KGS (108.6$) S. purchased 2 heads of cattle, which was sold after fattening. Thanks to this activity they make 2000 KGSW (43.44$) per month. They were also able to increase the number of livestock. Now S. is fattensing a horse and 2 heads of small cattle. She wants to get a loan to purchase 2 heads of cattle and to sow wheat.

Kuramaeva Y. is 50 years old, married and has 4 children: 3 sons and a daughter. All the children study at school. Y.'s husband works as a tractor-driver. When he's free, he helps Y. with housework. They want to get a loan in order to buy a heifer for 7000 KGS (152$) and small cattle for 3000 KGS (65.16$). 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fuel, which is needed for sowing process.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion M. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. She is 60 years old. Encarnacion is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Encarnacion owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Encarnacion has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Encarnacion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Encarnacion successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI. Encarnacion is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Encarnacion from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch Y. was born in 1959 and is living in Dry Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Chhoun Sen, are fishermen who can earn some money to support their family's living. This couple has four children, two of whom are laborers, while the others are too young to work or study. Although they try to work hard, they earn little income; so, to improve the condition their family's living, Mrs. Touch Y. is asking for a loan to buy a new motorbike to transport vegetables to resell as a start to a new business. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Samneang

texts.en:
Mrs. Samneang K. lives in Anlong Ta Sek Leu village in Kandal province. She is 44 years old. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a farmer, while the others are attending the local public school.

She and her husband, Mr. Ny Sus, are farmers who own a plot of land that is more than two hectares, where they grow rice and vegetable to sell in order to support their family. However, their field has infertile soil. To improve production, Mrs. Samneang K. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice and vegetable seeds, gasoline, and water, and to plow the field.

Mrs. Samneang K. is shown in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice and vegetable seeds, gasoline, and water, and to plow their field

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita P. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. She is 34 years old. Mercedita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mercedita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Mercedita has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Mercedita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedita successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from ASKI. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Mercedita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and then sell

loans.name: Sengheang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sengheang N. is a villager in Preaek Hang village in Kandal province. She is 29 years old and a farm laborer in the local village. She is the mother of two children: one is studying in the local public school, while the younger one is five years old.

Her husband, Mr. Meat Met, is fisherman who earns some money to support his family. However, their fishing supplies are too old to use. So to improve her husband’s business, Mrs. Sengheang N. is asking for a loan to buy fishing net and rosin.

Both Mrs. Sengheang N. and her husband are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fishing net and rosin

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom C. lives In Preaek Hang village in Kandal province. She was born in 1986. She is a farming laborer and her husband, Mr. Khchoeng Met, is a fisherman. Although they try to work hard, they do not make much money. So to improve their family's living conditions, Mrs. Mom C. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and a pump machine, and to rent a piece of land to grow vegetables. She is the mother of two children who are too young to work or to go to school. Her husband and children are in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a pump machine and to rent land

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mrs. C. is an older woman, 48 years old, and lives in the best territory of Kompong Tom, one of the provinces of Cambodia. She built a small restaurant where she sells food to people all day. She is married with four children. One of them is married and living independently, while the other three are single. Some of them are working. C. has a conductor in her husband who assists her in selling food. C. faces a problem. Her house is surrounded by ugly water during the heavy rainfalls and it might affect her health and business. Because of this obstacle, C. is pursuing a loan to purchase a piece of land to cover the bad situation.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: Mrs. Sophy P. lives in Chek village in Kandal province. She was born in 1976. She and her husband, Mr. Nak Kak, are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow vegetables that they sell to support their family. Their problem is that their field is infertile and it is a long way from an irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Sophy P. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. She is the mother of five children, one of whom is a construction worker, while the others are attending the local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida L. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. She is 37 years old. Zenaida is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Zenaida raises livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Zenaida has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Zenaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services so she could improve her living situation. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 19,000 PHP that she will use to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This loan will be her seventh loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template to allow their Field Partners to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mrs. San S. and her family are living in Thum village in Kandal province. She was born in 1983. She is a farming laborer and her husband, Mr. Pheap Srieng, is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. But their field is infertile and it is a long way from an irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. San S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. They have two children who are too young to work or go to school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Thol

texts.en: Mrs. Thol S. was born in 1980 and lives in Ping Pong village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sarorn Soeurn, is a motorbike taxi driver. Although they try to work hard, their income is very limited. So to improve their living conditions, they want to start new business but they do not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Thol S. is asking for a loan to buy a pond for breeding fish. This couple does not have any children. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy pond for breeding fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Koemny

texts.en: Mrs. Koemny K. and her family live in Preaek Louk village in Kandal Province. Born in 1952, she is a widowed mother of two children who are seamstresses in a garment factory.  Koemny owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates to support her family and also owns a general store in the  village. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it and so is applying for a loan to buy more groceries to resell.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: T. is a 36-year-old married woman. To earn a living, T. owns a bicycle that she uses to deliver fish paste to sell in and around her community. She has another financial earner in her husband who drives a motor taxi.  The couple now has six children. One of the children is married and lives separately, and the remaining children are single. To help be responsible for the family, one of her daughters operates a laundry service. The fish commands special price in this season. T. hopes to take this occasion to earn more profit and is asking for a loan in order to buy fresh fish and turn it into fish paste for sale.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Svay

texts.en: Svay R. is a 47-year-old resident of Kompong Tom Province. She was married, but divorced her husband when her kids were young. She has five children, four of whom live with her. The other one is now married and lives away from the family home. To help feed the family, three of her children are employed at different jobs. She grows rice and some vegetables to earn a living. Svay R. will use her loan to better supply her farm by buying more fertilizer and seeds for her growing facilities.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Sangali

texts.ru: Тохиров Сангали проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст, 69 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сын в России на заработках. Сам Сангали имеет высшее образование по специальности "Инженер". По профессии работал 5 лет. Сейчас он предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области более 30 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en:
Sangali T. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 69 years old. He is married and has five children. His wife is a homemaker. His son works in Russia. Sangali has high education and his major is an engineer. He has worked professionally for five years. Right now he works as a taxi driver and has been in this field for more than thirty years. He is asking for a loan to repair his car.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a car

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Mr. Meng P., 47, and his wife, Mrs. Chan Lach, 49, have been married since 1980 and have seven children: six sons and one daughter. Two of the children are married and live outside the family home, one is a monk, two assist their parents in the farming business and another one attends school. The family lives along National Road Number 1 about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Meng and his wife are farmers. They grow vegetables on their farmland in the village and sell their products to a middleman who comes to their home. Meng does not have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his vegetable farm. So, he is asking for his first loan of $600 to use for the purpose. 

The couple is pictured above.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy necessary ingredients

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Mrs. Saren C. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Dany Duy, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 2000 and have two sons. Both of the children are still young.  
Mrs. Saren C. has been a silk weaver since she was 16 years old, a skill she learned from her aunt. She taught her husband to become a silk weaver. They sell their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Besides weaving, Mr. Dany Duy also raises goats at home. Saren is requesting a loan of $300 to repair the house where she lives. She will also use part of the loan to purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
