BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock cassava flour and more bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni R. is currently in the business of selling used clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell. Poni is 28 years old and is married, with a husband who is a director. She has 2 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Together As One Group

texts.en:
Mariam B. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Together As One. She is 44 years old and married, with 6 children who range in age from 2 to 26 years old. Mariam could not continue her education through 3rd grade due to lack of financial support.

For 10 years, she has been selling hardware, such as nails, locks, and hinges, on a table at the Red Light market in Paynesville, Liberia. Mariam started selling with funds she borrowed from her savings club, but has now improved. She lacks shelter to do business, especially during the rainy season.

Mariam offers good service to her customers in order to keep them returning. She plans to use her 10,000-LRD portion of this 42,000-LRD group loan to purchase more hardware, such as nails, locks, and hinges. Her goal and dream is to own a building-material store in the near future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mariam is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase more goods such as nails, locks, and hinges

loans.name: Doka

texts.en:
Doka A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal, bread, and groundnut phase and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and cooking oil to sell. Doka is 40 years old and is married, with a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock tomatoes and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Mayira

texts.en:
Mayira C. is currently in the business of selling local brew at home and is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer to sell. Mayira is 35 years old and is married, with a husband that is a peasant. She has 3 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more fish, palm oil and rice

loans.name: Noomali Ene

texts.en:
Noomali Ene L. is 28 years old, married to Moripet Olorgiso, and a mother of four school-going children. She has been in the family farming business for the last ten years.
Noomali learned about Kiva partner, KADET, from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her first loan, and she is planning to buy chemicals to spray wheat and also fertilizer. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.
Noomali’s dream is to be engaged in large-scale farming and attain financial independence. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To buy chemicals to spray wheat and also fertilizer

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a young Palestinian man from Rafah city in Gaza Strip. Imad is 23 years old and owns a small grocery store in front of one of the city schools. Most of the school students are his customers, as Imad sells sweets, ice cream, and chips, in addition to products such as rice, bread, and cooking oil to the families of the area.

Imad's grocery store has a strong clientele, and since the demand for a wider variety of goods has been increasing, Imad came to FATEN to take a $1500 loan. He plans to purchase more and varied goods to respond to the demand and increase his sales.

Imad stands in his store in the photo above.

loans.use: Purchase a wider variety of goods for general store

loans.name: Help Yourself Group

texts.en:
James G. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Help Yourself. He is 44 years old, married, and has six children who range from one to fifteen years old. James could not continue his education through 11th grade due to lack of financial support.

For the past five years, James has been running a vegetable farm at the White Plain settlement, Liberia. He started his farm through the help of an international NGO in Liberia, but he faces problems with a shortage in tools to do his work. He grows good crops and sells them at an affordable price in order to keep customers returning. 
James plan to use his 10,000 LRD portion of this 35,000 LRD group loan to purchase more seeds for the next farming season. His goal and dream is to have more farms and improve the lives of his family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, James is holding the sign. And Hawa is inset at the lower right because she was absent during interview.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds for the next farming season

loans.name: God Will Provide Group

texts.en:
Catherine B. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called God Will Provide. She is 30 years old and married, with 3 children who range in age from 4 to 12 years old.  She also cares for 3 siblings.  In her youth, Catherine was not able to continue her education past first grade.  She is now attending an adult literacy program in order to improve her education.

Catherine has been selling fish at the Red Light market in Paynesville, Liberia, for 6 years.  She started with 300 Liberian Dollars in working capital but has been able to improve her profits by purchasing fish cartons.  To keep customers returning, she sells them large fish. 

Catherine plans to use her 9,000 Liberian Dollar-portion of this group loan to purchase more fish to improve her business. Her goal and dream is to expand her business to all parts of Liberia.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Catherine is holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase more fish

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel S. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Trust. He is 26 years old, single, and has one child who is ten years old. He is a college student.

For four years, he has been selling phone cards in the S.K.D. community on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. He sells in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning. 
 
He plans to use his 8,000 Liberian Dollar-portion of this group loan to buy more phone cards.  His goal is to grow his business and to continue to support his child so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Emmanuel is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more phone cards.

loans.name: Buzaniro Women's Group A, Kihihi

texts.en:
There is a fascinating story behind determined M. Alfred who was not afraid of diversity when he ventured into the business world ten years ago. This hardworking, married father of four children began his produce shop, dealing in general food crops like beans, maize flour, groundnuts (peanuts), peas and many other items in Kibaya, Kihihi.

Through acquiring loans from micro-finance institutions, Alfred was able to start up this side business alongside his agriculture to help him bring more income into the family. With this loan Alfred will be able to purchase more stock and be able to improve his earnings as he looks forward to live a self-sustaining life.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 46 años, es separada y de cuya relación tiene 4 hijos, con los que vive en casa de su familia. La venta de carne de pollo y gallina, es el negocio al que se dedica todos los días, en un puesto ubicado dentro del mercado de su distrito. Su trabajo empieza desde las 8 de la mañana, ya que a esa hora es cuando mas circula la gente para comprar lo productos básico para la cocina; hasta el medio día, que es cuado puede un respiro para descansar. Su esposo la ayuda en este trabajo y juntos sacan adelante su negocio, resultándole muy rentable, puesto que logra vender toda la mercadería que tienen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que se relaciona con mucha gente; por ello ya lleva 8 años en esta actividad. En adelante desea cambiarse de puesto, debido a la dificultad de no contar continuamente de agua potable. Este es su décimo crédito con Francisca y sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y está dispuesta hacerlo. En su grupo comunal es la socia mas alegre de todas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más javas con pollos, para atender la demanda del resto de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Francisco is 46 years old, is separated and has four children, from that relationship, with whom she lives in her family's house. Selling chicken and hen meat is the business that she is dedicated to everyday in a stall located inside her district's market. Her work begins at 8 in the morning since this hour is when people are circulating most to buy basic products for cooking. She works until noon when she can take a break to rest. Her husband helps her in this work and together they move their business forward, making it very profitable since they sell all the merchandise they have. What she likes most about her job is that she can meet lots of people. She has eight years experience with this work. In the future, she'd like to change her stall, due to the lack of continuous access to potable water. This is her tenth loan with Francisca and she knows that she has to repay punctually and is committed to doing so. In her community bank, she is the happiest member of all. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy more crates of chickens to meet the demand of the rest of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more crates of chicken.

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es: Cinthia, de 29 años, es una mujer ambiciosa, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos pequeños en una casa alquilada. Hace más de 3 años se dedica a la compra y venta de productos comestibles, mientras que su esposo lo realiza en otro lugar. Para ella es muy importante al momento de adquirir su mercadería, siempre toma en cuenta la fecha de vencimiento de cada producto, de esa manera se gana la confianza de sus clientes. Este negocio le es muy rentable, debido a que se encuentra en lugar estratégico, donde hay mucha circulación de gente. Por ello, trabaja desde las 8 de las mañana hasta las 1 de la tarde. Su mayor anhelo es aumentar su capital de trabajo, para que pueda abastecer su negocio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además agradece a sus compañeras de su grupo que admitieron su ingreso, ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Cinthia tiene planeado invertir el crédito, en la compra de productos de primera necesidad, de esa manera podrá aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Cinthia, who is 29, is an ambitious woman. She lives alongside her husband and their two small children in a rented house. For more than three years, she has been dedicated to the buying and selling of consumable products while her husband does the same thing in another place. For her, it is very important at the moment of acquiring her merchandise always to account the expiration date of each product and, in this way, gain the trust of her customers. This business is very profitable since it is located in a strategic place where many people circulate. For this, she works from 8 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon. He greatest goal is to expand her working capital so she can supply her business. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. She is thankful to her colleagues from her group who allowed her to join since it will be very useful for the progress of her business. Cinthia plans to invest the loan in the purchase of basic necessity products so she will be able to expand her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more basic necessity products.

loans.name: Christian Empowerment Group

texts.en:
Onesimus G. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Christian Empowerment. He is 41 years old and married, with 5 children who range from 1 to 18 years old. Onesimus is a high school graduate but could not afford to continue his education to college.

For 5 years, Onesimus has been selling stationery such as books and papers at Broad Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He started by selling for other business people but then decided to open his own business. He sells quality goods and interacts with his customers during the transaction in order to keep them returning.

Onesimus plans to use his 6,000 Liberian-Dollar portion of the group loan to purchase more stationery such as books and papers. His goals are to improve his business to a higher level and to go back to school.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Onesimus is holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase more stationery

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es:
Ermelinda de 67 años de edad es casada con el Sr. Adolfo Urbina, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 4 ya estan casados y tienen su propia familia y los 2 menores que viven con ella.  

Trabaja por cuenta propia como comerciante de productos lacteos, en donde percibe ingresos que le permiten cumplir con el pago de los compromisos crediticios adquiridos, ademas cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos mayores.  

Esta solicitando su 5to credito con el proposito de mejorar su casa, reparando el techo que se encuentra en mal estado y con las lluvias se moja una parte de la casa.  El mayor sueño que tiene es poder una vivienda con las condiciones basicas para su familia.
texts.en:
Ermelinda is 67 years old and is married to Adolfo Urbina. She has six children of whom four are married and have their own families and the two youngest live with her. She works on her own selling dairy products where the income allows her to meet the payments of her loan committments. Additionally, she has the support of her two eldest children. She is requesting her fifth loan with the purpose of improving her home, repairing the roof which is in a bad state and causes a part of her house to get wet with the rains. Her greatest dream is to have a house with basic conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repair.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed M. is a businessman as well as a worker who has seven years of business experience. He lives at 52 Ngalu Road, Bo, and sells at home.

He is married with three children who are all schooling. He works in close partnership with his wife to bring up the children well. The wife does the selling in the daytime while her husband is at work.

He is applying for a loan in order to increase his stock level. He intends to use the proceeds from the loan to complete his house.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of cement for construction

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El señor Víctor Sanjinez vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y su hijo.
El señor Víctor hace contratos de entradas para un club de fútbol de esta ciudad con empresas de Imprenta, y por dicha actividad recibe comisión; también realiza tramites varios para personas particulares; estas dos actividades le generan ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un Baño en su vivienda para el mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Victor Sanjinez lives in his own house in the Villa Nuevo Potosi area, on the west side of the city of La Paz, with his wife and their son. Victor makes contracts for tickets for a football club in this city with printing companies, and for this work, he receives a commission. He also performs various tasks for particular people. These two activities generate the income to support his family. The loan that he is requesting is to build a bathroom in his house so he can improve the quality of life for his family. This is the first occasion that he has requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis completed qualified him favorably for access to credit.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a bathroom in his house.

loans.name: Garubunda, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
He has a big dream of owning a big farm in his home area in Nyabicence, Rukungiri. On the face of it now, B. Eldard is in far-cry narrow circumstances that may make him seem like a wishful thinker. This means he faces long odds in achieving that mission.

Eldard, however, has at length built a strong attribute of determination that has played into his hands. With strong hardworking skills up his sleeve, he has gotten a dependable niche for his banana-selling business. It is one Eldard has banked on for the last ten years.

Eldard’s family of ten children has also enjoyed the good graces that have come with his doing that business. Monthly profits to the tune of 200,000 Ugandan shillings is what he has been getting since the beginning. With this loan he hopes to purchase mulches and fertilizer to help improve his plantation.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and mulches for his plantation

loans.name: Jimena

texts.es:
La señora Jimena M. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Villa Avaroa de la ciudad de El Alto con su hijo.
La señora Jimena trabaja como promotora en una empresa de venta de productos nutricionales, ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción y acabado de su cocina, más el pintado del mismo.
Esta es la quinta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Jimena M. lives with her son in her parents’ house in the Villa Avaroa area of the city of El Alto. Jimena works as a promoter for a company that sells nutritional products. The income supports her family. The requested loan is for building and finishing her kitchen. It is also to paint the kitchen. This is the fifth time she has requested a loan. The completed socioeconomic evaluation qualifies her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of finishing the kitchen in her house and to paint the kitchen

loans.name: Paloma Blanca Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Paloma Blanca. Está ubicado en la comunidad de Toluca en el Estado  de México.  El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes.
Guadalupe C. B.  es la presidenta  del grupo. Tiene 48 años, estudió hasta el 6° año de primaria,  es comerciante y tiene en total 7 hijos 3 mujeres y 4 varones.  Ella se dedica a las ventas por catalogo que inició hace 15  años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en blancos, tupperware y zapatos andrea: Sus clientes son vecinas empleadas de diferentes lados pues ella se dedica a mostrar sus catálogos cerca de las comunidades y colonias de Toluca además de realizar tandas para que sus clientes puedan adquirir sus productos mas cerca.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta pues ya tiene algunos pedidos.   También espera poder comprar un terreno junto con su esposo para poder ayudar a sus hijos casados.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
CLAUDIA ALEJANDRA JIMENES M.     VENTA DE  ROPA
ANA LIDIA F. B.             VENTA DE ZAPATO POR CATALOGO
OLIVIA B. M.               VENTA DE MEDICINA NATURISTA
ADELAIDA R. C.           VENTA DE EXTINGUIDORES
BRISA NAYELI G. V.         VENTA DE RECAUDERIA
PATRICIA G. G.              VENTA DE DULCES Y TUPPERWARE
AGUSTINA S. B.             VENTA DE PLASTICOS
GABRIELA V. S.           VENTA DE HERBALIFE Y ROPA
MARIA DE JESUS S. B.        VENTA DE PAPELERIA
texts.en:
This group is named Paloma Blanca (white dove). It is located in the community of Toluca in the state of Mexico. The group is made up of 10 members. Guadalupe C. B. is the president of the group. She is 48, studied up to the sixth year of primary school, is a merchant and has a total of seven children: three girls and four boys. She is dedicated to selling by catalog which she started 15 years ago. She is requesting a loan to invest in tupperware and Andrea brand shoes. Her customers are her neighbors, employed in different areas so she is dedicated to showing catalogs close to the communities and colonies of Toluca in addition to making rounds so her customers can acquire her products close by. At the time of requesting this loan, she feels happy since she already has some orders. Also, she hopes to be able to buy some land with her husband to they can help their married children. The other members of the group are: CLAUDIA ALEJANDRA JIMENES M. SELLING CLOTHING ANA LIDIA F. B. SELLING CATALOG SHOES OLIVIA B. M. SELLING NATURAL MEDICINES ADELAIDA R. C. SELLING EXTINGUISHERS BRISA NAYELI G. V. SELLING PRODUCE PATRICIA G. G. SELLING SWEETS AND TUPPERWARE AGUSTINA S. B. SELLING PLASTICS GABRIELA V. S. SELLING HERBALIFE AND CLOTHING MARIA DE JESUS S. B. SELLING PAPER

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in tupperware and Andrea brand shoes.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo tiene un taller donde elabora cotillones a pedido, para fiestas infantiles, matrimonios, y prestes.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Alto San Pedro  de la ciudad de La Paz en casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de cartulina, papel, carpicola y otros).
Es la Décima quinta que solicita un crédito en Impro,  demostrando responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Arturo has a shop where he makes decorations for reception halls for children’s parties, weddings, and “prestes” (popular social functions). His house, which is his own, is located in the Alto San Pedro region of the city of La Paz. The loan is for working capital (to buy cardboard, paper, glue, and other items). This is the 15th loan he has requested. He demonstrates responsibility making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy paper, glue, cardboard, and other supplies for his business of making decorations for reception halls

loans.name: Alma Ligia

texts.es:
La señora Alma Ligia E., es una mujer que lucha día a día junto a su familia para lograr salir hacia adelante, ella habita en la zona rural del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , doña Ligia desde hace mas de cinco años se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda y nueva, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es no contar con el capital suficiente para incrementar su inventario y darle mejor servicio a sus clientes,  además en un futuro quiere mejor las condiciones del mismo negocio ya que por  ahora tiene la pequeña tienda, en la sala de su hogar la cual le quita privacidad hacia su hogar.

El sueño más grande de la señora Ligia es poder  construir su vivienda de la ganancia que vaya adquiriendo con  sus ventas, a la vez agradece a Afodenic que a través de los fondos KIVA  le están dando la oportunidad y confianza de trabajar con un préstamo de C$ 5,000.00 córdobas los cuales lo va a utilizar en la compra de ropa.
texts.en:
Alma Ligia E. is a woman, who together with her family, fights day to day to be able to get ahead. She lives with her husband in the rural area of the Ticuantepe municipality. He helps with the household expenses. For over five years Ligia has been selling new and used clothes. The biggest difficulty she has is not having sufficient capital to increase her inventory and give her customers better service. Also, in the future she wants to improve the condition of her business. The store is small, and it is in the living room of her home. This takes away the privacy in her home. Ligia’s biggest dream is to be able to build her house from the earnings she is getting from her sales. She is grateful to Afodenic, who through funds from Kiva, is giving her the opportunity and the trust to work with a loan for 5,000 córdobas. She will use the money to buy clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater variety of clothes to later sell

loans.name: Cruz Maria

texts.es:
Cruz Alcívar de 33 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamada así porque hace años abundaban las flores orquídeas, y ahora han hecho un parque forestal) en Guayaquil. Su esposo es mecánico, y ellos tienen tres hijos de 18, 13 y 8 años de edad. 

Cruz por la falta de oportunidades y la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio decidió invertir todos sus ahorros en cuadernos y plumas para venderlos a sus vecinos y amigos. Poco a poco fue incrementando su capital y readecuo la parte delantera de su casa para construir un local.

Por esa buena decisión ahora tiene una papelería en  su casa, trabaja todos los días desde las 07h30 am hasta las 20h00 pm, vende los cuadernos a $ 0.60, las plumas a $ 0.15 etc. El dinero lo quiere invertir en cuadernos, plumas y papelería para tener mas ingresos. 

En el futuro quiere tener otras papelerías y que sus hijos puedan terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Cruz Alcívar, age 33, lives in an urban area in Las Orquídeas (it got its name from the abundant orchids that have been there for years; they have now made it into a botanical garden) in Guayaquil. Her husband is a mechanic, and they have three children. The children are 18, 13, and 8 years old. Cruz did not have opportunities, and she had the desperate idea to have her own business. That is why she decided to invest all of her savings in notebooks and pens to sell to her neighbors and friends. Little by little her capital was increasing. She fixed the front part of her house in order to build a place for her business. Because of this good decision, she now has a stationery store in her house. She works everyday from 7:30 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. She sells notebooks for $0.60 and pens for $0.15, etc. She wants to use the money to invest in notebooks, pens, and stationery in order to have more income. In the future she wants to have other stationery stores, and she wants her children to be able to finish their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks and pens

loans.name: Esteban Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Esteban Ramón M. R., es casado y con sus 4 hijos habita en el Barrio Medardo Andino, una  de sus hijas es mayor de edad y sobrevive de manera independiente, el señor M. labora como guarda de seguridad, desde hace 16 años.

Uno de los principales proyectos de la familia, está la culminación de la infraestructura del hogar, debido a que actualmente se convive en un solo cuarto con todos los hijos, es por esta razón que solicita de un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, que le permitan realizar divisiones que aporten a la independencia de los miembros de la familia y al buen convivir de los pequeños, debido a que en su crecimiento, van demandando mejores condiciones de habitad.
texts.en:
Esteban Ramón M. R. is married and lives with his 4 children in the Medardo Andino neighborhood. One of his daughters is an adult and supports herself. Señor M. has worked as a security guard for 16 years. One of the main projects of his family is to complete the infrastructure of their home. Currently they live in only one room with all of their children. For this reason they request a loan to buy construction materials that would allow them to create dividing walls that would provide independence for the members of the family and good living conditions for the children, because as they are growing they need better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Pedro Ismael

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Ismael V. R., es casado y habita con su señora esposa en el Barrio de las Enramadas, su esposa se dedica  realizar las tareas del hogar, pero apoya en los trabajos de la finca, ellos son agricultores de piña, tienen 5 hijos, todos ellos están casados y apoyan también a su padre en las tareas diarias  y en los gastos del hogar.

Uno de los principales proyectos que tiene el señor Pedro, es la compra de unas vacas para ir ingresando a la actividad ganadera, actualmente él cultiva cítricos y guayabas, tiene una experiencia de más de 32 años de explotar el suelo, pero uno de los problemas que más le han ocasionado pérdidas, es el robo de la producción que ha afectado su bolsillo, ha futuro desea diversificar sus cultivos en la siembra de piña, fruta que se consume en masa en toda la región de Nicaragua, ahora el solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas,  tales como fertilizantes, insumos vegetativos, para brindar un mantenimiento al cultivo de limón con el fin de acondicionar agronómicamente a las cosechas. Ha futuro esto les permitirá un mejor producción y la rproduccion de las cosechas, recuperando lo invertido y permitiéndoles mejores condiciones económicas que beneficien a toda la familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is married and lives with his wife in Barrio de las Enramadas. His wife carries out the housework but also supports her husband in his farm work - they are pineapple farmers. They have five children, all of whom are married and also help their father with the daily tasks and the household expenses. One of Pedro's main projects is to buy some cows as a starting point for getting into livestock farming. He currently grows citrus and guava, and has more than 32 years experience in getting harvests from the soil. One of the problems that has most often caused him loses and left him short of money is theft of his produce. For the future, he wants to diversify his crops by planting pineapple, a crop that is consumed in large quantities throughout Nicaragua. He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural materials such as fertilizer and seedlings in order to have a good lemon harvest. For the future, this will enable him to have better harvests, recoup the loan money that he spends, and will improve the economic condition of his entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Diana Del Rosario

texts.es:
Diana de 28 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Es madre soltera con un niño de dos años. 

Después que el esposo la abandono ella se quedo sin el principal ingreso en su casa ya estando con un hijo ella tuvo que ingeniar una forma de tener dinero para su hijo. Pero a
 todos los lugares que buscaba trabajo se le cerraban las puertas por su falta de estudios que tenia. Con la desesperante idea de tener dinero tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en ropa para venderle a los amigos.

Poco a poco ella empezó a tener ingresos y comenzó a comprar perfumes y cremas de una compañía llamada Yanbal (es una empresa que le da una oportunidad a las mujeres para que vendan domésticos y ganen un porcentaje de las ventas). Ahora esa es la principal actividad que le genera dinero vende perfumes, cremas, ropa etc.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cremas y perfumes para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un local para vender los productos.
texts.en:
Diana, 28, lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement, and only has the basic service of electricity. She is a single mother with a 2 year-old son. After her husband abandoned her, she was left without a main income in her household. Since she already had a son, she had to come up with a way of earning money for him. However, every place that she looked for work closed the door on her due to her lack of education. Desperate to earn money, she had to invest her savings in clothing to sell to her friends. Gradually she started to have income, and began to buy perfumes and creams from a company called Yanbal (this is a company that gives opportunities to women to sell from their homes and keep a percentage of the sales). Now her main economic activity is selling perfumes, creams, clothing, etc. With the loan she will buy creams and perfumes for her business. In the future, she wants to have a place where she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy perfumes and creams

loans.name: Union Warisata Group

texts.es:
Hugo M. de 25 años es transportista y es vecino de la zona Huayna Potosí, necesita el préstamo para hacer reparar su movilidad ya que es su instrumento de trabajo. Las demás integrantes de la Asociación Comunal Unión Warisatas, que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal German Busch,  cuentan con diversos negocios tales como: venta de tubos, celulares, ropa, atención de tienda de barrio, venta de comida y CDS. Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios y mejorar los mismos.

A la cabeza de su mesa directiva se organizan para llevar adelante su reunión y ponerse de acuerdo en el reglamento interno.
texts.en:
25-year-old Hugo M. is a shipper, near the community of Huayna Potosí. He needs a loan to repair his vehicle because it is for his livelihood. He works with the other members of the Warisitas Union Community Association, which is part of the German Busch Center. The Center is involved with many business such as the sale of pipes, cell phones, clothes, things for the needs of the neighborhood, food, and CDs. They all need the loan to invest in their businesses and improve them. At the head of the directing board, they organize to advance their meetings and agree on operating procedures.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Asset repair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase pigs

loans.name: 11 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
“11 de Octubre”  es un grupo de 11 señoras que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Villa Adela”,  se agruparon hace poco por  la necesidad de acceder al préstamo ya que todas necesitan incrementar su capital de trabajo. Todas tienen diversos negocios como la venta de comida, carne de pollo, perfumes, libros, elaboración de pan, elaboración de pasteles, trensado de manta y repostería.
Una integrante es Claudia J. de 43 años, ella vende condimentos  hace 7 años en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, ofreciendo sus productos persona a persona (ambulante) y necesita el préstamo para comprar mayor mercadería.
 
Liderizadas por la mesa directiva todas  se organizan para llevar adelante su reunión y ponerse de acuerdo en el reglamento interno, ya que les permitirá un desembolvimiento adecuado en cada una de las reuniones de pago y capacitación.
texts.en:
October 11 is a group of 11 women who attend the meeting in the Villa Adela Center. They have been getting together recently to access the loan that they all need to increase their working capital. They all have various businesses such as selling food, chicken meat, perfume, books, bread, desserts, cotton braids and confections. One of the members is 43-year-old Claudia J.. He has been selling seasonings in different markets of the city of El Alto, offering his products as a street vendor and needs the loan to purchase better merchandise. Led by the board, they organize during their meetings and agree on the rules of procedure, which enables them to come to agreement in each one of the meetings regarding training and payment.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: EL SEÑOR LUIS TIENE LA ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL LA DE  TRANSPORTISTA Y COMO SEGUNDA ACTIVIDAD LA VENTA DE ZAPATILLAS EN LA CALLE TUMUSLA ESTA ES UNA DE LAS CALLES MAS COMERCIALES DE LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ, QUIEN HA DIVERSIFICADO SU ACTIVIDAD  CON OTROS RUBROS Y DESEA SEGUIR TRABAJANDO CON LA INSTITUCION, EL ES CLIENTE ANTIGUO ESTE SERIA SU QUINTO CREDITO CON NOSOTROS, DICHO CLIENTE TRABAJA CON MUCHA PUNTUALIDAD Y ESMERO CON SUS CUOTAS, DESEA AYUDAR A SU FAMILIA Y SUS HIJOS PARA QUE SEAN MEJORES ESTUDIANTES Y QUE NO SUFRA COMO ELLOS, SIEMPRE COLABORANDO CON SU FAMILIA, SU ESPOSA LE AYUDA EN LA VENTA DE ZAPATILLAS CUANDO EL SALE A TRABAJAR CON SU MOVILIDAD.  EL INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE LLANTAS Y AUMENTARA SU CAPITAL COMPRANDO MERCADERIA EN LO QUE ES LAS ZAPATILLAS PARA NIÑAS. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Luis's main job is as a courier. He also sells shoes in Tumusla Street, one of the main commercial streets in the city of La Paz, and he has diversified into other areas. He would like to continue working with this field partner: he is a good customer and this will be his fifth loan with them. He is always on time and keeps careful track of his installments. He wishes to help his family, especially his children so that they can be good students and have a better life. The family always sticks together, and his wife helps out selling shoes when Luis is out working as a courier. He plans to invest the loan in buying tires for his car and adding to his stock of children's shoes. He is very grateful to the field partner Emprender, and to Kiva, for the confidence they have shown by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying stock to sell

loans.name: Placida

texts.es:
La Sra. Placida, vive en casa propia en la zona de Achachicala, tiene 54 años de edad y se encuentra casada con el Sr. Oscar  que tiene como actividad la de Gráfico y tienen solo un hijo que aun depende economicamente de ellos ya que se encuentra en edad escolar, son una familia muy unida.

Doña Placida tiene como actividad la venta de lenceria, mismo que lo realiza en su puesto ubicado en la avenida Buenos Aires, esta calle es comercial ya que muchos comerciants tienen su puesto de venta y es un lugar muy conocido por los Paceños. El crédito solicitado es para compra de mercaderia (fajas reductoras Silwet) por caja, es una persona trabajadora esta muy agradecida con Emprender y KIva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Placida owns the house she lives in, in the Achachicala area; she is 54 years old and is married to Oscar, who works as a graphic designer, and they have one child of school age who still depends on them economically, since he is in elementary school. They are a very close-knit family. Placida works in the clothing business: she sells lingerie from her stall, located in the Avenida Buenos Aires, a renown business street for the Paceños (inhabitants of La Paz), as many retailers have their stalls there. The loan requested will be used to buy boxes of slimming Silwet brand girdles. She is a very hard-working woman, and she is very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de Mercaderia

loans.name: Margaritas Group

texts.es:
“Margaritas”  es un grupo de 7 señoras y 1 varón que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Alto Lima”,  este es su primer préstamo y están entusiasmadas en hacer crecer sus negocios, se agruparon hace poco por  la necesidad de acceder al préstamo ya que todas necesitan incrementar su capital de trabajo. Todas tienen diversos negocios como la atención de tienda de barrio, confección de monederos, venta de chamarras, atención de llamadas, venta de CDS y carpintería.
Un ejemplo claro es Cristina Limachi, una joven de 18 años que se dedica a vender comida y necesita el préstamo para adquirir alimento seco.
texts.en:
The “Margaritas” (Daisies) Group consists of seven women and one man who attend their meetings at the Alto Lima Community Center. This is their first loan and they are excited about expanding their businesses. They gathered recently to access this needed loan to increase their operating capital. All of the members have different businesses which include managing a neighborhood grocery store, manufacturing purses, selling jackets, operating a call center, selling CDs, and providing carpentry services.

One example is Cristina Limachi, a young woman who is 18 years of age and earns a living selling food. She needs a loan to acquire dried foods.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dried foods

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin A. A. es un señor de 55 años el cual vive con su esposa y uno de sus dos  hijos en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros  sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos.



Don Edwin tiene ya 2 años de dedicarse a la cría de cerdos  para engorde. Pero ha decidido seguir el negocio de los cerdos pero esta vez para la cría, con el fin de crear una porqueriza y enfocarse en la producción de Cerdos. Asegura que es una buena idea ya que en este momento el cerdo tiene un  buen precio.

Es por eso que Don Edwin necesita un micro crédito por un monto de ¢250000 (Doscientos cincuenta mil colones) para la compra de cerdas para la cría.  Con la que podrá iniciar su porqueriza y además una muy buena fuente de ingresos que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.


Don Edwin  forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  su primer préstamo y asegura que será de mucho beneficio para su negocio, y espera seguir participando más activamente con la empresa de crédito Comunal.
texts.en:
Edwin A. A. is a 55 year old gentleman who lives with his wife and one of his two children in the rural Costa Rican community of Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones is located 150km south of San José Province, where the Costa Rican capital is located. The community lies 850 meters above sea level. Among the business activities that take place in the area are growing vegetables and coffee, breeding cattle, and fattening pigs.

Don Edwin has two years of experiencing raising and fattening pigs. However, he has decided to continue his business and focus on breeding them. In order to direct his efforts toward producing more pigs, he needs to build a pigsty. He believes this is a good idea because pigs are selling at a good price right now.

For this reason, Don Edwin is requesting a micro-loan in the amount of 250,000 CRC to purchase pigs for breeding. He will be able to build a pigsty and establish a good source of income that will help improve his quality of life.

Don Edwin is part of the Communal Credit Enterprise of Bancruce, one of 100 member organizations that belong to EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he assures everyone that it will be of great benefit to his business. He hopes to continue being an active participant in his local credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs for breeding

loans.name: Formando Un Futuro Group

texts.es:
ALCOM “FORMANDO UN FUTURO”

Formando un Futuro es un grupo que vive en San Juan D. Lurigancho conformado por 10 personas que han sobresalido D. problemas familiares y sociales.
L. señora Hilaria  tiene 55 años D. edad, y es madre D. 2 hijas independientes, es decir cada una tiene su propia familia.
En L. actualidad Hilaria tiene un kiosco con permiso D. L. municipalidad donD. venD. golosinas, dulces, bebidas, etc., también tiene un carrito D. helados Donofrio, y un locutorio ambulante, donD. las personas pueden hacer llamadas telefónicas.
ElL. planea tener una pequeña bodega en su propia casa donD. venderá productos alimenticios y D. limpieza, a partir D. préstamos anteriores ha podido mantener su kiosco lleno para satisfacer a todos sus clientes, también ha estado ahorrando una cantidad D. dinero el cual espera que crezca mas y mas, hasta tener lo suficiente para comprar lo que necesita para su bodega, como repisas, estantes, etc.
El préstamo actual lo utilizará para capital D. trabajo.
texts.en:
“FORMANDO UN FUTURO” (Forging a Future) Communal Bank Forging a Future has 10 members who live in San Juan D. Lurigancho and who have managed to overcome family and social problems. Hilaria, 55, has two independent daughters; that is to say, each has her own family. Hilaria has a kiosk for which she has a municipal permit to operate. She sells snacks, candy, beverages, etc. She also has a Donofrio brand frozen treats cart and a portable telephone booth that people can make phone calls from. She plans to have a small store in her home to sell food and home cleaning items. Her previous loans have maD. it possible for her to stock her kiosk with all the items her customers want. She has also been saving money and she hopes her savings will grow more and more until she has enough to buy everything she needs to set up her store like shelving, display cases, etc. She will use this loan for working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For foodstuffs, soft-drinks, candy, frozen treats, etc.

loans.name: Ofelia Samuel

texts.pt:
Ofélia Samuel G. nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Província do Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 44 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 9 filhos de idades compreendidas entre 25 a 6 anos de idade, os 5 últimos vão a escola. Fez somente 6ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Manjacaze para Maputo no Distrito de Boane com seus pais quando tinha somente 2 anos de idade. Trabalha numa empresa de produção e venda de Banana (BANANALANDIA) e tem um negócio próprio que desenvolve depois de sair do seu trabalho. Não possui nenhum empregado consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.600,00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum mensalmente através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas de serviço que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar mercadoria (capulanas, panelas, chaleiras e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 3.000.00mt, 6.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt para o comércio e habitação.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua casa e desenvolver ainda mais o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Ofélia Samuel was born in the district of Manjacaze, in the Maputo Province, South of Mozambique. She is 44 years old, a widow and the mother of 9 children between 25 and 6 years old. The five youngest children go to school. She only completed 6th grade and didn't finish school due to her parents' lack of financial resources. She lives in her own house with her children and doesn't support anyone else. She left Manjacaze to the Boane district in Maputo with her parents when she was only 2 years old. She works in a banana growing and selling plant (Bananalandia) and has had her own business after work. She doesn't have any employees and has an income of around 4.600.00m per month, which goes to household expenses and she manages to save some money in a traditional rotational savings system (Xitique). She has never had loans with other banks. She came to know Hluvuku through work colleagues who are also partners of the same institution. This loan, in the amount of 15.000.00mt is her fourth. She intends to buy merchandise ("capulanas"- traditional garments from Mozambique, pots, kettles and others) to increase her inventory. The previous loans were for 3.000.00mt, 6.000.00mt and 10.000.00mt for trade and housing. She commits to paying this loan on time in order to be able to be granted other loans. In the future, she would like to request more loans to finish her house and to further improve her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (capulanas - traditional garments from Mozambique, pots, kettles and others)

loans.name: Chaskañawi Group

texts.es:
ESTA BANCA DE EMPRENDIMIENTO ESTA COMPUESTA POR 10 INTEGRANTES 9 MUJERES Y 1 VARON, EL NOMBRE DEL BANCO SIGNIFICA PESTAÑAS REVUELTAS O LINDOS OJOS,  FUE FORMADA POR  LA SEÑORAS ELIZABET (PRESIDENTA) JANETH (ES LA SECRETARIA DE ACTAS) QUIENES LOGRARON REUNIR A 10 CLIENTES CONFIABLES, TRABAJADORAS Y RESPONSABLES TODAS CON ACTIVIDAD EN EL ALTO.

LA SRA. ELIZABETH SU PRESIDENTA REALIZA VENTA DE CELULARES Y CD's, VIVE EN LA ZONA DE ALTO LIMA EN ALQUILER, SU ESPOSO ES VIAJERO CON LA MISMA ACTIVIDAD Y SU MAYOR SUEÑO ES TENER SU CASA PROPIA POR LO QUE LES INTERESO MUCHO EL AHORRO QUE SE LES OFRECE TRABAJAN CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD YA VARIOS AÑOS ES UNA PERSONA MUY TRABAJADORA Y SIEMPRE VELANDO POR EL BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA CELULARES POR CANTIDAD ULTIMOS MODELOS Y ASI PODER INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE TRABAJO.

LA SECRETARIA DE ACTAS, LA SRA. JANETH REALIZA EL COMERCIO DE ROPA INTERIOR, ES SOLTERA Y AÚN ASI ES EL SUSTENTO DE SU FAMILIA YA QUE COLABORA A SU MAMÁ Y HERNANA MENOR CON LOS GASTOS DE LA CASA, A PARTE DE TENER SU NEGOCIO, TAMBIEN ESTUDIA Y SE ESFUERZA, EL MAYOR ANHELO QUE TIENE ES ENTRAR A LA UNIVERSIDAD Y LOGRAR SER PROFESIONAL, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA POR DOCENAS PARA DE ESTA MANERA INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE TRABAJO.

ESTE GRUPO ES MUY UNIDO, SE APOYAN ENTRE SI LA SRA. CAROLINA ES LA TESORERA VENDE ANTICUCHOS ESTOS SON TROZOS DEL CORAZON DE LA VACA COCIDOS AL CARBON, VAN ACOMPAÑADOS DE PAPAS BLANCAS Y UN AJI DE MANI MUY PICOSO, ESTE NEGOCIO LE PERMITE AYUDAR ECONOMICAMENTE EN SU HOGAR, A SU ESPOSO QUE ES  PLOMERO Y NO GANA MUCHO, TIENEN UNA NIÑA ADOLESCENTE A LA QUE QUISIERAN VER PROFESIONAL CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA INSUMOS PARA LA ELABORACION DE SUS RIQUISIMOS ANTICUCHOS.
texts.en:
This communal bank has 10 members: 9 women and one man. The bank’s name means “Tangled Eye Lashes” or “Beautiful Eyes.” It was formed by Elizabeth (president), Janeth (recording secretary) who managed to gather 10 trustworthy, hard-working, responsible people from El Alto to join. Elizabeth, group president, cells CDs and cell phones. She rents her house in the Alto Lima neighborhood. Her husband is a traveling salesman of the same items. Her greatest wish is to have her own house so she is very interested in the savings that working with this activity makes possible. She has collaborated with us for several years now. She is a very hard-working person who is always watching after her family’s wellbeing. She will use the funds to buy large amounts of the latest models of cell phones so that she can thus increase her working capital. Janeth, recording secretary, is an underwear merchant. Although she’s single, she’s her family’s sole source of support because she helps her mother and younger sister with the household expenses. Besides her business, she’s also studying and trying very hard. Her greatest wish is to get into the university and become a professional. She will use the funds to buy merchandise by the dozen so that she can thus increase her working capital. This is a very unified group; they support each other. Carolina is treasurer and she sells anticuchos (skewered grilled beef heart served with potatoes and spicy chili peanut sauce). This activity makes it possible for her to help support the family because her husband, who is a plumber, doesn’t earn very much. They have an adolescent daughter that they’d like to see become a professional. She will use the funds to buy ingredients for her delicious anticuchos.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in working capital.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.pt:
Bernardo R. nasceu no Distrito de Massinga, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique tem 47 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos de 22, 20, 15, 13 e 09 anos, todos vão a escola excepto o mais velho. Fez somente 4a classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e para além dos filhos sustenta sua nora que vive com ele. 
Sai de Massinga para Maputo em missão de serviço em 1982, mais tarde passou para Boane onde formou seu lar. Trabalha como segurança na empresa Banalandia desde o ano de 2008, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 1.800.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta bancária. 
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas em conversa que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é seu 2° empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção (portas, barrotes, cimento, pedra e outros) para concluir a construção da sua residência. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 7.000.00mt, para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para mobilar a casa.
texts.en:
Bernardo R. was born in the Massinga District, Inhambane Province, in southern Mozambique. He is 47 years old, married, and the father of 5 children ages 22, 20, 15, 13, and 9. All attend school except for the eldest. He only completed school through the fourth grade, due to a lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his family, and in addition to his children he supports his daughter-in-law who lives with him. He left Massinga for Maputo to look for work in 1982, later he moved to Boane where he made his home. He has worked as a security guard for the company Banalandia since 2008. He does not have any employees and has a salary of 1.800.00mt per month, which he uses for household expenses and occasionally saves a bit in his bank account. He has never had a loan with other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through word of mouth from friends who are also customers. This is his second loan, in the amount of 10.000.00mt which he will use to purchase construction materials (doors, iron bars, cement, stone, etc.) to complete construction on his home. The previous loan was for 7.000.00mt for the same purpose. He promises to pay the loan on time in order to have access to others. In the future he plans to request additional loans to furnish his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase construction materials (doors, iron bars, cement, stone, etc. )

loans.name: Atalia Salomao

texts.pt:
Foto tirada no escritório devido a distância do local de negócio.
Atalia Salomão Z. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 44 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos de 24, 20, 16 e 10 anos de idade, os 2 últimos vão a escola. Fez somente 7ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Nunca mudou de cidade onde vive, é comerciante e dona do seu próprio negócio ha mais de 14 anos. Ela compra e vende afumados, salsichão, salsicha e outros produtos cárnicos.  O bitoque de vitela é o seu melhor produto. Aprendeu o trabalho na Swazilandia, há já muitos anos. Trabalha sozinha as vezes tem com ajuda dos filhos, consegue um rendimento de cerca de 1.500.00mt por semana que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar cerca de 1.000.00mt por quinzena através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de oficiais de créditos que faziam mobilização perto do local onde desenvolve seu negócio. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar carne, chouriço, frangos e outros para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para reabilitar a sua casa e desenvolver ainda mais o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Photo taken at the office due to distance to the place of business. Atalia Salomão Z. nasceu was born in Maputo City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is 44 years old, single, and has four children, ages 24, 20, 16 and 10. The two youngest children go to school. Atalia only finished seventh grade; she did not continue school because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her children and does not support anyone else. She has never moved away from the city she lives in. She is a businesswoman and has owned her own business for more than 14 years. She works alone, sometimes with her children's help, and earns about 1,500 meticais per week. She uses this money for household expenses and even manages to save about 1,000 meticais every two weeks through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings). Atalia has never taken out loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from loan officers who were conducting enrollment campaigns near her business. This 15,000 meticais loan is her first loan. She will use it to buy meat, smoked sausage, chicken, etc., to increase her inventory. She promises to pay off this loan on time in order to maintain her credit. In the future she would like to ask for more loans to improve her house and further develop her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat, smoked sausage, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Luciernagas De Emprender Group

texts.es:
ESTA BANCA D. EMPRENDIMIENTO NACIO  POR LA INQUIETUD D. UN GRUPO D. SEÑORAS QUE TENIAN LA NECESIDAD D. CONTAR CON UN CREDITO E INVERTIRLO EN EL AUMENTO D. SU CAPITAL, LA MAYORIA D. ELLAS  REALIZAN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES COMO POR EJEMPLO:

LA PRESIDENTA LA SRA. CELIA VEND. COMIDA EN UNA PARADA D. CHOFERES TODO EL DIA SU ESPECIALIDAD ES LA SOPA D. FIDEO CON MANI, SU ESPOSO ES CHOFER ASALARIADO Y SUS HIJAS LE AYUDAN CON EL GASTO Y  EL NEGOCIO VIVE EN LA CASA D. SU CUÑADO OCUPA DOS CUARTOS Y UNA COCINA ELLA TIENE EL SUEÑO D. CONTAR CON SU CASA PROPIA AUNQUE AHORA ES UN POCO DIFICIL DICE QUE LOGRARA SU META MIENTRAS TENGA VIDA Y SALUD, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA INSUMOS Y UNA COCINA NUEVA PARA LA ELABORACION D. SUS COMIDAS.

LA TESORERA LA SRA. ADELA SACO EL CREDITO PARA INVERTIR EN SU CARNICERIA  Y SURTIR CON VERDURAS PARA QUE VENDA TAMBIEN ESTOS PRODUCTOS, VIVE EN LA CASA D. SU SUEGRA, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA Y LE APOYA MUCHO TIENE DOS HIJOS PEQUEÑOS, LA MAYOR ESTA EN KINDER Y EL PEQUEÑO APENAS ESTA APRENDIENDO A CAMINAR, ELLA AUNQUE APENAS TIENE 19 AÑOS ES UNA MUJER MUY TRABAJADORA YA QUE LOS JUEVES Y DOMINGOS SUBE AL ALTO Y AYUDA A SU MAMA QUIEN LE PAGA UNA COMISION POR FERIA, LO CUAL SIGNIFICA UN INGRESO EXTRA TIENE EL SUEÑO D. TENER SU CASA Y UN AUTO PROPIO.

TODAS LAS SOCIAS SON PERSONAS RESPONSABLES Y DINAMICAS QUE ESTAN AGRADECIDAS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
This communal bank grew from the need several women had to obtain credit to invest in their businesses. Each has her own commercial activity, such as: Celia, group president, sells prepared food at a public transportation stop all day; her specialty is vermicelli soup with peanuts. Her husband is a salaried driver and her daughters help her with household expenses and with her business. They live in her brother-in-law’s house occupying two bedrooms and a kitchen. Her dream is to build her own house although that is pretty difficult at the present time. She says she will reach her goals, though, as long as she has life and health. She will use the funds to buy ingredients and a new stove for her meals. Adela, group treasurer, took out the loan to invest in her butcher shop and also to buy vegetables to sell there as well. She lives in her mother-in-law’s house. Her husband works and helps her a lot. They have two small children, the oldest is in kindergarten and the little one is barely learning to walk. Although Adela is only 19 years old she is a very hard-working woman. On Thursdays and Sundays she goes up to El Alto to help her mother who pays her a commission per market which means extra income. Her dream is to have her own house and car. All the members are responsible, dynamic people who are grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in them by granting the loan

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Fernando Alfredo

texts.pt:
Fernando Alfredo M. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 42 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos de 18, 12 e 01 anos de idade, o de 12 anos vai a escola. Fez somente 7ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com sua família e sustenta a sua sobrinha que vive com ela. 
Nunca saiu da cidade de Maputo, trabalha como técnico operativo na empresa Aguas de Moçambique ha mais de 15 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 7.107.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Ja teve empréstimo no Banco comercial Barclays e decidiu não continuar mais. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu primo que é cliente desta instituição a longa data. Este é seu 1° empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, barrotes, portas e outros) para ampliar a sua residência.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para adquirir mais um talhão para construir outra residência.
texts.en:
Fernando Alfredo M. was born in Boane District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is 42 years old, married, and has three children, ages 18, 12, and 1. The 12-year-old goes to school. Fernando only completed seventh grade; he did not continue because of financial difficulties. He lives in his own house with his family and supports a niece who lives with him. He has never left the city of Maputo. For more than 15 years he has worked as an operations technician at Aguas de Moçambique. He has no employees and has a salary of 7,107 meticais per month. He uses this money for household expenses and also manages to save some in his bank account. Fernando had a loan with Barclays Commercial Bank and decided not to continue with them. He learned about Hluvuku through his cousin, who is a long-time customer of this institution. This is his first loan. He is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, beams, doors and other items) to add on to his house. He promises to pay off this loan on time to maintain his credit. In the future he would like to ask for more loans to buy another plot and build another house.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (zinc sheets, beams, doors and other items)

loans.name: Señor De Mayo Group

texts.es:
“Señor de Mayo” es un grupo de 13 señoras  que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Alto Lima”,  están juntas hace 6 años aproximadamente. Se agruparon por la necesidad de mejorar y ampliar sus negocios y de esta manera acceder al préstamo y beneficiarse todas. 
Una de las integrantes es Miriam C. que ingreso al grupo por invitación de sus primas que ya estaban en el grupo y durante este tiempo ha podido participar de todos los servicios de Pro Mujer. Ella se dedica a vender ropa en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, hace 4 años, con el préstamo tiene planificado comprar más mercadería y seguir generando ingresos que le permitan satisfacer las necesidades básicas de sus dos hijos.
Las demás integrantes tienen diversos negocios que se dedican a comercio, producción y servicio. Todas requieren el préstamo para mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
“Señor de Mayo” (Lord of May) is a group of 13 women who attend their meetings at the Alto Lima Community Center. They have been together for approximately six years. The members gathered to access a loan from which they all could benefit because they needed to improve and expand their businesses.

One of the members is Miriam C., who was invited to join by one of her cousins who was already part of the group. During this time, she has taken advantage of all the services offered by Pro Mujer. Miriam has been selling clothes at different fairs throughout El Alto for four years. She plans to use her loan to buy more merchandise so that she can continue generating revenues and provide the basic necessities for her two children.

The other members have different businesses in the retail, manufacturing, and service sectors. All of them need this loan to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ines Joaquim

texts.pt:
Inês Joaquim Gonçalves nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique tem 40 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos de 20, 16, 12 e 01 anos de idade, os 3 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 7ą classe não continuou devido a guerra de desestabilização que afectou as escolas onde devia dar continuidade com seus estudos. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos e sustenta sua irmã enviando lhe algum valor monetário para despesas de casa. 
Nunca saiu da cidade de Maputo, tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 15 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Ja teve empréstimo na Associação de credito Gueguegue e decidiu não continuar mais. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que é cliente desta instituição a longa data. Este é seu 1° empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, barrotes, pedra e outros) para ampliar a sua residência.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para construir capoeiras para a criação de frangos.
texts.en:
Inês Joaquim Gonçalves was born in Maputo City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is 40 years old, single, and mother to four children who are 20, 16, 12 and 1. The three eldest children go to school. Inês only finished seventh grade; she did not continue school because the civil war affected the schools at which she would have continued studying. She lives in her own house with her children and supports her sister by sending her some money for household expenses. Inês has never left Maputo City. For more than 15 years she has had her own business. She has no employees and has an income of close to 5,000 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses while saving some through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings). She had a loan with Gueguegue Credit Union, but decided not to continue with them. Inês learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is a long-time customer of this institution. This is her first loan. She is asking for 12,000 meticais which she will use to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, beams, stone and other items) to add on to her house. Inês promises to pay off this loan on time so she may take out other loans. In the future she intends to ask for more loans to build coops for raising chickens.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (zinc sheets, beams, stone and other items)

loans.name: Florinda Mariel

texts.es: LA SEÑORA FLORINDA ESTA CASADA, SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE VARIEDAD DE ROPAS(CHAMARRAS, POLERAS Y OTROS) DESDE HACE 8 AÑOS, TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ROPA EN EL MERCADO, ESTA EN ALQUILER. TIENE CASA PROPIA, TIENE 2 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, ESTA EN SU SEGUNDO CICLO, DONDE HA DEMOSTRADO SER RESPONSABLE EN SUS PAGOS CON LA INSTITUCION, ES UNA PERSONA MUY TRABAJADORA. EL CREDITO LO UTILIZARA  PARA AUMENTAR SU MERCADERIA SURTIR MEJOR SU CASETA YA QUE ESTA LLEGANDO LA TEMPORADA DE FRIO Y NECESITA COMPRAR CHAMARRAS AL POR MAYOR Y ASI VARIAR SU MERCADERIA POR TEMPORADA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Florinda is married and she has been dedicating herself to the buying and selling of various kinds of clothes (leather jackets, ponchos, T-shirts and others) for 8 years in a clothes shop she rents in the market. She owns a house and has 2 children of school age; she is a very hard-working woman who is presently repaying her second loan, and she has demonstrated being very responsible with her payments to the institution. The loan she is asking for will be used to augment her stock and to better furnish her stall, as the cold season is approaching and she needs to buy wholesale jackets, thus varying the seasonal products she offers. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy items of clothing to sell

loans.name: Gladys Estela

texts.es:
Gladys Estela C. A. L. tiene 25 años, es soltera,  no tiene hijos,  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Gladys  trabaja en la agricultura y ayuda en el hogar a su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son el maíz, papas, arbeja, fréjol.   Vende los productos en la  Parroquia de San Pablo y en el Cantón San Miguel.
Gladys solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes  para sus cultivos.  Su meta es mejorar la producción para tener mayor rendimiento en ganancias económicas. Los desafíos que enfrentan son los cambios climáticos que pueden perjudicar sus sembrios. Gladys manifiesta que en sus tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música y ayudar en los quehaceres del hogar.
texts.en:
Gladys Estela C. A. L. is 25 years old, single, and does not have any children. She lives in the town of San Francisco de Rumí, which is 1½ hours from San Miguel Canton in the Province of Bolivar.

Gladys is a member of the Communal Bank “San Francisco de Rumí Pamba”. The group consists of 25 members, most of whom are engaged in agriculture. Gladys is a farmer and helps support her family financially. Among the crops grown in the area are corn, potatoes, peas, and beans. She sells her products in San Pablo Parish and San Miguel Canton.

Gladys is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for her crops. Her goal is to improve production so that she can generate more revenue. The challenges that Gladys confronts are the changes in weather than can negatively impact her crops. In her free time, Gladys says she enjoys listening to music and helping with the household chores.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Lisete Paciencia

texts.pt:
Lisete Paciência Lucas M. nasceu na cidade de Inhambane, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique tem 29 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 2 filhos de 09 e 02 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a escola. Frequenta a faculdade na Universidade Eduardo Mondlane. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta duas enteadas enviando dinheiro para as despesas de casa. 
Saiu da cidade de Inhambane para Maputo a fim de continuar com os estudos em 2001. Trabalha como administrativa numa empresa desde 2004, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 5.258.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Ja teve empréstimo no banco Millenium Bim e decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma vizinha que é cliente desta instituição a longa data. Este é seu 1° empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, barrotes, cimento, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência e oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Lisete Paciência Lucas M. was born in Inhambane, south of Mozambique. She is 29, married and the mother of two children ages 9 and 2, the oldest one a student. She studies at the Eduardo Mondlane university. She left Inhambane for Maputo in order to get back to school in 2001. She works as an administrative assistant at the same company since 2004 and she makes U$180 per month, which she uses to support her household and still saves some. She has had other loans at the Milenium Bim Bank but decided to change banks. She heard of Hluvuku through a neighbor that is a long time client of the institution. This is her first loan and she's asking for U$450 in order to buy construction supplies (zinc plates, cement, rocks and others) to finish building her house. She is committed to pay it back on time to be able to apply for other loans. In the future she hopes to get more loans to finish building her house and offer better living conditions to her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio C. C. tiene 58 años, es casada,  tiene  7 hijos que se llaman Holger de 35, Oswaldo de 30,  Walter de 25, Estela de 24, Miguel de 21, Maria de 20 y Manuel de 17 años  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Gregorio trabaja en la agricultura toda su vida como principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son el maíz, papas, arbeja, fréjol.   Vende los productos en la ciudad de Guayaquil cada año.
Gregorio solicita el crédito para comprar ureas, abonos y pagar jornales de los trabajos.  Su meta es  construir unos invernaderos.   Los desafíos que enfrentan son que en tiempo de cosechas los precios se ponen muy bajos. Gregorio manifiesta que en su comunidad celebran a San Francisco y cuando no hay mucho trabajo salen a pasear
texts.en:
Gregorio C. C. is 58 years old, married, and has seven children named Holger (age 35), Oswaldo (age 30), Walter (age 25), Estela (age 24), Miguel (age 21), Maria (age 20), and Manuel (age 17). They live in the town of San Francisco de Rumí, which is 1½ hours from San Miguel Canton in the Province of Bolivar.

Gregorio is a member of the Communal Bank “San Francisco de Rumí Pamba”. The group consists of 25 members, most of whom are engaged in agriculture. Gregorio has been farming all of his life as the main source of income for his family. Among the crops grown in the area are corn, potatoes, peas, and beans. He sells his products in the city of Guayquil every year.

Gregorio is requesting a loan to buy urea and compost, as well as pay the salaries of his workers. His goal is to build a few greenhouses. The challenges he faces include harvesting his crops when prices are low. Gregorio says that his community of San Francisco celebrates when there is no work left to be completed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase urea & compost; pay his workers' salaries

loans.name: Segundo Fausto

texts.es:
Segundo Fausto P. G.  tiene 66 años, es casada,  tiene  8 hijos que se llaman Beatriz de 40, Rosalía de 38,  Guadalupe de 35, Agnelio de 32, Laura de 28, Francisco de 22, Anita de 21 y Manuel de 18 de  años  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Segundo trabaja en la agricultura toda su vida como principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son el maíz, trigo, cebada, papas, habas arbeja, fréjol.   Vende los productos en el cantón de San Miguel. 
Segundo solicita el crédito para comprar ureas, abonos y para el mejoramiento de la vivienda.  Su meta es  que sus cultivos den buenos productos para mejorar los precios y su comodidad en su vivienda.   Los desafíos que enfrentan son que en tiempo de cosechas los precios se ponen muy bajos. Segundo manifiesta que en su comunidad celebran a San Francisco y  cuando no hay mucho trabajo salen a pasear en conjunto de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Fausto P. G. is 66 years old, married, and has eight children named Beatriz (age 40), Rosalía (age 38), Guadalupe (age 35), Agnelio (age 32), Laura (age 28), Francisco (age 22), Anita (age 21), and Manuel (age 18). They live in the town of San Francisco de Rumí, which is 1½ hours from San Miguel Canton in the Province of Bolivar.

Segundo is a member of the Communal Bank “San Francisco de Rumí Pamba”. The group consists of 25 members, most of whom are engaged in agriculture.
