Segundo has been farming all of his life as the main source of income for his family. Among the crops grown in the area are corn, wheat, barley, potatoes, lima beans, peas, and kidney beans. He sells his products in San Miguel Canton.

Segundo is requesting a loan to buy urea and compost, as well as make improvements to his home. His goals are to improve his crops so that he can gain the best price and make his home more comfortable. Segundo’s challenges include dealing with low market prices during harvest time. He says that he and his family celebrate with the rest of the community of San Francisco whenever there is not much work left to be completed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase urea & compost; make improvements to his home

loans.name: Lolita Alfredo

texts.pt:
Lolita Alfredo Mulima S. nasceu no Distrito de Moamba, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 53 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 1 filho de 18 anos de idade, neste momento não vai a escola porque não conseguiu ingressar a faculdade. Fez somente 9ą classe não continuou porque logo depois foi ao lar e teve oportunidade de avançar com os estudos. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 
Saiu do Distrito de Moamba para Maputo na cidade da Matola. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 8 anos, possui um empregado que lhe ajuda no seu negócio. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 10.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Ja teve empréstimo na Associação de crédito Socremo e banco comercial Millenium Bim e decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua amiga Sra. Felismina que Ja é cliente desta instituição. Este é seu 1° empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, açúcar, amendoim, feijão e outros) para aumentar a mercadoria do seu negocio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para ampliar o seu negócio e para a aquisição de uma viatura como meio de transporte para ajudar no transporte da mercadoria.
texts.en:
Lolita Alfredo Mulima S. was born in the Moamba District in Maputo, Mozambique. She is 53 years old, married and the mother of a 18 year old son, who's not in school because he wasn't accepted at the university. She dropped school after 9th grade. She lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else. She left Moamba to go live in Matola and started a business 8 years ago. She has an employee that helps her out. She makes around U$350 per month that she uses to support her household and save some. She heard of Hluvuku through her friend Felismina, who's already a client of the institution. This is her first loan in the amount of U$450 that she will use to buy food products (rice, sugar, peanuts, beans and others) to sell at her store. She is committed to pay it back in time so she can asks for other loans and hopefully get a car to help transportating her products.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food products for reselling

loans.name: Anita Pacanate

texts.pt:
Anita Pacanate C. nasceu na cidade de Tete, Província do mesmo nome, Centro de Moçambique tem 59 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 5 filhos de 21, 18, 14, 9 e 7 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Não foi a escola porque os pais não a deixaram na altura. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para além dos filhos. 
Saiu de Tete para Maputo devido a transferência do seu marido em cumprimento do serviço militar. É pensionista do Ministério da Defesas ha 30 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem uma pensão de 5.728.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus vizinhos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é seu 1° empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, arames e outros) para concluir a sua casa.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para construir um muro de vedação da sua casa.
texts.en:
Anita Pacanate C. was born in Tete, Mozambique. She is 59 years old, married and the mother of five children aged 21, 18, 14, 9 and 7, all of them students. She never went to school herself because her parents didn't let her back in the day. She lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else besides her children. She left Tete for Maputo when her husband was in the army and was transfered there. She has a pension from the Ministery of Defense for the past 30 years, and makes approximately U$200 per month that she uses to support her children. She never had a loan from other banks and she is asking for U$450 that she will use to buy construction supplies to finish building her house. She is committed to pay the loan back in time so she can ask for more in the future to finish building her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies

loans.name: Amistad Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento AMISTAD POR SIEMPRE, se encuentra en su 5º  ciclo., es uno D. nuestro grupos mas antiguos y fieles a nuestra institucion ; el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco  esta representada por las siguientes socias:

Como Presidenta esta la Sra. Rosa quien es una persona D. edad, por su responsabilidad y solidaridad con sus compañeras fue elegida la lider del grupo, es casada y tiene 3 hijos D. los cuales 2 son casados y uno sigue viviendo con ella , como negocio tiene la venta D. sandalias en el mercado Santa Barbara, le va muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes y ella ya venD. hace 20 años, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia para surtir su puesto y asi incrementar su capital D. trabajo.

Como Tesorera esta la Sra.Jhovanna  quien es soltera no tiene hijos es una persona joven y con mucho entusiasmo  y tiene su negocio es la venta D. comida en la puerta D. un Colegio ubicado en la zona sud y que ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos con el dinero del credito comprara insumos para la elaboracion D. sus platos y la Secretaria es la Sra. Prima es casada tiene 4 hijos   y tiene su negocio D. dulces en la puesta del colegio  quien es vecina D. ventas con jhovanna. El dinero del credito lo utilizara en la compra D. dulces para surtir su puesto. Todo el grupo sacò para la compra D. mercaderia y asi incrementar su capital D. trabajo. todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Entrepreneurial Bank Amistad Por Siempre (Friendship Forever) is presently in its 5th cycle with our institutions: it is our oldest and most loyal group, composed of responsible and hard-working people. This bank is represented by the following members: Rosa is the President: she is an elderly lady who has been elected leader of the group because she have proven herself to be responsible person and because of the solidarity shone to her teammates. She is married and has 3 children: 2 are married and one still lives with her. She sells sandals in the Santa Barbara market: the business is going very well, she has a lot of customers and has been working there for 20 years. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products to furnish her stall and so increase her income. Jhovanna is the treasurer: she is single and has no children. She is a young and enthusiastic woman, and for a living she sell meals outsiD. a school in the southern area of the town. She has demonstrated being responsible and accurate with her payments, and the loan she is requesting will be used to buy ingredients to prepare her meals. Prima is the secretary, she is married and has 4 children. She sells sweets and candies outsiD. a school, the same school where Jhovanna works. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy sweets and candies to furnish her stall. The whole group has obtained money to buy products and increase their income this way. All the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase their income.

loans.name: Catarina Rossana

texts.pt:
Catarina Rossana S. nasceu no Distrito da Manhiça, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 47 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos de 30, 27 e 21 anos de idade todos Ja não vão a escola. Fez somente 7ą classe não continuou a falta de recursos financeiros. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos e sustenta seus enteados que vivem com ela.
Saiu apenas de Maputo para o Distrito de Boane ainda na Província de Maputo. Trabalha como auxiliar de limpeza no Instituto Politécnico Universitário desde 1983, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 2.600.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda com ajuda de seu marido consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária de vez enquanto sempre que puder.
 Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus Vizinhos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é seu 6° empréstimo no valor de 27.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, ferro, areia e outros) para continuar com a obra de construção da sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 7.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, 15.500.00mt, 20.000.00mt e 17.000.00mt todos para áreas de habitação e para bens de consumo. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na construção do murro de vedação na sua casa.
texts.en:
Catarina Rossana S. was born in Manhica District in the Maputo Province, south of Mozambique. She is 47 years old, married and the mother of three children aged 30, 27 and 21, all of them out of school. She finished 7th grade but had to stop it due to lack of financial support. She left Maputo to go live in Boane and works as a cleaner at the University Instituto Politecnico since 1983. She has no employees and makes U$80 per month that she uses to support her housenold, and with the help of her husband she's able to save some in the bank. She never had other loans and heard of Hluvuku through her neighbors that are also clients of the institution. This is her 6th loan in the amount of U$775 that she'll use to continue building her house. The previous loans were all for housing and consumer goods. She is committed to pay this one back in time as well, and hopefully apply for more loans in the future in order to build a new wall in her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen C. V.  tiene 50 años, es casada,  tiene  8 hijos que se llaman Raúl de 30, David de 27,  Janeth de 24, Agnelio de 23, Mercedes de 20, Salomón de 18, Saúl de 16 y Nancy de 13 de  años  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Carmen trabaja en la agricultura toda su vida como principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son el maíz, papas, tomate.   Vende los productos en el los mercados de Guaranda y Riobamba. 
Carmen solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para los sembrios.  Su meta es  que sus precios no estén bajos al momento de la cosecha.   Los desafíos que enfrentan son la sobreproducción de maíz y ahí es cuando los precios se ponen malos. Carmen manifiesta que en sus tiempos libres le gusta conversan con los vecinos sobre la ecuación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen C. V. is 50 years old, married, and has eight children: Raul (age 30), David (age 27), Janeth (age 24), Agnelio (age 23), Mercedes (age 20), Salomón (age 18), Saúl (age 16), and Nancy (age 13). They live in the town of San Francisco de Rumí, which is 1½ hours from San Miguel Canton in the Province of Bolivar.

Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank “San Francisco de Rumí Pamba”. The group consists of 25 members, most of whom are engaged in agriculture. Carmen has been farming all of her life as the main source of income for her family. Among the crops grown in the area are corn, potatoes, and tomatoes. She sells her products at the markets in Guaranda and Riobamba.

Carmen is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies for her crops. Her goal is to avoid earning low prices during harvest season. Her challenges include overproducing corn when prices are not favorable. In her free time, Carmen says she enjoys talking with her neighbors about her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Angelica Pedro

texts.pt:
Angélica Pedro N. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 39 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 6 filhos de 18, 16, 14, 12, 10 e 06 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 5ą classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para além de seus filhos. 
Saiu de Chibuto para Maputo com a sua família no ano de 2000, onde mais tarde fixou sua residência no Distrito de Boane. É comerciante e dona do seu negócio a mais de 5 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma vizinha que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é seu 3° empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar fardos de roupa usada diversa para aumentar quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 3.000.00mt e 5.000.00mt ambos para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. Tem como sonho melhorar as condições de habitação para a sua família. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar no desenvolvimento do seu negócio.
texts.en:
Angélica Pedro N. was born in Chibuto District, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. She is 39 years old, widowed, and has six children, ages 18, 16, 14, 12, 10 and 6. All the children go to school. Angélica only finished fifth grade; she did not continue with school because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone other than her children. She left Chibuto in 2000 to move with her family to Maputo, settling in Boane District. She has owned her own business for more than five years. She has no employees and earns around 6,000 meticais monthly. Angélica uses this money for household expenses and sometimes manages to save some in her bank account. She has never taken out loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a neighbor who is also a customer of this institution. This is Angélica's third loan. She is asking for 12,000 meticais, which she will use to buy bundles of assorted used clothing to increase her inventory. The previous loans were for 3,000 meticais and 5,000 meticais, and both were used for the same purpose. Angélica promises to pay off this loan on time in order to take out other loans. Her dream is to improve her family's living conditions. In the future she intends to ask for more loans to help her business grow.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bundles of assorted used clothing

loans.name: Myrian Jacqueline

texts.es:
Myrian Jacqueline A. H.   tiene 30 años, es casada,  tiene  4 hijos que se llaman Jenny de 13, Soña de 12,  Raúl de 9, Jaime de 7 años,  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Myrian trabaja en la agricultura toda su vida como principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son las papas, arbeja, trigo.   Vende los productos cada cosecha en la ciudad de Guayaquil. 
Myrian solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos.  Su meta es de realizar unos invernaderos.   Los desafíos que enfrentan son que en las cosechas bajan los precios de venta de los productos. Myrian manifiesta que en sus tiempos libres juega con sus hijos en el campo.
texts.en:
Myrian is 30 years old, married, and has 4 children whose names are Jenny (13 years old), Soña (12 years old), Raúl (9 years old), and Jaime (7 years old). They live in the San Francisco neighborhood of Rumí Pamba, an hour and a half from Cantón San Miguel, province of Bolívar. She is a member of the rural loan group "San Francisco de Rumí Pamba", which is comprised of 25 members in total, most of whom are farmers. Myrian has been a farmer all her life, and this is the main source of income for her family. Among the most outstanding crops in the area are potatoes, peas, and wheat. Every harvest time, she sells her crops in the city of Guayaquil. Myrian is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies for her crops. Her goal is to make some greenhouses. One of the challenges that faces her is that produce prices are low in the harvest season. Myrian says that in her free time she plays with her children in the fields.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies for her crops

loans.name: Segundo Gonzalo

texts.es:
Segundo Gonzalo L. L.   tiene 30 años, es casada,  tiene  3 hijos que se llaman Roxana de 9, Jairo de 6 y Raúl de 3 años,  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Segundo trabaja en la agricultura toda su vida como principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son las papas, maíz, arbeja, habas, trigo.   Vende los productos cada cosecha en la ciudad de Ambato. 
Segundo solicita el crédito para comprar ureas y abonos para sus sembrios.  Su meta es de mejoras sus cultivos para tener una buena producción.   Los desafíos que enfrentan son que en las cosechas venden a precios bajos sus productos. Segundo manifiesta que en sus tiempos libres juega fútbol .
texts.en:
Segundo Gonzalo L. L. is 30, married, and has three children named Roxana (9), Jairo (6) and Raúl (3). They live in San Francisco de Rumí which is about one and a half hours from San Miguel in Bolívar Province. Segundo is a member of the community organziation “San Francisco de Rumí pamba", and is one of 25 members, most of whom make their living from agriculture. Segundo enjoys playing soccer in his free time. Segundo has been a farmer all of his life and his crops are the livelihood of his family. The most important crops in the region include potatoes, corn, beans, grains and wheat. He sells harvested produce in the market in the city of Ambato. Segundo seeks a loan to buy fertilizer for his crops in order to increase his production. The main challenge he faces are the low market prices paid for his crops at the time of sale.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to increase his crop production

loans.name: Betty Elizabeth

texts.es:
Betty tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío Caracucho, un zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, lugar caracterizado por tener a la mayoría de su población concentrada en pequeños caseríos dispersos, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Betty se dedica a trabajar como confeccionista de faldas, vestidos y blusas desde hace mas de dos años, cuenta con una máquina de coser en su vivienda donde trabaja constantemente para confeccionar las prendas de vestir que le solicita un comerciante que, a su vez, las vende en algunas ciudades de la sierra del país. Con las ganancias que ella percibe de esta actividad ayuda a sus padres a solventar la economía de su familia.

Esta actividad también le ayuda a sentirse activa, por lo que ella gusta mucho de la labor que realiza. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida por lo que ella está pensando en comprar más materiales como hilos y telas para confeccionar mas prendas de vestir, para lograr su objetivo Betty se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Betty es una joven que siempre apoya a sus padres en labores agrícolas y de crianza de animales, ya que estas son las principales fuentes de sustento con las que cuentan. Su mayor anhelo es llegar a ampliar su taller para poder seguir trabajando y brindarle una oportunidad de trabajo a otras mujeres de la zona.
texts.en:
Betty is 25 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the village of Caracucho, an rural area in the District of Mórrope where most of the population is scattered among several small villages. This area is part of the Province of Lambayeque and located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Betty has been manufacturing skirts, dresses, and blouses for more than two years. She has a sewing machine in her home where she works constantly to produce clothing requested by a merchant, who then sells them in some of the mountain cities. Using the earnings she receives from her work, Betty is able to help her parents with the family finances.

Her business also allows her to stay active since she enjoys her work tremendously. Since the business has been well-received, Betty is thinking about buying additional materials, such as thread and fabric, to make more clothing. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edypyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Betty is a young woman who has always supported her parents with their farming and animal husbandry endeavors, the main sources of income on which they depend. Her greatest wish is to expand her workshop so that she can continue working and provide employment opportunities to other women in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric & thread

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es:
El grupo Alfa y Omega lo integran tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y decididas una de ella es María Alcadia S. V. quien desde hace dieciséis años  tiene una tortillería y vende frijoles cosidos.  Ella con el préstamo compra leña, maíz y frijoles en grandes cantidades.

Sus compañeros de grupo son Ángela del Carmen Vázquez R. quien comercializa chatarra y Liliam de los Reyes C. R. quien tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The "Alfa y Omega" (Alpha & Omega) group is composed of three hard-working, dedicated and determined women. One of them is María Alcadia S. V. who has had a tortilla shop for 16 years; she also sells cooked beans. She will use the loan to buy firewood, corn and beans in large quantities. Her fellow group members are: Ángela del Carmen Vázquez R. who retails recyclables and Liliam de los Reyes C. R. who has a small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, iron, stone and other items)

loans.name: Santiago Felipe

texts.es:
Santiago Felipe V. C.  tiene 60 años, es casado,  tiene  4 hijos que se llaman Freddy de 30, Javier de 28, Hilda de 35 y Miguel de 40 años,  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una distancia de hora y media del Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y pastoreo de ganado bovino.

Santiago trabaja en la agricultura toda su vida como principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son las papas, maíz, arbeja, habas, trigo y pastoreo de ganado.   Vende los productos cada cosecha en la ciudad de San Miguel. 

Santiago solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y abonos orgánicos para la siembra de maíz.  Su meta es de mejoras sus cultivos y su forma de vida.   Los desafíos que enfrentan son falta de ayuda al agricultor, pocos ingresos económicos. Santiago manifiesta que en sus tiempos libres le gusta cantar junto al rió.
texts.en:
Santiago Felipe V. C., 60, is married and has four children whose names are: Freddy, 30, Javier, 28, Hilda, 35, and Miguel 40. They live in San Francisco de Rumí Pamba which is an hour and a half from San Miguel canton, Bolívar province. He is a member of the “San Francisco de Rumí Pamba” communal bank which has 25 members in total most of whom are in agriculture and sheep-raising. Santiago has worked in agriculture his whole life; it is his family’s main source of income. Among his crops are: potato, corn, pea, broad bean, wheat and cattle pasturage. He sells each harvest’s product in San Miguel. Santiago is asking for funds to buy fertilizers and organic manure for his corn crops. His goal is to improve his crops and his way of life. The challenges he faces are the lack of support for farmers and low income. Santiago tells us that he enjoys singing beside the river in his free time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and organic manure for his corn crops.

loans.name: Reginaldo Fernando

texts.pt:
Reginaldo Fernando M. nasceu no Distrito de Massinga, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique tem 43 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 25, 18, 14 e 11 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 4ą classe do antigo sistema e não continuou devido a guerra de ocupação colonial. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seu tio e irmão que vivem com ele. 
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo cumprindo com o serviço militar obrigatório, veio sozinho e mais tarde troche a família para residirem juntos em Boane. É serralheiro de profissão ha mais de 23 anos, tem 3 empregados que lhe auxiliam no seu trabalho e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 12.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma tia que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é seu 1° empréstimo no valor de 13.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar ferro para o fabrico de grades e portas para aumentar a quantidade do seu stock e responder a demanda da sua clientela. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para ampliar sua serralharia e fazer crescer ainda mais o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Reginaldo Fernando M. was born in the Massinga district in the province of Inhambane in southern Mozambique. He is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children who are 25, 18, 14 and 11 years old. All of them are in school. Reginaldo only studied through the 4th level under the old system of education. He didn't continue with his studies due to the war of colonial occupation. He lives in his own house with his family, and also takes care of an uncle and a brother who live with him. Reginaldo left Inhambane for Maputo in order to comply with the obligatory military service. He first arrived alone and then brought his family so that they could live together in Boane. He has worked as a blacksmith for more than 23 years and has 3 employees who help him in his work. He has a monthly income of around 12,000.00 Meticales, which he uses to cover household expenses. He also saves some money in his bank account each month. He has never taken out a loan with another bank, and found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through an aunt who also works with the institution. This is his 1st loan, for the amount of 13,000.00 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy iron for making grates and doors, in order to increase his stock and respond to his customers' demand. Reginaldo promises to repay this loan as agreed, in order to be eligible for other loans in the future. He plans to ask for future loans to expand his shop and make his business grow even more.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of iron for making grates and doors.

loans.name: Cielo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cielo está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Mirna de Jesús N. P. quien hace cinco años instalo en su casa un pequeño taller de costura donde se especializa en ropa para niños. Ella con el préstamo comprara telas para mejorar su negocio.

Sus compañeros de grupo son María Teresa Narváez P. quien desde hace dos años vende nacatamales, comida típica nacional que se consume especialmente los fines de semana y Santiago José P.  quien vende ropa desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
The "Cielo" (Heaven or Sky) group is made up of three hard-working persons. One of them is Mirna de Jesús N. P. who set up a small seamstress workshop in her home five years ago; she specializes in making children's clothing. She will use the loan to buy fabric to improve her business. Her fellow group members are María Teresa Narváez P. who has sold nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales-a typical dish that is eaten primarily on weekends) for the last two years and Santiago José P. who has been a clothing merchant for the last two years.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For fabric.

loans.name: Acuario 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Acuario 2 está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y decididas  una de ellas es  Rosa María Gaitán González, coordinadora del grupo quien se dedica a la venta de cerdo y cuajadas ambulante negocio con el que saco delante a su familia.

 Sus compañeras de grupo son Manuela de Jesús Jiménez quien comercializa accesorios en mercado Israel  como chapas, pirañas,   aros…etc. y Rosa Amanda Suarez quien venta de tortillas e invertirá el crédito en maíz, leña, molino, cal.
texts.en:
The "Acuario 2" (Aquarius 2) group is made up of three hard working, dedicated and determined people. One of them is Rosa María Gaitán González, group coordinator, who sells pork and cuajadas (a cheese-like product). This itinerant business has made it possible for her to move her family ahead in life. Her fellow group members are: Manuela de Jesús Jiménez who sells accessories, like locks, hoops, hair pins, etc. in the Israel market and Rosa Amanda Suarez who sells tortillas and will use the funds to buy corn, firewood, lime powder and a mill.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For pork and cuajadas (a cheese-like product)

loans.name: Dos De Mayo Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “DOS DE MAYO”; Nuestros socios viven en la ciudad D. Cusco, en el distrito de Huanchac. Los socios se reúnen todos los meses en el local de Arariwa.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Martha, nuestra socia tiene 43 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades D. hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia vende productos nutricionales, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para viajar y comprar productos de nutrición para implementar en su negocio.

Los socios alternan sus actividades con el comercio minorista ellos venden celulares y accesorios, otra socia es empleada de maquinarias pesadas, otra tiene tienda abarrotes, otro socio vende libros y diarios en un kiosko, otros dos socios son fotógrafos, y otra socia vende ropa. Nuestros socios solicitan el préstamo para invertir en sus diferentes negocios.

Los socios  agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members make up the “DOS DE MAYO” (May 2) communal bank. They live in Cusco’s Huanchac district and meet monthly in Arariwa’s offices. Our featured member is Martha, 43. She is a single mother of two children. She alternates her household chores with retail: she sells nutritional products. She is asking for funds to pay travel costs to buy nutritional products to stock her business. The other members alternate their activities with retail. Some sell cell phones and accessories, another member is a heavy machinery operator, one has a grocery store and another member sells books and newspapers in a kiosk; two other members are photographers and one sells clothing. All the members seek funding to invest in their various businesses. The members are grateful for and value the support given them through this means and pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For travel costs to buy nutritional products to stock her business.

loans.name: Cuexcomate Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA  CUEXCOMATE, POR EL NOMBRE PREHISPANICO QUE SE LE DA A LOS GRANEROS DE MANUFACTURA ARTESANAL DE ORIGEN MESOAMERICANO QUE CONSTRUIAN EN SUS CASAS DEBIDO A LAS CARACTERISTICAS DE SU DISEÑO CONSERVA SUS COSECHAS PARA ESPECIALMENTE  EL MAIZ, COMO SE OBSERVA EN LA FOTOGRAFIA ESTA CONSTRUIDO A BASE DE MATERIALES NATURALES COMO EL BARRO, PIEDRA Y PAJA.
ESTA  UBICADO EN PUEBLA EN MEXICO MUY CERCA DE LOS LÍMITES CON EL ESTADO DE MORELOS. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 10  INTEGRANTES.
LA SEÑORA RUFINA C. B.  ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO. TIENE 47 AÑOS Y SOLO ESTUDIO LA PRIMARIA, VENDE COMIDA Y TAMBIEN ES ALFARERA. ELLA SE DEDICA A VENDER COMIDA Y A  LA ELABORACION DE ALFARERIA DESDE LOS 17 AÑOS Y YA LLEVA 30 AÑOS DEDICANDOSE A LA ALFARERIA, YA QUE ES UNA TRADICION FAMILIAR,  SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA  QUE UTILIZA, COMO EL BARRO, LEÑA, GRIETA Y COLORANTES.  SU SUEÑO ES CONSTRUIR SU PROPIO HORNO, PARA PODER DEDICARSE MAS A LA  ALFARERIA, YA QUE ACTUALMENTE SOLO LO HACE EN PEQUEÑAS PROPORCIONES, POR QUE SOLO PIDE PRESTADO EL HORNO CON SU VECINA Y TIENE QUE ACARREAR TODA LA MERCANCIA DESDE SU CASA Y DESPUES DE REGRESO, ADEMAS DE QUE NO SIEMPRE ESTA DISPONIBLE.
EL NOMBRE DE LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPOS Y SU ACTIVIDAD SON:
SOFIA A. F.          ALFARERIA
INES C. A.           ABARROTES
RUFINA CARVAJAL B.         COMIDA Y ALFARERIA
ENEDINA A. M.        ALFARERIA
CONSTANTINA M. H.   ALFARERIA
MODESTA P. M.        ALFARERIA
ELENA G. C.          ALFARERIA
JOSEFINA B. A.        ALFARERIA
YOLANDA A. C.       ALFARERIA
PETRA C. P.          ALFARERIA
texts.en:
This group is called “Cuexcomate” after the pre-Hispanic term used for artisanal granaries of Mesoamerican origin built in homes that, thanks to their design, allowed crops, especially corn, to be stored. As can be appreciated in the photo, this one is built with natural materials like mud, stone and straw. It is located in Puebla, México, very near the border with the state of Morelos; it is made up of 10 members. Mrs. Rufina C. B. is a group member. She is 47 years old and only finished elementary school. She sells prepared food but she’s also a potter. She has sold food and made pottery since the age of 17; she’s been making pottery for 30 years since it’s a family tradition. She is asking for funds to buy raw materials that she uses such as: clay, firewood, grout and dyes. Her dream is to build her own kiln so that she can spend more time as a potter; currently she only produces small amounts because she has to borrow her neighbor’s kiln and carry all her materials back and forth from home. Besides, the neighbor’s kiln isn’t always available. The other group members and their activities are: SOFIA A. F. - Potter INES C. A. - Grocer RUFINA CARVAJAL B.- Food and Pottery ENEDINA A. M.- Potter CONSTANTINA M. H.- Potter MODESTA P. M.- Potter ELENA G. C. - Potter JOSEFINA B. A. - Potter YOLANDA A. C. - Potter PETRA C. P.- Potter

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for pottery: clay, firewood, grout, dyes.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 45 años, es una mujer muy amable, vive en un departamento alquilado, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijas. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica en la venta de zapatos, por ello viaja constantemente a Trujillo, ciudad que queda al norte del país, para conseguir la mercadería necesaria.  Puesto que en esa ciudad se caracteriza por ser lo mejores fabricantes de calzado, desde entonces vende zapatos, sandalias y botas de cuero. Este negocio le es rentable, por que tiene buenos compradores que conocen la calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que logra conocer mucha gente,  sin embargo el estar viajando le da a veces inseguridad. Su mayor anhelo es comprarse un departamento, en donde pueda vivir con sus hijas y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más zapatos, para cubrir la demanda de sus asiduos compradores.
texts.en:
Ana, 45, is a very kind woman who lives in a rented apartment with her husband and two daughters. For over 15 years she has sold shoes; she constantly travels to the city of Trujillo, which is in the north of the country, to get the needed merchandise because this city is noted for being the best shoe manufacturer. She sells shoes, sandals and leather boots. This is a profitable business because she has good buyers that recognize the quality of her products. What she most enjoys about her work is getting to know a lot of people; the constant travel, however, sometimes makes her feel insecure. Her greatest wish is to buy an apartment where she and her daughters can live and she can offer them a better quality of life. This is her first loan with MFP and she commits to making all her installment payments on time. She will use the requested funds to buy more shoes to meet her regular customers’ demands.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las hormiguitas está conformado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, decididas y trabajadoras una de ellas es  Dayanira Esther A. L. quien vende fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida fritas y sopas de res, mondongo, de albóndigas, de queso y de pescado.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Blanca Rosa A.  R. quien vende ropa y cosméticos, Blanca Félix M. O. quien es propietaria de una pulpería y María Aurelia García tiene una pequeña venta. Ellas el préstamo lo invertirán para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Las Hormiguitas" (Little Ants) group is made up of four hard-working, dedicated women. One of them is Dayanira Esther A. L. who sells fritanga [a popular eatery serving fried snacks, beef soup, mondongo (tripe and vegetable soup), meat ball soup, corn chowder, fish stew]. Her fellow group members are: Blanca Rosa A. R. who sells clothing and cosmetics, Blanca Félix M. O. who owns a grocery store and María Aurelia García who has a small store. They will use the funds to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For basic grains, cheese, spices, vegetables, meats, etc.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea V. O., es madre soltera y habita en el barrio Las Conchitas, sus hijos son mayores de edad y le apoyan económicamente a sus gastos diarios, ella es agricultora de piña desde hace más de 15 años.

Uno de los principales problemas que ha tenido en sus labores diarias es la falta de agua potable que afecta la vida diaria de la familia, dentro de los planes para el cultivo esta la diversificación de las cosechas, es por la misma razón que solicitan de un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas que brinden un mantenimiento óptimos a las cosechas, para su posterior siembra y la reproducción optima de una cosecha, esto les permitirá mejores condiciones económicas y/o el capital necesario para futuras inversiones.
texts.en:
Andrea Vilches O. is a single mother; she lives in Las Conchitas neighborhood. Her children are all adults and they help her out financially to meet daily household expenses. She's been a pineapple farmer for over 15 years. One of the main problems she has faced in her daily chores is the lack of potable water; this affects her family's daily life. Among her plans is crop diversification and this is why she's asking for funds: to buy farming supplies that will provide maximum care for her crops, for her subsequent planting and for the crop's optimal reproduction. This will provide better economic conditions and/or the necessary capital for future investments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Diomar

texts.es: Diomar tiene 28 años, tiene un hijo, Leonardo de 5 años y juntos viven en casa de un familiar. Hace más de 3 meses, se dedica a la compra y venta de lencería, mientras que su suegra la apoya, cuidando a su hijo. Desde entonces y casi todos los días, trabaja de manera ambulante, recorriendo las calles de los  mercados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que puede disponer de su tiempo sin descuidar de su hijo. Sin embargo la actividad que realiza la expone a ser victima de robo. Es por ello que desea alquilar un puesto de venta dentro del mercado; para así tener mayor seguridad y estar junto a su hijo más tiempo. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas, puesto sabe que le será muy beneficioso para su negocio. Asimismo en su grupo comunal espera ser una socia cooperadora para el bienestar de la asociación. Con el crédito que solicita, espera comprar más lencería y de ese modo ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Diomar, 28, has a son, Leonardo, 5. They live together in a relative’s house. For over 3 months she has been a lingerie merchant while her mother-in-law helps her care for her son. Since then and almost every day she wanders the aisles in the market selling her wares. What she likes most about her work is that she can control her time so that she doesn’t neglect her son. However, the type of work she does leaves her vulnerable to theft. Because of this, she’d like to rent a stall inside the market so that she will be more secure and be able to spend still more time with her son. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She also expects to be a cooperative member of her communal group to the benefit of the association. She will use the requested funds to buy more lingerie in order to offer a greater variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lingerie.

loans.name: Celestes Group
loans.use: Stocking merchandise.

loans.name: Las Divinas De Mendoza Group
loans.use: For stock merchandise.

loans.name: Maria De La Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Maria de la Concepción C. S., tiene 44 años de edad habita en el Barrio San Juan de los Ríos, es casado y su esposo labora como agricultor, a la vez es carpintero y le apoyá económicamente a los gastos diarios, sus hijos trabajan en la carpintería y estudian la escuela secundaria, ellos se dedican a la agricultura desde hace 2 años.

Fue con el apoyo del esposo, que logró comprar un terreno y empezar sus días en la siembra, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas, que le permitan mejorar sus tierras para la siembra de los cultivos, esto favorecerá a la familia con mejores condiciones económicas y  la posibilidad de contar con el Capital necesario para futuros inversiones o proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Maria de la Concepción C. S., 44, lives in the San Juan de los Ríos neighborhood. She is married and her husband is a farmer but he also works as a carpenter and helps her with household expenses. Her children work in the carpentry shop and also go to secondary school. They have been farmers for two years. With her husband’s help, she managed to purchase a plot of land and start her farming days. She is asking for funds to buy farming supplies that will allow her to improve the soil for her crops. This will be of benefit to the family because it will produce better economic conditions and provide the possibility of having capital for future investments and life projects.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Las Campanitas De Loma Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Campanitas de Loma está conformado por  9 y se ubica en el Estado de México en México.
Yolanda Jiménez C. es la tesorera del grupo. Tiene 34 años, estudió la preparatoria, es ama de casa y comerciante y tiene en total 3 hijos, 2 mujeres y un varón de 17, 11 y 7 años de edad respectivamente.  Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de dulces que inició hace 2 años con un pequeño puesto ambulante a un costado de la iglesia en el cual trabaja de sábado a jueves y el día viernes lo emplea para ir a surtir su mercancía. Platica que a base de los créditos y con las ganancias que sus ventas le han generado se apoyó para comprar un automóvil que le sirve para trasladarse a comprar su mercancía y para transportarla a diferentes puntos de venta cuando hay eventos en el pueblo, en los que participan varias comunidades de los alrededores y se instalan muchos puestos para toda la gente que se reúne. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de más dulces y botanas, y de ser posible comprar también jugos y refrescos con la intención de acrecentar su negocio y continuar participando en las eventualidades que se organizan en su comunidad, pues ella espera obtener mas ganancias que con el paso del tiempo le permitan construir un local y tener su propia dulcería, mejorando también su calidad de vida. 

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
- Ana Lilia R. V. (Venta de Ropa Interior)
- Agripina C. (Venta de tortillas)
- Silvia C. R. (Venta de ropa)
- Rosa María C. G. (Venta de ropa)
- Petra B. A. (Venta de dulces y plásticos)
- Verónica C. V. (Venta de dulces y refrescos)
- Marcela V. C. (Venta de zapatos)
- María del Rocío R. B. (Venta de ropa)
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Campanitas de Loma” (Loma’s Little Bells); it has 9 members and is in Estado de México, a Mexican state. Yolanda Jiménez C., 34, is the group treasurer. She finished high school and is a housewife and merchant; she has three children, two girls and one boy who are 17, 11 and 7 years of age respectively. She is a candy merchant; she started out two years ago with a small sales cart alongside a church; she was open for business from Saturday through Thursday, she used Fridays to stock up on merchandise. She relates that based on loans and profits from her sales she was able to buy a car that she uses to go get her merchandise and transport it to various points of sale when there are events in town where many outlying communities participate and many booths are set up for all the people that gather. She is asking for funds to buy more candy and snacks and, if possible, juices and beverages with the intention of expanding her business and continue participating in the events the town organizes because she expects to get more profits that will make it possible for her to build a proper candy store in the future thereby improving her quality of life. The other group members are: - Ana Lilia R. V. (Underwear Sales) - Agripina C. (Tortilla Sales) - Silvia C. R. (Clothing Sales) - Rosa María C. G. (Clothing Sales) - Petra B. A. (Candy and Plastics Sales) - Verónica C. V. (Candy and Beverage Sales) - Marcela V. C. (Shoe Sales) - María del Rocío R. B. (Clothing Sales)

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more candy and snacks and, if possible, buy juices and beverages.

loans.name: Sophia Leopoldo's Group

texts.en:
Sophia L., from the village of Talairon, is the 62-year-old leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Sophia, who is married and has five adult-aged children, owns and operates a vulcanizing shop business providing mechanical services to local community members. Her husband is the one handling the mechanical and vulcanizing activities. Sophia has been engaged in her business for over eight years, earning approximately 9000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Sophia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid her previous loan from PMPC, she is now requesting a new loan, her 13th, of 14900 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Sophia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Jenny Paola

texts.es:
Para Jenny PaoL. S. L. experiencia de sus padres en micro exportación, ha sido valiosa para su desempeño como joven emprendedora que diseña y fabrica  sus propias carteras, bolsos y accesorios principalmente elaborados en materiales de cuero. ElL. a sus 27 años tiene mucha proyección y visiona un futuro promisorio desde L. ciudad de Bogotá para el mundo, pues vive en el barrio  San Fernando  de esta capital, desde donde hace sus primeros intentos. En L. actualidad está aplicando a su cuarto crédito, que invertirá en L. compra de cuero y sus derivados e insumos pues quiere sacar nueva colecciòn de bolsos, carteras y porta celulares. Cuando Jenny inició en el año 2.000 se capacitó como diseñadora y entró con pie firme participando como expositora en L. feria exporartesanias en el año 2006, donde pudo llevar  productos diversificados, entre bolsos monederos y porta celulares, que poco a poco se han ido expandiendo en toda L. ciudad.
ElL. es una cliente  de L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que con sus créditos logró aumentar su capital de trabajo y comprar una maquina plana devastadora  con L. que redujo su tiempo en L. producción, gradualmente sus productos son conocidos también en  República Dominicana. Su mayor sueño es abrir mercado en otros países, seguir expandiéndose y dándose a conocer en otras partes del mundo.Su mayor desafío son las fluctuaciones  que ocurren con el precio del dollar  y muchas veces el no tener suficiente capital de trabajo para producir y cumplir con pedidos importantes que hacen clientes en Colombia.
texts.en:
For Jenny PaoL. S. her parents’ experience in micro export has been very valuable in her development as a young entrepreneur: she designs and manufactures her own line of leather wallets, purses and accessories. At the age of 27 she has quite a bit of future projection and vision from the city of Bogotá to the world; she lives in this capital city’s San Fernando neighborhood and it is here where she is making her first inroads. She is currently applying for her 4th loan which she’ll use to buy leather and its derivatives as well as other raw materials to launch a new collection of purses, wallets and cellular phone carrying cases. When Jenny started out in 2000 she trained as a designer and then started out with a firm first step: she was an exhibitor at the 2006 Exporartesanias Fair where she showed a line of diversified products like coin purses and cell phone carrying cases. Gradually she has been expanding citywide. She is a client of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and has used loans to buy equipment that has drastically reduced her production time; her products have become known in the Dominican Republic. Her greatest dream is to establish herself in foreign markets, to continue expanding and becoming known in other parts of the world. Her greatest challenge is the fluctuations in value of the dollar and often not having sufficient capital available to fill all the orders she has from important Colombian customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather and its derivatives as well as raw materials to launch a new collection of purses, wallets and cellular phone carrying cases.

loans.name: Verly

texts.en:
Verly L., 31, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Danilo L., a messenger for a prominent bank, they are blessed with two children. To help her husband earn so that their family can have a better life, Verly has been managing her own ready-to-wear clothing stall for quite some time now.

A regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now, Verly regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow ten times in CCT’s Cooperative, using the money to expand and improve her clothing business.

To ensure the continued success of her business, she is now requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 loan to buy more products to replenish her stocks and maintain the operations of her variety store. Verly dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners gathering each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products to replenish stocks and maintain operations of her variety store

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa H. is from the village of Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 42 years old. Felisa is married and has six school-age children. To make a living, Felisa owns a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops which include a variety of vegetables.  Felisa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Felisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felisa is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Felisa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita B. is from the village of Siare, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 60 years old, married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Amelita owns a general store.  The other source of income for the family comes from her husband who works as a carpenter. Amelita has been engaged in her business for 28 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Amelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Amelita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Amelita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business.

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda R., 46, is making sure that her family has enough provisions to meet their daily needs. Married to Edwin R., a painter, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store while selling viands (item of food/tasty dish) alongside her usual products.

Luzviminda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow eight times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a loan of 15,000 PFP. This amount will be a source of added capital for her expanding business and will be used to buy groceries needed to replenish her store inventory as well as for raw ingredients for her viands.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries needed to replenish her store inventory and raw ingredients for her viands

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen R. is 41 years of age, married, and a resident of Labuyo, Tangub City. Her husband is a local government employee for Tangub City and the couple is blessed with four children aged 8, 12, 14 and 16 years old. 
Helen has skills in cooking and business management. To help her husband in supporting their family, she decided to engage in business and opened a restaurant business. For three years, she has been able to manage her business and is now earning an average net income of not less than 3,000 PHP per month. These earnings are very helpful to her family. She has taken a number of loans and her previous loan was for 8,000 PHP. Now she is requesting her fifth loan, of 10,000 PHP, to add to her capital for her existing eatery and sari-sari store business. The future income from this loan will be used to improve her family's living conditions, to meet their basic needs and as savings for future use. Helen is hoping that someday her business will become more progressive.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia A., 51, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Matyano A., a barber and junk shop owner, they are blessed with four children. Virginia makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing their family’s junk shop together with her husband for quite some time now.
Virginia has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Her good repayment performance with her previous loans means she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her junk shop.
To ensure the success of the family's businesses, Virginia would like to apply for a loan of 13,000 PHP. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to the expanding businesses by buying equipment and other hair care products for the barber shop and investing a portion of the loan in buying junk from junk collectors.
Virginia dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy equipment and other hair care products for the barber shop

loans.name: Emelda Salomon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Emelda S. (on the left in photo), a 42-year old married resident of Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City, is the leader of a five-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Emelda S.’s Group.

Emelda is married to Rodrigo S., a jabal-jabal driver, and they are blessed with five children, all now adults. To help her husband in supporting their family, Esmelda opened a little sari-sari store four years ago, now earning an average monthly income of not less than P5,000.00. Emelda joined the cooperative in 2006, and as an active center officer and member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a micro-finance program reaching out to the rural poor, she is requesting a new loan, her eighth, of P12,000.00 to purchase housing materials for house repair. Future income will be used to improve the living conditions for her family, and she is hoping that someday her business will become larger.

loans.name: Wuiliam Enrique

texts.es:
Wuiliam tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de su madre ubicada en la ciudad de Ferreñafe, conocida a nivel nacional por la elaboración de comidas típicas, se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su vivienda, el nos comenta que la bodega fue inicialmente instalada por su madre, pero ella viajó a la ciudad de Lima para trabajar, desde entonces el se ha hecho cargo del negocio y se vale de el para salir adelante.

Wuiliam trata diariamente de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes ofreciéndoles productos de calidad y un buen trato, sus esfuerzos estan teniendo resultado y eso lo pone contento. El desea ampliar su negocio para poder percibir mas ganancias, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de abarrotes para lograr su objetivo.

Wuiliam es un joven bastante trabajador y responsable, su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio y convertirse en un empresario de éxito, en la zona donde vive el es muy conocido y estimado por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Wuiliam is 26 years old, single, and lives at his mother’s house in the city of Ferreñafe, which is known nationally for its traditional dishes. This community is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past year, Wuiliam has been selling basic necessities and groceries from a store inside of his home. He says that his mother was responsible for starting the business, but she then had to travel to the city of Lima for work. At that point, he was left in charge of the business and was able to make it succeed.

Wuiliam tries every day to satisfy the demand of his customers by offering them high quality products and good service. He is happy with the results that came about from his efforts. Wuiliam wants to grow his business in order to generate more earnings. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN to invest in the purchase of groceries in order to achieve his goal.

Wuiliam is a hardworking and responsible young man. His greatest wish is to expand his business and become a successful businessman. He is well-known in the area where he lives and respected by his neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to expand his business

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda T. is from the village of Baliangao. She is 39 years old, married and has a school-aged child. Luzminda owns and operates a business selling dry goods in the local community. Luzminda has been involved in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it. She's also involved in snack vending.

In 2005, Luzminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital for her snack vending business. Luzminda is requesting a new loan, her 12th, of 14,500 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Marmie

texts.en:
Marmie V. is from the town of Rosales, Pangasinan. She is 41 years old. Marmie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marmie owns & operates a business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Marmie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marmie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marmie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marmie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic P. is from the town of Balungao, Pangasinan. She is 38 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Marivic owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marivic has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Marivic joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic is requesting her first loan, of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda P. is from the village of Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 41 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Imelda owns and operates a business growing and selling a variety of vegetables. Imelda has been involved in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Imelda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to invest in expanding the business. Imelda is requesting a new loan, her 3rd, of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. Imelda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
