loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Desde hace 21 años la vida de Sonia Gómez de 54 años, transcurre  entre sus actividades productivas en un negocio de confecciones y su responsabilidad como madre de 2 hijos que ahora tienen 24 y 30 años de edad. 
Inició esta actividad trabajando  mediante contrato de confección de ropa para  importantes clientes  y algunos amas de casa, entre vecinas amigas y familiares  de manera informal;  la ventas a 2 empresas, importantes para su desempeño, que pronto se fueron a la quiebra, lo cual entristeció mucho  a Sonia porque bajaron significativamente sus ventas, y le tocó acudir a sus ahorros para vivir por un tiempo de ellos;  estimulada por el afecto de la familia, empezó nuevamente su trabajo para una diseñadora de la que algunos años después logró  independizarse apoyada por los créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; es asì como retoma su negocio Hoy  “Confecciones Sonia”, ubicado en el barrio Recreo de la ciudad de Barranquilla,  en una zona comercialmente muy transitada; con estos financiamientos logró comprar una máquina industrial para seguir trabajando de manera independiente. Su negocio es la línea femenina, especialmente blusas, y la fabricación de  multiusos. 
En la actualidad solicita un crédito por valor de $1.500.000  para comprar telas por rollos y elaborar blusas y multiusos sobre pedidos. Su meta es ampliarlo y mudarlo en un local simultáneamente  vender sus prendas terminadas, para lograr  también lo que se ha propuesto.
texts.en:
For the past 21 years, Sonia Gómez (age 54) has been engaged in productive activities within the apparel business. She is a responsible mother of two children, who are now 24 and 30 years of age.

Her business started when she began receiving contracts to produce clothing for important customers and a few housewives. She also started sewing for neighbors, friends, and relatives on an informal basis. The sales from these two businesses were important for her success, but unfortunately they went bankrupt. Sonia was greatly depressed by her significantly low sales and had to temporarily live off of her savings. Fueled by the love of her family, she started a new job working for a designer and afterwards became independent a few years later with the help of the loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Upon her return, she named her business “Sonia’s Apparel”, which is located in the neighborhood of Recreo, a busy commercial area in the city of Barranquilla. With these loans she was able to buy an industrial machine that allowed her to continue working independently. Her business now produces a line of clothing for women, including blouses and multi-purpose outfits.

The current loan she is requesting is in the amount of 1,500,000 COP and will be used to buy rolls of fabric for making blouses and multi-purpose outfits to complete her orders. Her goal is to expand her business and move it to a storefront where she can also sell her finished items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rolls of fabric for manufacturing garments

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine O. is a 35 year-old business woman. She is married with five children and she has six dependents too. She is a resident of Unjuku upper village, Nebbi Town Council.

Christine owns a fashion and design boutique which has a tailoring school attached to it located along Uringi Road in Nebbi Town Council. She has been running the business for over ten years.

Christine will use her loan to purchase a new sewing machine and more fabrics (materials) to make dresses (clothes) for sale. Her dream is to expand her business to accommodate many customers.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and more fabric to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yorlady

texts.es:
Yorladys F. A. tiene 28 años y vive en Bosa Brasil, barrio de  la linda capital de Colombia: Bogotá; ella y a su  marido  siempre han estados encaminados en los negocios, porque son muy emprendedores, saben trabajar y  viven impulsado por su progreso y el de su hijos de 7 y 1 año de edad  respectivamente.
Yorladys no importa lo que haga siempre lo hace con mucho profesionalismo, por eso ha tenido muchos negocios,  desde los más sencillos como servicios de telefonía, dulcería, hasta unidades de producción de comidas rápidas, pero siempre está buscando un ingreso más a su familia. 
Desde hace dos años trabaja al lado de su marido, con el que aparece en la fotografía, y unidos ofrecen servicios de salud oral, especialmente trabajos de prótesis a domicilio, pero ella aún no ha dejado de ser comerciante, porque vende productos varios mediante catálogos.  En la actualidad quiere fortalecer el negocio que ahora desarrolla con su esposo y necesita un crédito para adecuar un local donde ofrecer los servicios de salud oral, con ello estaría empezando a hacer real el sueño de que su esposo y ella  tengan un consultorio y tabjen unidos en un punto fijo; mas adelante tiene un gran desafío y es trabajar arduamente  para  adquirir una casa propia que le ofrezca estabilidad familiar.
texts.en:
Yorladys F. A. is 28 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Bosa Brasil, which is located in Bogota, the beautiful capital of Colombia. She and her husband have always focused their energies on their businesses because they are enterprising individuals who know how to work and make progress in their lives. They have two children, ages 7 and 1 respectively.

No matter what she does, Yorladys has always conducted herself with great professionalism in her many businesses. From the simplest ventures such as providing phone service and making candy to managing a production line serving fast food, she always looks for ways to generate extra income for her family.

For the past two years, Yorladys has worked with her husband (who also appears in the photo) in providing dental services, specifically manufacturing dental prosthetics in their home. However, she continues her work as a merchant, selling various products through catalogs. At the moment, she wants to strengthen her husband’s practice by requesting a loan to secure a location where they can offer dental services. This would fulfill their dream of having an office where they could work together in an established area. The greatest challenge ahead of them is to continue working hard so that they can acquire a home and establish some stability for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Secure a location for her husband's dental practice

Patrick O. is a 38 year-old business man. He is married with three children and he also has five more dependents, of whom four are in school. He is a resident of Akesi village, Nebbi Town Council.

Patrick owns a retail shop business which he has been running for over three years. He will use his loan to purchase retail shop items such as biscuits, toilet papers, soap, salt, packed milk, sugar, drinks and so forth, to sell.

His future hope is to enlarge his shop for more profits.

He deals with a retail shop business and he has been in this business for over ten years.

He will use his loan to purchase more retail items such as soap, salt, rice, tooth paste, sugar, and so forth, to sell and meet his customers’ demand. His future hope is to extend his market.

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.es:
José Miguel A. A.  tiene 36 años, es casada,  tiene  1 hijos de 8 meses de edad, se llaman Kevin,  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y pastoreo de ganado bovino.
José trabaja en la agricultura toda su vida como principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son las papas, trigo, maíz, arbeja.   Vende los productos en los mercados de San Miguel y Guaranda, también vende en la comunidad cuando llegan los comerciantes. 
José solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y abonos químicos para la siembra de sus cultivos.  Su meta es de comprar más terreno para seguir sembrando y mejorar su forma de vida y de sus hijos.   Los desafíos que enfrenta son que cuando llueve mucho puede perder sus cultivos. José en sus tiempos libres le gusta pasar en unión de sus amigos de la comunidad.
texts.en:
José Miguel A. A. is 36 years old, married, and has an eight month old child named Kevin. He lives in the town of San Francisco de Rumí, which is 1½ hours from San Miguel Canton in the Province of Bolivar. José is a member of the Communal Bank “San Francisco de Rumí Pamba”. The group consists of 25 members, most of whom are engaged in agriculture. José has been farming all of his life as the main source of income for his family. Among the crops grown in the area are potatoes, wheat, corn, and peas. He sells his products in the markets of San Miguel and Guaranda, as well as to merchants who pass through the community. José is requesting a loan to buy compost and chemical fertilizers for his crops. His goal is to buy more land so that he can continue planting crops and improving his children’s way of life. The challenges he faces include dealing with those instances when too much rain can ruin his crops. In his free time, José enjoys visiting with his friends in the community.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a 50-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and two children. Both he and his wife work to support the family. He has been working as a car electrician since 1990. He has a store that he rents for his work. Many people in Lebanon buy cars second-hand, so there is a constant need for reliable repairmen like this Kiva borrower.

He is requesting a loan of $1,200 to make needed purchases for his work. This will be his third loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To make needed purchases for his auto-repair work

loans.name: José Agnelio

texts.es:
José Agnelio P. U.  tiene 32 años, es soltero, no tiene  hijos,  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
José trabaja en la agricultura  a partir de los 18 años y es su  principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son las papas, trigo, maíz.   Vende los productos en los mercados de San Miguel y en su comunidad cuando llegan los comerciantes. 
José solicita el crédito para comprar abonos químicos para sus cultivos.  Su meta es de obtener una buena cosecha y mejorar su forma de vida de su familia.   Los desafíos que enfrenta son precios baratos en tiempos de cosechas. José en sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar voleibol.
texts.en:
José Agnelio P. U. is 32 years old, single, and does not have children. He lives in the town of San Francisco de Rumí, which is 1½ hours from San Miguel Canton in the Province of Bolivar.

José is a member of the Communal Bank “San Francisco de Rumí Pamba”. The group consists of 25 members, most of whom are engaged in agriculture. José has been farming for 18 years as the main source of income for his family. Among the crops grown in the area are potatoes, wheat, and corn. He sells his products at the markets in San Miguel and to merchants who pass through the community.

José is requesting a loan to buy chemical fertilizers for his crops. His goal is to achieve a good harvest and improve his family’s way of life. José challenges include dealing with low market prices during harvest time. In his free time, he enjoys playing volleyball.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a 35-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and child. Both she and her husband work to support the family. She has been working as a farmer since 2007. She owns the land she works on. Although women entrepreneurs are still in the minority in Lebanon, their presence is continuously growing. Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. offers special incentives to loan officers who recruit female clients.

She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a water tank for her farm. This will be her first loan from Ameen. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in her picture, not indicating her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase a water tank for her farm

loans.name: Joffre Andrubal

texts.es:
Joffre Andrubal A. P.  tiene 23 años, es soltero,  tiene 3  hijos, Kimberly de 5 años, Juan  de 3 y  Sebastián de año 7 meses,  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Joffre trabaja en la agricultura  y es su  principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son las papas, cebada, arbeja, trigo, maíz.   Vende los productos en los mercados de Guaranda. 
Joffre solicita el crédito para comprar abonos químicos para sus cultivos.  Su meta es de obtener una buena cosecha y mejorar su forma de vida de sus hijos.   Los desafíos que enfrenta son demanda de productos y baja de precios en el mercado. Joffre en sus tiempos libres les ayuda a realizar los deberes a su hijo Sebastián.
texts.en:
Joffre Andrubal A. P. is 23 years old, single, and has three children: 5-year old Kimberly, 3-year old Juan, and 7-month old Sebastian. They all live in the San Francisco de Rumì precinct, about an hour and a half from the San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar County. Joffre is a member of the rural bank, San Francisco de Rumí pamba, which is composed of 25 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture. Joffre works in agriculture and is the main breadwinner in his family. The most popular crops in the area are potatoes, barley, peas, wheat, and corn. He sells his products at the Guaranda market. Joffre is seeking out a loan in order to be able to purchase chemical fertilizers for his cultivations. His objective is to obtain a better harvest so that he can improve his children's quality of living. The challenges that he faces are the increase in product demand and the lowering of market prices. During his free time, he helps care for his baby son, Sebastián.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chemical fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a 37-year-old single man. He is living with one parent and one sibling. All three household members work to support the family’s expenses. He has owned his own bakery since 2008. He has to pay the “new” rent for his business, which is significantly more than that of long-time business owners, who have benefited from extremely low rent costs. 

This borrower is requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to invest in two machines for his work. One will help in mixing the flour and water and the other will help roll out the dough and make it flat. In Lebanon, there are many small shops to buy fresh bread and homemade Lebanese “pizzas” called “manouche.” These foods are especially popular for breakfast or as a snack. 

This will be his second loan from Ameen. He demonstrated consistent and on-time payments during his last loan cycle.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To invest in two machines for his bakery work

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria, trabaja en su casa elaborando pintado en tela, el mismo le ayuda a poder solventarse en los gastos de alimentación y estudios de sus hijos, ya que esta separada de su esposo.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Villa San Antonio alto de la ciudad de la Paz en casa alquilada.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de tela, compra de pintura y otros).
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro,  con este crédito le podrá comprar mercadería y mejorar sus costos por compras.
texts.en:
Maria works out of her home, painting canvasses, which helps her pay her and her children's food and study costs. She is separated from her husband. She lives in the Villa San Antonio area, above the city of La Paz, in a rented house. This is her first loan with Impro, and she plans to use it as capital towards her work: the purchase of canvasses, paints, etc. With this credit, she would also be able to purchase materials and improve her sale costs.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of canvasses and paints for her pieces of art.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a 61-year-old, married man. He lives with his wife and child. Both he and his child work to support the family. He has been selling vegetables from his truck to customers in his region since 1970. Lebanon is rich in its agricultural products and it is common to find vendors selling fresh fruits and vegetables throughout the country. This borrower is requesting a loan of $700 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to make much needed repairs to his work vehicle so that he can better serve his customers. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please follow this link

loans.use: to make repairs to his work vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more dried bush meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 2 new computers for his accounting business

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo Manuel R. C.  tiene 23 años, es soltero,  no tiene  hijos, Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Segundo trabaja en la agricultura  y es su  principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son las papas, trigo, maíz.   Vende los productos en los mercados de Guaranda. 
Segundo solicita el crédito para comprar insumos de herbicidas  para sus cultivos.  Su meta fijada es de obtener un vehículo, para poder trasladar sus productos a los mercados.   Los desafíos que enfrenta son el temor a que bajen los precios de sus producciones. Segundo en sus tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música y bailar
texts.en:
Manuel R. C. the Second is 23 years old, single, and has no children. He lives in the San Francisco de Rumí pamba precinct about an hour and a half from the San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar County. He is a member of the rural bank, San Francisco de Rumí pamba, which is composed of 25 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture. Manuel works in agriculture and is the main breadwinner in his family. The most popular crops in the area are potatoes, wheat, and corn. He sells his products at the Guaranda market. Manuel is seeking a credit to be able to purchase herbicides for his cultivations. His goal is to be able to buy a vehicle with which he could use to transport his products to the markets. One of the challenges that he faces are his fear that the prices of his products will lower. During his free time, Manuel likes to listen to music and dance.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase herbicides for his cultivations.

loans.name: Damacline

texts.en:
Damacline is 21 years old and is single.  She has been running a salon where she also sells beauty products for one year. She is also employed as a baby-sitter in a nursery. She was previously working as a home-help. 


She joined Hongera group in Faulu Kenya so that she could easily access financial support.  She wants to take out her first loan from Faulu Kenya.  She wants to add stock of braids, cosmetics, lotions, chemicals and weaves.  She hopes to open up a wholesale cosmetics shop in the future.  She describes herself as honest and hardworking.

loans.use: To add stock of braids, cosmetics, lotions, chemicals and weaves

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a 23-year-old, single man. He is living with 6 family members: his parents and 4 siblings. Three of his siblings are not working. He has been running a ladies beauty salon since 2004.  

He is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. This will be his first loan from Ameen. He is planning to use the loan to enhance his salon’s décor as well as purchase new merchandise for his work. 

Note: Based on the politicA. and sociA. challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: to decorate his salon and purchase new merchandise

loans.name: Herminda Rosa

texts.es:
Cuando en Altos D. San Pedro Mártir,  barrio ubicado en L. ciudad D. Cartagena,  preguntan por arreglo D. ropa, es muy bien sabido que donD. Candelaria Jiménez D. Castro, L. señora que tiene un miscelánea y venD. detalles para el hogar y productos D. ferretería, también ofrecen este servicio y saben que es muy responsable en el cuidado D. L. prenda. 

El negocio D. candelaria es vender detalles para toda ocasión, especialmente accesorios para niñas y mercancía D. ferretería, pero también se dedica a  L. costura y reparación D. prendas D. vestir; justamente está solicitando a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo su segundo crédito por valor D. $2.200.000 comprar una maquina D. coser con el fin D. no seguir utilizando L. máquina D. su vecina.

Al principio Candelaria una minitienda en el barrio  Blas D. Lezo donD. vendía refrescos, víveres y abarrotes  al detal. Al principio se vinculo a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  en el programa D. grupos solidarios donD. demostró ser un cliente muy solidario y cumplido en sus pagos.  Actualmente se encuentra vinculada en el programa D. microempresas  donD. ya tiene 2 créditos individuales que le han servido  para aumentar su capital D. trabajo y adquirir muebles y enseres; elL. dice: “Mi vida ha cambiado muchísimo  ya que he tenido L. oportunidad D. crecer con mi empresa y tener una gran visión empresarial, L. cual me ha permitido aplicarL.  en mi hogar  y D. esta forma organizarme mas con mi familia y hacerL. mas  participe en mi negocio”.Su meta y mayor desafío inmediato es organizarlo físicamente en su vivienda y siente que va a lograrlo con el respaldo D. su familia.

Candelaria Jiménez es una mujer  que ha crecido como persona y emprendedora a L. vez porque  participa D. muchas actividades formativas, tanto en el plano administrativo como en el mejoramiento del oficio con instituciones que en su barrio, trabajan en  beneficio D. sus habitantes.
texts.en:
Anyone in Altos D. San Pedro Mártir, Cartagena, who is looking for a smart new outfit will know who to go to: Candelaria Jiménez D. Castro, who offers these services out of her small store in which she also sells decorative household items and other products. Candelaria sells items for every occasion, especially accessories for girls, alongsiD. hardware products, but also has a true flair for sewing and repairing garments. For this reason she is seeking another small loan of $2,200,000 Colombian pesos from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy her very own sewing machine, so she is not totally reliant on using her neighbor's machine. At first Candelaria had a tiny store in the Blas D. Lezo neighborhood where she sold soft drinks, staples and foodstuffs. Then she became a member of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and has proven to be very responsible in managing and paying off small loans. Two prior micro-loans have allowed her to increase her working capital and acquire needed furniture and other items; she notes that “my life has changed since I've had the opportunity to grow my own business and develop an entreprenueurial vision, extending this to my home and organizing greater participation of my family in running the business." She is fully confident that she can better organize the store's infrastructure with the help of her family. Candelaria Jiménez has grown immensely from her community activities, both in her administrative acumen as also in her efforts to improve conditions in her neighborhood, to the benefit of the entire community.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: God Bless You Group

texts.en:
Martha D. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Bless You. She is 63 years old and a widow with five children who range from 15 to 21 years old. She also cares for two nephews. Martha did not have the opportunity to go to school due to poverty.

For 20 years, she has been selling slippers at the Rally Town market in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. Martha started by selling petty goods and fish but has been facing problems with low funds to do business and she lacks a sponsor. She places her goods in an orderly manner in order to keep customers returning.

Martha plans to use her 20,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 80,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to purchase more slippers to improve her business. Her goals and dreams are to improve her business by building a shop and to build a house for her children.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Martha is holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase more slippers to improve her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower from Lebanon is a 30-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two children. She has been running a clothing and lingerie shop out of her home since 2007. She has completed her studies through the middle school level. 

She is requesting a $700 loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to further expand her business and increase her selection of merchandise. This will be her first loan from Ameen. Although women entrepreneurs are still in the minority in Lebanon, their presence is continuously growing. Ameen s.a.l. offers special incentives to loan officers who recruit female clients.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in her picture, not indicating her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: Expand her business and increase her inventory

loans.name: Fidelis

texts.en: Fidelis is a 53-year-old dairy farmer.  She is married and has four school-going children.  She has been involved in commercial farming for four years.  She belongs to a group of farmers called Gathiraini B farmers.  The group members supply their milk to a milk processing factory and meet on a weekly basis to save their money.  They also support each other by being guarantors whenever a member takes out a loan.  In this way Fidelis can easily get a loan from Faulu Kenya. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a dairy cow.  She hopes to become a large scale farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower from Lebanon is a 39-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and three children. He is the only income provider for his household. He has been working as a construction worker specializing in bricks and stones for the past ten years. He has one person who works with him part-time. He works on a freelance basis, which makes him flexible to serve customers in his region. 

He is requesting a loan of $1,200 from the Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase new tools for his construction work. He estimates that he will increase his profit by 15% after taking this loan. This will be his second loan from Ameen. He was a reliable client for his last loan with only one late payment. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a 19-year-old young woman. She is married and lives with her husband. She and her husband are both working to support their household. She has an undergarment and lingerie shop in her home. She has been selling goods from her home since 2007. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to increase her inventory. 

Women entrepreneurs are still in the minority in Lebanon, but they are gaining a greater presence in the country’s labor market. Ameen s.a.l. offers additional incentives to loan officers for offering micro-loans to prospective clients as well for recruiting female clients. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. loans.use: Increase inventory for her store

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 43 years old and married to a businesswoman. They are blessed with five children.  For the past twenty years, he has been doing tailoring to earn a living.  He mainly makes trousers and shorts to sell.  He uses his income to pay his one employee and to support his family.  

He is in the Dafulos group in Faulu Kenya where he saves part of his income weekly.  Through this, he has been able to invest in his business and stabilize it.  He is also able to pay school fees for his four school-going children.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Faulu Kenya.  With this loan, he wants to buy an overlock (serger) machine and buy fabric for making clothes.  He hopes to open up another shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy an overlock machine and fabric

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a single 33-year-old woman. She has three other family members in her house, two of whom are also working. She has owned a beauty salon since 2000. She also sells lingerie from this location. 

She is requesting a loan of $1000 from the Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. This will be her third loan from Ameen. Because she had to rely on her sister for a ride, she faced some challenges to complete her previous loan payments on time. She is planning to use this loan to increase her inventory.

Women entrepreneurs are still in the minority in Lebanon, but they are gaining a greater presence in the country’s labor market. Ameen s.a.l. offers additional incentives to loan officers for offering micro-loans to prospective clients as well for recruiting female clients.

This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a 28-year-old single woman. She lives with one parent and her four siblings. She and three of her siblings work to support the family. She has been raising cattle since 2008. She is able to produce enough milk from the cattle to sell. She has completed her education through middle school. 

She is requesting a loan of $1,000 from the Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. to purchase food for her cattle. This will be her first loan from Ameen. 

Although women entrepreneurs are still in the minority in Lebanon, their presence is continuously growing. Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. offers speciA. incentives to loan officers who recruit female clients.

loans.name: Segundo Héctor

texts.es:
Segundo Héctor A. H.  tiene 64 años, es casado,  tiene 5 hijos, Bolivia de 31 años, Marithza de 26, Edwin de 24, Joffre de 23 y Mayra de 18 años Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Segundo trabaja en la agricultura  y es su  principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son las papas, trigo, cebada,  maíz.   Vende los productos en la comunidad a los comerciantes que van a la zona. 
Segundo solicita el crédito para comprar insumos químicos para sus sembrios.  Su meta es de mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.   Los desafíos que enfrenta es vender todos los productos que se siembra. Segundo en sus tiempos libres les la  consejos de buena conducta a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Segundo is 64 years old, married, and has 5 children - 31 year-old Bolivia, 26 year-old Marithza, 24 year-old Edwin, 23 year-old Joffre, and 18 year-old Mayra. They live in the neighborhood of San Francisco de Rumí Pamba, an hour and a half from Cantón San Miguel in Bolivar province. Segundo is a member of the rural loan group "San Francisco de Rumi Pamba", which is composed of 25 members in total, of whom the majority are farmers. Segundo works in agriculture, and this is the primary source of income for his family. Among the most outstanding crops of his area are potatoes, wheat, barley, and corn. He sells his produce in the community to the traders who are in the area. Segundo is requesting a loan to buy chemical inputs for his crops. His goal is to improve his family's standard of living and to see his children become professionals. One of the challenges that he faces is to sell all the produce that he grows. In his free time he teaches his children to live good lives.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chemical inputs for his crops

loans.name: Love-Kebbeh Group

texts.en:
Kebbeh S. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Kebbeh-Love. She is 48 years old, married, and has six children who range from 15 to 7 years old. She did not attend school due to poverty.

For 25 years, she has been selling rice, palm oil and fish at Crozeiville Market, White Plains, outside Monrovia, Liberia. She sells in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning. 
 
She plans to use her 7,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 35,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more palm oil, rice and fish. Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kebbeh is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil, rice and fish.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 48 years old, married and has three children between the ages of 35 and 22 years.  Joel runs Musimamo Tailoring Shop and has two employees.  He has been in this business since 1979.  He has also been practicing dairy farming for a living.  

He joined Nyamu group in Faulu Kenya, and since then he has been able to buy a dairy cow.  This is because he previously took out a loan from Faulu Kenya and was guaranteed by the group members. 

He has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Faulu Kenya to buy a sewing machine and fabric.  He hopes to become financially stable and own a piece of land in the future.  He says that he is determined to achieve his dreams in life.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Roberto Freddy

texts.es:
Roberto 31 años de edad, es conviviente vive en casa de sus padres con su pareja y sus 
2 menores hijos. Roberto se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte en su vehiculo 
propio una mototaxi la cual adquirió hace 2 años. El ya posee experiencia en el 
negocio y les brinda a los clientes buen trato y seguridad. Roberto tiene el anhelo de 
poder construir su propia vivienda por eso es que además labora como repartidor para 
una conocida polleria de la ciudad. Roberto requiere el crédito para darle 
mantenimiento a su mototaxi y así no le genere tantos gastos.
texts.en:
Roberto, age 31, is in a common law marriage. He lives in his parents’ house with his life partner and their two minor children. Roberto provides transportation services. He uses his own vehicle, a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle), which he got two years ago. He has experience in this business, and he gives his clients good service and safety. Roberto’s goal is to be able to build his own house. That is why he also works as a delivery man for a well known poultry store in the city. Roberto needs the loan to perform maintenance on his mototaxi. That way it will not generate so many expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance on his mototaxi

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a 41-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and one child. He is the only income provider for his household. He has been working as an electrician since 1993. He works independently, which gives him flexibility to visit customers at their homes or businesses. He has completed his education through middle school.

He is requesting a loan of $1,200 from the Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to invest in new tools and equipment for his work. This will be his first loan from Ameen. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: to invest in new tools and equipment

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 29 years old and married to a businesswoman.  He has been operating John’s Music Shop for four years.  Formerly he operated another retail shop.  John decided to employ two people in his shop so that he could get time to run his Bodaboda (motorbike transport) business.  

John and his friends came up with a group and joined Faulu Kenya so that they could get financial support.  In this group, he is able to save his money on a weekly basis and he can be guaranteed a loan by his group members.  

He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Faulu Kenya.  He wants to use this loan to add to his stock of DVDs, cassettes and video tapes to sell.

loans.use: To buy DVDs, cassettes and video tapes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a 22-year-old single man. He lives with his two parents and three siblings. Only he and one parent work to support the family. He has been working as a construction worker since 2005. He specializes in cement work. He travels to different sites to serve his clients. 

He is requesting a loan of $1000 from the Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. He will use the loan to invest in cement and other materials for his work. This will be his first loan from Ameen. He estimates that his profits will increase by about 25% after taking the loan.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him  (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.). Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: to invest in cement and other materials

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 49 years old and married with three children.  He has been selling scrap metals and grass hay to earn a living.  He has been doing this work for the past ten years.  Daniel is able to sell hay because he is surrounded by many livestock farmers. He likes his work very much because it is aimed at keeping the environment clean and safe by recycling waste materials such as scrap metals.  He is also involved in dairy farming. 

He joined a group in Faulu Kenya so that he can access financial support.  He has been an active member of the group and has been consistent in paying back the loans he gets from Faulu Kenya.  For this reason, he has been guaranteed by his group members another loan of 90,000 KES.  He plans to buy more hay and scrap metals to sell.

Daniel appreciates that he has been able to educate his children and that he has been able to add more dairy cows on his farm through Faulu Kenya.

loans.use: To buy hay and scrap metals to resell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a 46-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and child. Both he and his wife work to support the family. He has owned his own mini-market since 1997. These small stores are common throughout Lebanon and can be found in almost every neighborhood. 

He has requested a loan of $1000 from the Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to increase his store’s inventory. This will be his first loan from Ameen. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profit by 15%.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: Nancy Maribel

texts.es:
Nancy Maribel C. Y.  tiene 19 años, es soltera, no tiene hijos  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
Ella es socia  miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Nancy trabaja en la agricultura toda su vida, como  fuente económica principal de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona es: maíz, papas.   Vende los productos en la ciudad de Guaranda cada cosecha.
Nancy solicita el crédito para comprar ureas, abonos, semillas y fertilizantes.  Su meta es  mejorar sus terrenos ya que esto le generará mayores ingresos económicos.   Los desafíos que enfrentan son que en tiempo de cosechas los precios se ponen muy bajos o existe riesgo de perder la producción. Nancy manifiesta que ayuda en sus momentos libres a su madre en quehaceres del hogar  y cuando no hay mucho trabajo sale a pasear en San Miguel.
texts.en:
Nancy is 19 years old, single, and does not have any children. She lives in the neighborhood of San Francisco de Rumí Pamba, an hour and a half from Cantón San Miguel in Bolivar province. Nancy is a member of the rural loan group "San Francisco de Rumi Pamba", which is composed of 25 members in total, of whom the majority are farmers. Nancy has worked in agriculture all her life, and this is the primary source of income for her family. Among the most outstanding crops of her area are: corn and potatoes. Every harvest time, she sells her produce in the city of Guaranda. Nancy is requesting a loan to buy urea soil additive, fertilizers, and seeds. Her goal is to improve her land so that it will bring her greater income. One of the challenges that she faces is that at harvest time the price of produce is very low. There is also a risk of loosing her crop. Nancy says that in her free time she helps her mother with the household chores and when there isn't much work to do she goes out for a stroll in San Miguel.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Urea soil additives, fertilizer, and seeds

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah is married with seven children and all her children go to school.  She resides in and owns a three-room house where she stays with nine people. Hadjah doesn’t take care of additional family members. Hadjah is a market vendor in Kawempe market. Hadjah owns a stall selling bananas. She wants to use this loan of 500,000/= to buy more bunches of bananas from Mbarara in southern Uganda. Hadjah has been in this business for four years and with MCDT for eight years now. Hadjah sells to all categories of people at retail and at wholesale. She works seven days week. Her business challenges include transportation of bananas from Mbarara to her stall in Kawempe and the rainy season. Hadjah‘s business aspiration is to start bringing a lorry full of bananas. She decided to work with MCDT to get enough capital for her business without collateral security.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 52 years old, married to a farmer and has one child.  She runs a poultry farm to earn a living and is on her second year in this business.  She also does dairy farming to earn extra income.  Previously she raised vegetables.  

Mary joined Faulu Kenya in the New Beginning group after being introduced by a friend.  As a member of the group, she has been guaranteed a loan of 30,000 KES from Faulu Kenya.  With this loan, she plans to buy chicks under 10 days old.  She hopes to become a wholesale farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy chicks

loans.name: Segundo Gerardo

texts.es:
Segundo Gerardo M. C. tiene 27 años, es soltero, tiene 2 hijos que se llaman: Samid de 5 años, Shelmy de 6 años.  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba ubicado a una hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Segundo trabaja en la agricultura.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son el maíz, trigo, cebada.   Vende los productos en el cantón San Miguel.
Segundo solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes e insumos químicos  para sus cultivos.  Su meta es construir una casa y mejorar la situación económica. Los desafíos que enfrentan son los cambios climáticos que pueden perjudicar sus sembrios. Segundo  manifiesta que solicitó antes un crédito y lo utilizo para pagar a los peones de los trabajos de agricultura realizados. Segundo manifiesta que en  su comunidad festejan las fiestas del carnaval y los jueves sale a la feria a San Miguel.
texts.en:
Segundo is 27 years old, single, and has two children called Samid (who is 5 years old) and Shelmy (who is 6). They live in the neighborhood of San Francisco de Rumí Pamba, located an hour and a half from Cantón San Miguel in Bolivar province. Segundo is a member of the rural loan group "San Francisco de Rumi Pamba", which is composed of 25 members in total, of whom the majority are farmers. Segundo works in agriculture. Among the most outstanding crops of his area are corn, wheat, and barley. He sells his produce in the town of San Miguel. Segundo is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and chemical inputs for his crops. His goals are to build a house and improve his economic situation. One of the challenges he faces is that climate changes could hurt his crops. Segundo says that he previously requested a loan and used it to pay laborers for agricultural work they had done. He says that in his community they celebrate carnival and that on Thursdays he goes out to the San Miguel fair.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, and chemical inputs for his crops

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 38 years old and married with four school-going children.  She operates a retail shop where she sells maize, beans, green grams (mung beans) and rice.  She also runs a posho mill (for grinding maize into flour) to earn extra income. Her family is her priority and therefore she works hard to provide for the family.  

She was introduced to Faulu Kenya by her friend and she is an active member of the Elim Self Help Group.  She attends their weekly meetings and pays her dues consistently.  Because of this, the group members have guaranteed her a loan of 30,000 KES from Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to expand her business and employ more people.

loans.use: To buy more cereals to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella S. is a 68-year-old widow. She is the mother of two grown children. Angella delights in offering community service and that has been her passion. She runs a primary school in Mombasa and has been in operation for six years. 

Angella was introduced to KADET by a friend and is now accessing her first loan. She plans to purchase new chairs and desks for the school. The children served are mainly from the Buxton community and enjoy the services they receive. Angella hopes to improve the education standards of the children in the community.

loans.use: To purchase new chairs and desks for the school.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick O. is a 26-year-old single father of one child, who is going to early primary school. He operates a retail shop in Mombasa's Mikoroshoni area and his business is three years old. Patrick serves the area residents and households that are near his shop.

He was introduced to KADET by a group member and is now taking out his first loan. With this 20,000 KES loan, he plans to re-stock his shop with foodstuffs like rice, maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil. He also wants to make renovations to his store. 

Patrick supplements his income from his rental houses located in Majaoni, Mombasa. He hopes to expand and own more rental houses, as the demand for housing in the area is high.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to sell and to make renovations to his store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with six children and two of her children go to school. Rose takes care of additional family members. She deals in local gin, which she gets from the districts of Fort Portal, Kasese, Kabarole and Kyenjojo in southwestern Uganda.  She uses public transport to and from buying local gin  (alcohol). She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of local gin. She has been in this business for 20 years. Besides this liquor business, she also owns rental rooms near her home. Rose sells at wholesale only. Rose works seven days a week. Her business challenges include transportation and the rainy season. She aspires to buy a plot of land and build other rental houses. She joined MCDT because it was near home.

loans.use: To buy more local gin (alcohol)

loans.name: Villa Quiquijana Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VILLA QUIQUIJANA”; Nuestros socios vives en el distrito de Quiquijana perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Honorata; la socia tiene 44 años de edad es natural de Acopata, situado a 10 minutos del distrito de Quiquijana, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 pequeños hijos, Nuestra socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella vende lanas y tintes vegetales; desde hace 6 años atrás, en el distrito de Quiquijana todos los domingos y en las fiestas patronales, Nuestra socia también pertenece al programa juntos, ella participa de este programa de desarrollo con su comunidad campesina, para buscar oportunidades de desarrollo personal, la socia también cría pollos, cuyes y chanchos, ella y su conyugue tienen terrenos de cultivos en los cuales siembran variedades de papa, maíz y habas, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lana de oveja y tintes para teñir las lanas.  

Nuestros socios en su mayoría son agricultores y ganaderos, otros venden granos secos y compra y venta de animales menores y vacunos.

Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partners belong to the Villa Quiquijana village bank and live in the Quiquijana distsrict in the Quispicanchis province of Cusco, Peru. One of the members is Honorata who is 44 years old and a native of Acopata, a city 10 minutes from Quiquijana. She lives with her partner with whom she has 2 small children. For the past 6 years, she has worked as a retail saleswoman selling wool and vegetable dyes in Quiquijana on Sundays and on the holidays of various patron saints. She also belongs to the "Together" program, a program designed to help rural women find opportunities for personal development. She also raises chicken, guinea pigs, and pigs. She and her partner have land where they grow potatoes, corn and beans. She is seeking this loan to buy wool and dye for the wool. The other group members work primarily in agriculture and raising cattle; others sell dried grain and buy and sell small animals. They are grateful for the support they will receive through these loans and commit to pay their debts on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool and dye for the wools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is a 48-year-old cobbler who makes and repairs shoes at his shop in a busy market area of Serem in Rongai.  He is married with five children, two sons between 20 and 25 years old, and three daughters between 11 and 23 years old.  He has been in business for ten years and does work for schools, factories, and local people.  

Festus plans to use his 40,000 KES loan to purchase more raw materials like leather and soles.  He successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 KES.

His primary challenges are competition (many cobblers in the market) and traveling a long distance to purchase raw materials in Nairobi (8-9 hour bus ride each way).  For additional income and food, he also does farming of vegetables, beans, and maize.

In the future, Festus hopes to buy a car for personal and business use, and to build a nice home for his family to have a comfortable life.  In five years, he wants to open a big wholesale shop to serve different markets in the area.  He describes himself as hard-working, courageous, and generous.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials like leather and soles

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 36-year-old man who grows tomatoes, cabbage, spinach and kale on his farm.  He is married and has two daughters, 4 and 11 years old.  He has been farming for eight years and employs one other person.  He sells his produce at the local market.  His primary challenge is lack of funds to buy farm implements.  Before farming, he bought and sold beans and maize for seven years.  In addition to farming, Samuel's family has a small boutique shop.

In the future, Samuel hopes to build a greenhouse and a good house for his family.  In five years, he hopes to be a successful manager of his farm and to have built a large storage facility for temporary storage of farm produce.  Samuel describes himself as disciplined and organized.  He sets goals and fully commits his efforts to achieve them.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seed, and farm implements

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 36-year-old man who grows tomatoes, spinach, cabbage and other vegetables. He is married and has a three-year-old son. He has been farming for fifteen years and employs one other person on his farm in Kiseriain in Rongai. One of his challenges is transportation since his farm is about five kilometers off the main road. For other sources of income, Peter raises chickens for sale and has a motorbike taxi.

He wants to use the 20,000 KES loan to buy fertilizer, seed, and a spray pump so that he can get the best crop yield.

In the future, Peter hopes to diversify his income to include raising animals. He wants be a successful farmer and own a large-scale farm. He describes himself as a risk-taker hoping to get greater returns for his efforts.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seed, and a spray pump

loans.name: Juana Gloria

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE ECCE HOMO”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. JUANA,  ella tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 1 años de edad, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista. La socia envía pollos vivos al departamento de Puerto Maldonado; a su hermana mayor para que ella los venda y luego les envíe el dinero de retorno, Nuestra socia viene trabajando 1 años con la modalidad de bancos comunales; La socia también vende verduras su conyugue es obrero. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos, verduras y con una pequeña parte su conyugue comprara herramientas, nuevo serrucho y martillo. 

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner belongs to the Senor de Ecce Homo village bank and lives in the Huanchac district in Cusco, Peru. Her name is Juana and she is 24 years old and a single mother of two children, 1 and 3 years old. She works as a retail saleswoman sending live chickens to her sister in the department of Puerto Maldonado who sells them and then sends Juana her share of the money. She has worked with village banks for the past year. She also sells vegetables; her partner is a blue-collar worker. She is seeking a loan to purchase chickens, vegetables and with a small part for her partner, she will purchase tools, a new saw, and a hammer. She is grateful for the support she is receiving through this loan and commits to pay her debts on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens, vegetables, tools, a saw, and a hammer

loans.name: Lucky Group

texts.en:
Lucky M., the leader of a group of five borrowers called Lucky Group, is a 32-year-old single mother of three children, 12 and 13 years old. Lucky did not have the opportunity to go to school due to lack of financial support.

For the past three years she has been selling foodstuffs such as pepper, oil, salt and seasonings at the Old Road Community Market in Sinkor, Monrovia, Liberia. Lucky started selling with 1,200 Liberian Dollars as working capital that was given to her by a friend. She sells goods that customers demand in order to keep them returning. Lucky plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to purchase more seasonings, pepper, oil and salts, her ultimate goals being to own a shop and build a house for her family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Lucky is holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonings, pepper, oil and salts.

loans.name: Benigno

texts.es:
El señor Benigno R. vive en casa propia en la zona de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Benigno es albañil, realizando trabajos de construcción en viviendas particulares de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción del muro frontal de su vivienda, para darle seguridad a la misma.
Esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Benigno R. lives in his own home in the Llojeta area on the east side of the city of La Paz. He is a construction worker and generally works on individuals' homes in the city and uses that income to support himself. This loan will be used to build the front wall of his home to improve his home security. This is the second loan he has requested and the socioeconomic analysis performed after his first loan has qualified him to receive another.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a frontal wall for his home to provide better security

loans.name: Amos Group

texts.en:
Amos M. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Amos Group. He is 42 years old and single. Amos could not continue his education through 12th grade due to poverty, and he had to go into business to survive.
For the last four years, Amos has been selling provisions such as milk, sugar, margarine and Ovaltine at Clay Street, downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He started out selling water and foodstuffs, but faced problems with some goods that did not move fast on the Liberian market. He now sells goods that customers demand in order to keep them returning.
Amos plans to use his 8,000 LRD portion of this 40,000 LRD group loan to purchase more milk, sugar and margarine. His goal and dream is to improve his business so that he has a bigger store.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Amos is holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase more milk, sugar and margarine

loans.name: Leonor Narcisa

texts.es:
Leonor A. de 45 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas, es divorciada, pero tiene cuatro hijos que ya están casados. Vive sola en su casa de cemento, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. 

Leonor empezó a ser comerciante desde muy joven ya que toda su familia es comerciante ella también quiso ser igual y tener sus propios ingresos. Invirtió sus ahorros en ropa, perfumes, cremas, artículos de hogar etc. Trabaja también como vendedora Yanbal (es una compañía que ayuda a las mujeres para que sean vendedoras de cosméticos y ganen un porcentaje de comisiones). 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes y ropa para tener mas variedad en lo que vende. En el futuro quiere comprar un carro para llevar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Leonor Arguelllo is 45 years old and lives in the urban area in Las Orquideas; she is divorced and has four children who are all married. She lives in a cement home which has basic services (water, electricity, etc.). Leonor began as a saleswoman when she was very young as her whole family works in sales and she wanted to do the same to earn her own income. She invested her savings in clothing, perfumes, creams, and home products. She also works selling Yanbal (a company that helps women to sell cosmetics and earn a commission). She will use this loan to buy perfumes and clothing to have a greater variety of products to sell. In the future, she would like to buy a car to carry her merchandise to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perfume, clothing

loans.name: Chicas Superpoderosas Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal CHICAS SUPER PODEROSAS, en su Secuencia 4, está formado por 10 personas, 9 mujeres y 1 varón, la mayoría D. las socias pertenecen a la Zona D. Alto San Isidro, que están ubicados cerca D. la parada D. minibuses 211,  las socias se dedican a la venta D. ropa, costura y venta D. polleras, repostería y también hay una trabajadora  del hogar, etc. En la secuencia anterior todas cancelaron muy bien, además adelantaron por un día el último pago, no tuvieron problemas D. mora en ninguno D. sus pagos son socias que se conocen muy bien.

La Sra. Gabriela es la representante, actualmente toma el cargo D. la presidenta del banco se dedica a la venta D. ropa por la calle Tumusla, cuenta con esta actividad hace 1 año, el préstamo será destinado a incrementar su capital.  Tiene un hijo con el señor Jhonny, el cual es su concubino. En su banco comunal se ha destacado como una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos, también fue anteriormente D. la mesa directiva, siendo una buena guía para su banco, con el dinero D. credito comprara mercaderia y asi poder incrementar su capital D. trabajo.

La Sra. Flora Socia que asume el cargo D. tesorera del banco, trabaja en una fotocopiadora cerca D. la universidad mayor D. San Andes hace 3 años, el préstamo esta destinado a la compra D. material D. escritorio papel en cantidad y tintas para la fotocopiadora que comparte con familiares. Casada con el señor Eusebio  tiene un hijo. Es una D. las representantes en su banco comunal, que ha sido elegida para el cargo por su  responsabilidad que ha demostrado dentro del banco como garante y como mesa directiva dentro D. la banca. 

El Sr. Fidel  es elegido como secretario, se dedica a la construcción D. viviendas, es albañil. El préstamo esta destinado para la compra D. herramientas para su trabajo, vive con su esposa Juana. Su meta es realizar contratos, como especie D. contratista ya que cuenta con gente que desea trabajar como albañiles y ayudantes.

Todas las socias son personas trabajadoras, estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Chicas Super Poderosas (Superpower Girls Community Bank) is presently in its 4th cycle, and it is composed of 10 people, 9 women and 1 man. The majority of the members live in the Alto San Isidro area, located close to the 211 minibus stop. The members sell a variety of things: clothes, dresses and skirts, cakes, and one is a maid. In the previous cycle all the members have been very punctual with their repayments, the last repayment was even maD. one day in advance with respect to the deadline, and none of them received a fine for belated repayments: these are indeed very well acknowledged entrepreneurs. Gabriela is their representative, she is now the president of the bank and sells clothes in Tumusla street. She has been running this business for 1 year, and the loan she is requesting will be used to increase her income. She has a child with her partner, Jhonny. In her Community Bank she has proven herself to be a responsible person, accurate with her payments; she was formerly employed in the directing board, where she proved to be a good guiD. for the bank. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products to increase her income. Flora is the treasurer, she has been working in a photocopy shop close to the San Andes main university for 3 years. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy office items, many reams of paper and inks for the photocopier she shares with some relatives. She is married with Eusebio and has a child. She is one of the representatives of her Community Bank, and she has been elected to the post for the responsibility she has shown in the bank as a guarantor and as part of the banks’ directing board. Fidel has been elected secretary: he builds houses, he is construction worker. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy tools for his job . He lives with his wife Juana, and he aims to sign contracts and to become a contractor, as he can count on people willing to work as builders and helpers. All the members are hard-working people, thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase their income.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es: EL SR. FRANKLIN TIENE UNA MOVILIDAD VAGONETA CON LA QUE TRABAJA COMO SERVICIO DE TAXI. SU ESPOSA, MAGALI, SE DEDICA A VENDER COSMETICOS A CREDITO Y ADEMAS SIGUE ESTUDIANDO EN LA UNIVERSIDAD Y LE FALTAN DOS AÑOS PARA TERMINAR SU CARRERA DE DERECHO. ELLOS TIENEN UNA HIJA EN EDAD ESCOLAR. VIVEN EN LA ZONA DE ALTO PAMPAHASI QUE ESTA A 25 MINUTOS DEL CENTRO DE LA CUIDAD. FRANKLIN TRABAJA COMO TAXISTA DESDE HACE SIETE AÑOS PERO YA ES UNA AÑO Y MEDIO QUE COMPRO SU VAGONETA Y ESTA MUY FELIZ YA QUE AHORA TIENE MAS TIEMPO PARA COMPARTIR CON SU FAMILIA. ÉL DESCANSA LOS DÍAS MARTES DEBIDO A QUE EN NUESTRA CUIDAD EXISTE UN REGLAMENTO QUE ORDENA QUE CADA MOVILIDAD TIENE RESTRICCION DE INGRESO AL CASCO URBANO CENTRAL UN DIA A LA SEMANA Y ESTE DÍA SE DESIGNA SEGUN EL NÚMERO DE PLACA DE CADA MOVILIDAD. ESTE DIA FRANKLIN APROVECHA PARA REALIZAR UN CONTROL A SU VAGONETA. ÉL TRBAJA CON NUESTRA INSTITUCION DESDE HACE VARIOS MESES EN LOS CUALES DEMOSTRO SER UN PERSONA PUNTUAL Y RESPONSABLE CON SUS PAGOS. EN ESTA OCACION SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA EL MANTENIMIENTO GENERAL DE SU VAGONETA.
texts.en:
Franklin owns a vehicle he uses to provide taxi services. His wife, Magali, who is still studying at the University and who will complete her Law Degree in two years, sells cosmetics on credit. They have a daughter of school age, and they live in the Alto Pampahasi area, 25 minutes from the city center. Franklin has been working as a taxi driver for seven years, but one and a half years ago he bought his own vehicle, and he is very happy because now he has more time to spend with his family. Tuesday is his established day off, as there is a rule in our town governing traffic according to which every car has no access to the urban area for one day of the week: the day is determined by each car’s license plate number. Franklin uses his day off to check his vehicle. He has been working with our institution for a few months, during which he has demonstrated being responsible man and accurate with his payments. In this occasion he is asking for a loan to provide for the general maintaining of his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: General maintenance of his vehicle

loans.name: Saturday Children Group

texts.en:
Saturday T. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Saturday Children. He is 35 years old, married, and has three children aged from 6 to 18 years old. Saturday did not have the opportunity to go to school due to poverty.

For the last three years, Saturday has had a money changing business.  Liberia's currency is the Liberian
dollar, which trades at about 70 LRD to the U.S. dollar, but the U.S. dollar is also legal tender in the country and is widely accepted.  Firestone, the country's largest private employer, pays its employees in U.S. dollars, so Saturday's services are in high demand when it's payday for Firestone workers. Saturday also sells mobile phone chargers at the Harbel market in Margibi county, Liberia.

He started selling at the Cotton Tree community in Harbel City with 20,000 LRD as working capital. He has a good manner of approach towards his customers, which keeps them returning. Saturday plans to use his 4,000 LRD portion of this 20,000 LRD group loan to purchase more mobile phone chargers and to use in his foreign currency exchange business. His goal and dream is to own his own booth from which to operate and become financially strong in the near future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Saturday is holding the sign. Sarah is inset at lower right because she was absent during interview.

loans.use: To purchase more mobile phone chargers and to use in his foreign currency exchange business

loans.name: Nyame Asem Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Akosua describes herself as hard-working, a woman for whom no challenge is too great. She is 36 years old and is the leader of the “Nyame Asem” (translated as 'God’s word') borrower group. Akosua is a food vendor who prepares and sells rice with different sauces. She has been selling cooked rice for the past two years. She is excited to be taking out this loan, which she will use to purchase three bags of rice, vegetables, cooking oil and spices. She is married to a mason and together they have three children. 

The other members are also engaged in trades such as food selling, smoked fish, palm oil production, grocery sales, used clothing sales etc. They are the major breadwinners of their respective families and are requesting a loan to support their businesses. They hope to make more savings to be able to provide good education for all their children, hopefully through university level.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Ana Maria tiene su bazar-librería  en la zona de Pampahasi, lleva muchos años con esta actividad, y es muy conocida por la zona, su librería es muy surtida ya que esta cerca de un colegio, por esto tambien tiene su fotocopiadora y plastificadora; ella vive Tambien por la zona con sus hijitos y su esposo, sus hijos están en colegio y su esposo es gerontólogo y trabaja en una institución y particularmente. Es una persona muy reponsable y muy puntual, trabaja hace 4 años aproximadamente con nuestra institución. El crédito será invetido en la compra de paquetes de hojas bond y otros tipos de hojas para la librería. Es una persona muy responsable y dinamica, esta muy agradecida a Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Ana Maria owns and runs a bookstore-bazaar in the Pampahasi area; she has been working in this business for a long time and she is well known in the area; her bookshop has a very good assortment, as it is located close to a school, and for this reason she also has a photocopier and a laminating machine. Ana Maria lives in the same area with her young children and her husband: her children are of school age and her husband is a gerontologist working both in an hospital and privately. She is a very responsible and scrupulous woman, who has been working with our institution for about 4 years. The loan will be used to buy reams of Bond paper and other varieties of writing paper for the bookstore. She is a very responsible and dynamic person, and she is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the faith shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy reams of writing paper for her bookstore

loans.name: Berlen Gabriela

texts.es: Berlen Gabriela tiene 27 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Ella es una persona que disfruta de relacionarse con sus clientes. Además ha luchado para salir adelante hace mas de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que además tiene otro medio de ingreso como es ofrecer el servicio de molino, pues siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar sus ingresos. La mayoría de sus clientes asisten a su pulpería porque Berlen es muy atenta con ellos y además les brinda muy buenos consejos. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de golosinas, jugos, sopas, detergentes, bolsas y granos básicos. Su deseo es convertir su negocio en una gran distribuidora.
texts.en:
Berlen Gabriela is 27 years old and runs a small general store. She enjoys interacting with her customers and she has worked hard over the last 6 years in this business to progress and grow her business. She has another form of income through her milling services; she is always looking for ways to improve her income.
