Most of her customers go to her store because Berlen is very attentive to them and offers them good advice. This loan will be used to buy candy, juice, soap, detergent, bags, and basic grains. She dreams of turning her business into a larger distribution business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Oswaldo Heribeto

texts.es:
Oswaldo de 48 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico, tiene dos hijos. El hace tres años dejo de trabajar en una empresa y se independizo comprando cuadernos, papelería. 

Poco a poco a implementado mas mercadería para vender, y también ahora vende colchones que los comprar a un precio muy bajo. También sale a recorrer las calles de Guayaquil para vender los colchones. 

Quiere comprar con el prestamos ollas, papelerías y colchones para su negocio, en el futuro quiere vender productos electrónicos, y tener un almacén de cosas varias.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is 48 and lives in Paraiso de Guayaquil on the outskirts of the city of Guayaquil. His house is made of cement and he has electricity only of the basic utilities. He has two children. Oswaldo left his job with a company three years ago to become an independent vendor of notebooks and stationery. Little by little he has incorporated more merchandise to sell. Now, he also sells mattresses that he buys at a very low price. He travels the streets of Guayaquil selling the mattresses. With the loan proceeds, he would like to buy pots, stationery and mattresses for his business. In the future, he wants to sell electronics and to have a store to sell assorted products.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pots, mattresses, notebooks.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Mariama C. est une institutrice dans une ecole prescolaire,elle a 38 ans et est mere de 5 enfants.
Elle fait en meme temps un commerce de tissus, qu'elle achete en Mauritanie pour les revendre a Ziguinchor. Elle fait le voyage 1 fois tous les 2 mois. Elle est dans ce commerce depuis mintenant 7ans. Elle est entree dans cette activite pour gagner plus d'argent et gerer ses charges. Elle souhaite developper son activite avec surtout l'aide de partenaire financie.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariama C. is a kindergarden teacher. She is 38 years old and is the mother of five children. At the same time, she sells fabrics which she purchases in Mauritania to resell in Ziguinchor. She makes the trip to buy her stock every two month. She has been in this business for seven years. She launched this activity in order to increase her income and manage her expenses. She is seeking to grow her business with the help of additional financing.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boosting business capital

loans.name: Bethel Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Christiana S. calls herself a humble and responsible petty trader who has been selling second-hand clothing for the past 10 years. She is currently the sole breadwinner of her family since her husband does not have a good job. She operates her business in a rented stall at Sunyani Market and has a dream of acquiring her own stall at the new market located at the heart of the Sunyani township. She also has the dream of supporting her children's education to a level that  will permit them to be gainfully employed. 

Christiana is the leader of Bethel Trust Group and according to the group members, she was elected as a result of her sense of responsibility. The group members are united and hope to be together as long as there is availability of funding and hope to expand their businesses with their current loan.

loans.use: Purchase bales of used clothing

loans.name: Nyame Ntese Odasani Group

texts.en:
Akua B. is a widow with eight children, all of whom are living with her. She retails maize and smoked fish and has been doing this for the last 10 years. She says her business has sustained her family ever since her husband died and she has been able to pay her children's school fees from the income generated. She hopes to support her children's education to a level that will enable them to find decent jobs. She hopes this dream comes to pass. 

The name 'Nyame Ntese Odasani' in our language literally means "God is not a Human Being". The group says they derive inspiration from the fact that God will never disappoint them. They have been together for some time and trade in the same market; as a result they trust each other for repayment. They trust that this loan will help them achieve the dream of expanding their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase bags of maize amd smoked fish

loans.name: Jose Fabian

texts.es:
José de 45 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, (En la foto el aparece de lado izquierdo con una camisa ploma, esta con su esposa y su mejor amigo) empezó a vender pescados hace 4 años, en la esquina de su casa, para poder mantener a sus cuatro hijos de 20, 19, 16 y 15 años. Aunque su casa es de caña y solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico, el sigue trabajando como vendedor de pescados.

Su trabajo lo realiza con ayuda de su esposa y en ocasiones con sus hijos, trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 00h00 pm todos los días. Ahora su puesto de trabajo esta ubicado en un mercado del Fortín.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar, pescados para su negocio. En el futuro quiere construir su casa de cemento.
texts.en:
Jose is 45 years old and lives in the semiurban area of Fortin de Guayaquil (in the photo, he is on the left side in the lead-colored shirt with his wife and best friend). Four years ago he started to sell fish on the corner of his home in order to support his 4 children who are 15, 16, 19, and 20 years old. Though his home is made of reeds and only has electricity in terms of basic services, he keeps working hard selling fish. His wife and children help him with his work; he works from 8 am to midnight everyday though he now sells in a stall in the Fortin market. With this loan, he will buy more fish for his business. In the future he would like to build a cement home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fish

loans.name: Agrecia Arnaldo

texts.pt:
Agrecia Arnaldo M. nasceu no Distrito de Xai xai, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 31 anos de idade, solteira não tem filhos ainda. Frequenta o primeiro ano de bacharelato em física na Universidade Pedagógica. Vive na casa cedida pelo Estado e sustenta seu irmão e dois sobrinhos que vivem com ela. 
Saiu de Xai xai para Distrito de Namaacha província de Maputo quando seus pais divorciaram em 1989. Em 2003 saiu de Namaacha para Boane, pela transferência dos serviços, trabalha como docente é quadro do Ministério da Educação ha mais de 8 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 4.300.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta bancária (Millenium Bim).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um colega que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é seu 2° empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, pedra e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua casa. O empréstimo anterior foi 8.400.00mt destinado a bens de serviços. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. Tem como sonho concluir os seus estudos, no futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para a conclusão da sua casa.
texts.en:
Agrecia Arnaldo M. was born in the Xai xai district, in the Gaza province, in the south of Mozambique. She is 31 years old, is single and does not have any children. She attended the first year of college studying physics in the Pedagogical University. She lives in government housing and she supports her brother and two nephews, who both live with her.

She left Xai xai for the Namaacha district, in the Maputo province when her parents divorced in 1989. In 2003, she left Namaacha for Boane when she was transfered. She has worked as a teacher for the Ministry of Education for 8 years. She has no employees and has a monthly salary of 4,300 MT, which she uses to pay for her household expenses and she saves some in her bank account.

She has never had a loan with another bank. She came to know Hluvuku through a coworker who is also a client of the institution. This is her second loan for the value of 12,000 and she will use this amount to purchase construction materials (cement, iron, stone, and others) to continue the construction on her home. She promises to repay her loan dutifully so that she can have access to others. She dreams of finishing her studies, in the future she hopes to access more loans to finish her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, iron, stone, etc.)

loans.name: Martha Aurora

texts.es:
Martha Aurora Q. M.  tiene 29 años, es casada,  tiene  3 hijos que se llaman Roxana de 9 años, Jairo de 6 años y Paúl de 3 años.  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
Ella es socia miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Martha trabaja en la agricultura toda su vida como  fuente principal económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son el maíz, papas, habas, trigo, arbeja.   Vende los productos en el cantón de San Miguel. 
Martha solicita el crédito para comprar químicos, fertilizantes.  Su meta es  que su producción se mejore para poder obtener buenos precios al momento de la venta.   Los desafíos que enfrentan son el cambio de clima, sequía ya que debido a estos fenómenos se puede perder la cosecha. Martha manifiesta que antes realizó un crédito y utilizo en la agricultura,  manifiesta que en su comunidad celebran a San Francisco y  los domingos sale a la feria a San Pablo, con su familia.
texts.en:
Martha Aurora Q. M. is 29 years old and married with 3 children: Roxana who is 9, Jairo who is 6, and Paul who is 3. They live in the San Francisco de Rumi Pamba precincts about an hour and a half from Canton San Miguel Provincia de Bolivar. She is a member of the San Francisco de Rumi Pamba village bank made up of 25 members, most of whom work in agriculture. Martha has worked in agriculture her whole life and this forms the basis for supporting her family. The primary crops grown in the area are corn, potatoes, beans, wheat, and peas. She sells the crops on the street of San Miguel. Martha is seeking a loan to buy some chemicals and fertilizers. Her goal is to improve her production to sell at better prices and increase her sales. She faces various obstacles such as climate change and drought since such phenomena can mean a total loss of the harvest. Martha has received one other loan which she also used for agriculture. In her community, they celebrate the holidays of San Francisco and San Pablo which she enjoys with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chemicals and fertilizer

loans.name: Rabbi Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
M. is a 31-year-old woman who describes herself as hard-working.  She is married to a farmer and has 3 children between the ages of 4 and 12 years old.    M. would like to provide her children with quality education up to university level.

For the past 8 years, M. has operated a 'cold store' selling items such as frozen fish and chicken.  She will use the loan to buy more fish and chicken for her store.  M. hopes to eventually expand her business by buying more goods to sell to customers. 
 
M. is the leader of the group called 'Rabbi', which means 'father'.  There are 12 members in this group.  The other members of the group operate retail businesses offering items such smoked fish, bananas and plantains.  All of the members know each other well and live in the same area. They hope to expand their businesses with this loan.

loans.use: Purchase cartons of frozen fish and chicken

loans.name: Oswaldo Mesías

texts.es:
Oswaldo Mesías C. A.  tiene 30 años, es casado,  tiene 1 hijo que se llama Darío.   Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Oswaldo trabaja en la agricultura como principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona es: maíz, papas, trigo.   Vende los productos en los mercados de Guaranda y Guayaquil. 
Oswaldo solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes para los sembrios.  Su meta es  que sus productos sean a través de la producción orgánica.   Los desafíos que enfrenta son  como almacenar sus productos y aprovechar en épocas de escasez. Oswaldo anteriormente solicito un crédito el que utilizo para cubrir una deuda, manifiesta  que en sus tiempos libres le gusta conversar con los vecinos sobre la forma de mejorar sus condiciones de vida en la comunidad donde vive.
texts.en:
Oswaldo Mesias C. A. is 30 years old, married and has one son named Dario. They live in the San Francisco de Rumi Pamba precincts about an hour and a half from Canton San Miguel Provincia de Bolivar. He is a member of the San Francisco de Rumi Pamba village bank made up of 25 members who primarily work in agriculture. Oswaldo also works in agriculture which forms the basis for supporting his family. The primary crops grown in the region are corn, potatoes, and wheat. He sells his products in the markets of Guaranda and Guayaquil. Oswaldo is seeking a loan to buy items like fertilizer, seeds and other items for his crops. His goal is to keep his crops organic. One of his challenges is finding a good way to store his products so he can take advantage of better prices in times of less supply. Oswaldo received a loan before which he used to pay a debt. He says that in his free time he likes to chat with his neighbors about how to improve the standard of living in their community.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials, fertilizers, seeds, etc. for crops

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: La Sra. Jenny se dedica a la venta de ariculos en remate ya sean estos aretes que hoscilan entre uno y dos bolivianos medias, juguetes y otros mas.  Ella vive en habitaciones en anticrético juntamente con su esposo Roberto y su pequeño niño, el esposo es transportista y le ayuda con los gastos familiares.  El destino del credito es para abasteserce de una mayor variedad de articulos y tambien terminar de pagar el ingreso de su minibus al sindicato donde su esposo trabaja con el mismo, uno de los deseos de la Sra. Jenny es el de comprarse una casita y poder ir a vivir con toda su familia, es muy trabajadora siempre pensando en brindar una mejor calidad de vida  a su familia, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Jenny works in the bargain sale business, selling products such as earring, their price fluctuating between 1 to 2 bolivianos, tights, stockings, toys and more. She lives with her husband Roberto and their young son in an “anticrético” house (a housing system in which one grants a loan to the owner of the house one wants to live in for a period of time: if the owner does not give the money back to the lender when the contract expires, the lender keeps the house). Her husband is a driver, and he helps her with the family expenses. The loan will be used to obtain a wider variety of products and to extinguish the tax for the minibus that is due to the union her husband works for. One of Jenny’s desires is to succeed in buying a small house for her family to live in. She is a very hard-working woman, always concerned about offering a better quality of life to her family. She is very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Antonio Pedro Jose

texts.pt:
António Pedro José Marrengule nasceu no Distrito de Maxixe, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique tem 57 anos de idade, viúvo e pai de 1 filho de 26 anos e uma neta de 7 anos de idade, a neta vai a escola. Fez somente 6a classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para além da sua neta. 
Sai de Maxixe para Maputo em missão de serviço. Trabalha como enfermeiro e é quadro do Ministério da Saúde ha mais de 30 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta bancária. 
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é seu 2° empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas, barrotes, cimento, pedra e outros) para concluir a construção da sua residência. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 10.000.00mt, para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para mobilar a casa e comprar uma motorizada, para facilitar as suas saídas de casa para o serviço.
texts.en:
António Pedro José Marrengule was born in the Maxixe district in the Inhambane province in the south of Mozambique. He is 57 years old, is a widower, and the father of one child who is 26 years old and a 7 year-old granddaughter who goes to school. He completed through 6th grade himself but stopped due to lack of funds. He lives in his own home with is family and he doesn't support anyone else besides his granddaughter. He left Maxixe for Maputo when he was transferred. He has worked as a nurse for the Ministry of Health for more than 30 years. He does not have any employees and he makes a monthly salary of 3,000MT, which he uses to pay for his household expenses and occasionally saves some to his bank account. He has never taken out a loan with another bank. He came to know Hluvuku through friends who were also clients of the institution. This is his 2nd loan for the amount of 12,000MT, with which he plans to purchase construction materials (plates, beams, cement, stone, etc.) to finish construction on his home. The previous loan was for 10,000MT and was used for the same purpose. He promises to make his repayments dutifully so that he can access future loans. In the future, he'd like to take out more loans to furnish his home and purchase a motor vehicle to facilitate his trips from home to work.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (plates, beams, cement, stone, etc.)

loans.name: Concepcion Primitiva

texts.es: La Sra. Concepción trabaja con Emprender desde al año 2001, en un grupo llamado Elección, grupo bueno ubicado en el Mercado Los Pinos, la Sra. Se dedica a la venta de frutas de temporada, ella trabaja en ese mercado hace mas de 20 años, ella tiene hijos ya profesionales y estudiantes universitarios, el esposo es empleado de la Policia, con muchos años de servicio, la Sra. solicita este crédito para compra de mercaderia y en parte para cubrir gastos de estudios de tesis de su hija menor, es una persona muy buena y responsable, ambos esposos compraron un terreno hace pocos años por la zona de Reyes Carvajal, camino a la Florida e hicieron construir su casita con los ahorros que tenian y los prestamos que sacaron, en fin es una persona muy trabajadora y puntual en sus pagos. Estan muy agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Concepción has been working with Emprender since 2001, in a group called Elección, a fine group located in Mercado Los Pinos. She sells seasonal fruit and has been working in this market for more than 20 years. Some of her children have already a job, and others are university students, and her husband is a policeman with many years in the line of duty. The loan she is requesting will be used partly to buy products, and partly to cover the expenses for the university graduation of her youngest daughter. Concepción is a very good and responsible person; a few years ago she and her husband bought some land in the Reyes Carvajal area, on the way to La Florida, and had their house built there with their savings and the loans they obtained; she is a very hard-working woman, always very accurate with her payments. They are really grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit to sell

loans.name: Adriano Simao

texts.pt:
Adriano Simão N. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 34 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 10, 07, 04 e 01 anos, os dois mais velhos vão a escola. Fez 9a classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta uma cunhada que vive com ele. 
Nunca saiu de Boane, cresceu e casou se neste Distrito. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 4 anos, vende mais arroz que compra por 500.00mt o saco e vende por 750.00mt. Não possui nenhum empregado trabalha com ajuda da esposa e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 1.200.00mt a 1.500.00mt por dia que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária e através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de Poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da chapa que esta patente em frente do escritório na sucursal de Boane e decidiu solicitar o seu 1° credito. Este é seu 1° empréstimo no valor de 10.200.00mt com qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, açúcar, farinha e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para ampliar a sua residência e adquirir um meio de transporte para ajudar a transportar a sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
Adriano Simão N. was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. He is 34 years old, married, and has 4 children who are 10, 7, 4 and 1 years old. The two oldest children attend school. Adriano studied through 9th grade, and didn't continue because a lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his family and helps to support his sister-in-law who lives with them. Adriano never left Boane, he grew up there and was married there. He has owned his own business for more than 4 years, selling rice that he buys for 500 Meticales a bag and can sell for 750 Meticales a bag. He doesn't have any employees but with the help of his wife he earns between 1200 and 1500 Meticales a day. He uses this money to pay for household expenses, and also saves some money each month through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings). Adriano has never taken out a loan with another bank. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] when he saw the sign outside of the Hluvuku office in Boane and he decided to apply for a loan. This is his first loan, for the amount of 10,200 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy products (rice, sugar, flour and others) in order to increase his stock of merchandise. Adriano promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to expand his house and to purchase a vehicle to help transport his merchandise.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products (sugar, rice, flour and other items)

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel Ángel C. A.   tiene 23 años, es soltero.  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Miguel Ángel  trabaja en la agricultura toda su vida como  fuente principal económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona es: maíz, papas, trigo.   Vende los productos cada cosecha en la ciudad de San Miguel. 
Miguel Ángel  solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas, abonos, fertilizantes para sus cultivos.  Su meta es mejorar la calidad del producto y mejorar su fuente de ingresos.   Los desafíos que enfrentan son llegar a vender sus productos sin intermediarios ya que ellos les explotan, ya que en tiempo de cosecha  bajan los precios de venta de los productos. Miguel Ángel  manifiesta que en sus tiempos libres acude a fiestas cívicas de su comunidad, en conjunto con sus amigos.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel C. A. is 23 years old and single. He lives in the San Francisco de Rumi Pamba precincts about an hour and a half from Canton San Miguel Provincia de Bolivar. He is a member of the San Francisco de Rumi Pamba village bank made up of 25 members who primarily work in agriculture. Miguel Angel works in agriculture as well and uses this to support himself. The primary crops grown in the area are corn, potatoes and wheat. He sells his products in the city of San Miguel. Miguel Angel is seeking a loan to buy agricultural products and fertilizers for his crops. His goal is to improved the quality of his crops to improve his income. One of his major challenges is finding a way to sell his products without using a middleman as the middlemen generally exploit the farmers by lowering their prices during harvest time. Miguel Angel says that in his free time he likes to participate in the civic activities of his community with his friends.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Agricultural products and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Santos Natividad

texts.es: El señor Santos Natividad posee un negocio que es una pulpería. Y está ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace diez años. El realiza sus compras de contado y sus ventas son al crédito y de contado, las compras las efectúa en el mercado de Managua donde le resulta mucho más favorable ya que así compra el por mayor. Pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar y mantener a su familia. El está solicitando un financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio, además es padre de tres niños menores de edad, los cuales asisten al colegio y están a su cargo. El nos cuenta que sueña con mejorar su actividad económica que es su medio de vida.
texts.en:
Santos Navidad has run a small general store located in his house for the past 10 years. He buys his goods on account and sells his goods on credit or on account as well. He buys his inventory in the market of Managua where he can get wholesale prices. He has always enjoyed working and taking care of his family. He is seeking a loan to invest in his business. He is the father of three young children who are all attending elementary school. He dreams of improve his store to better his standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Pedro Vicente

texts.es:
Pedro Vicente C. C.   tiene 23 años, es soltero,   Vive en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Pedro Vicente trabaja en la agricultura como fuente principal  económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son: maíz, papas, trigo.   Vende los productos cada cosecha en diferentes lugares del país. 
Pedro Vicente  solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas,  abonos y fertilizantes  para sus sembrios.  Su meta es de mejorar la calidad del producto y su calidad de vida.  Los desafíos que enfrentan son que desearían que sus productos sean vendidos al productor no a los intermediarios. Pedro Vicente no ha realizado préstamos,  manifiesta que en sus tiempos sale a pasear a san Miguel.
texts.en:
Pedro Vicente C. C. is 23 and single. He lives in the town of San Francisco de Rumí, which is 1½ hours from San Miguel Canton in the Province of Bolivar. He is a member of the San Francisco de Rumí Pamba Communal Bank. It is comprised of 25 members in all. Most of them work in agriculture. Pedro Vicente works in agriculture as his primary source of income for his family. The crops that excel in the area are corn, potatoes, and wheat. He sells those products from every harvest at different places in the country. Pedro Vicente is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies and natural and chemical fertilizers for his plants. His goal is to improve the quality of the product and his quality of life. The challenge he faces is that he would like his products to be sold to the producer not to the intermediaries. Pedro Vicente has not had loans before. In his free time he goes walking to San Miguel.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Agricultural supplies like natural and chemical fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Gloria Silva

texts.pt:
Glória Silva B. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 35 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 1 filho de 07 anos, e vai a escola. Fez 10a classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com 0 seu filho e sustenta sua mãe e irmãos enviando algum valor monetário para ajuda nas despesas de casa.
Saiu da Cidade da Matola em casa dos pais para Boane na sua própria casa. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 07 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.500.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua tia que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é seu 4° empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar mercadoria (fardos de roupa usada, lençóis, mantas, cortinas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na habitação.
texts.en:
Gloria Silva B. was born in the city of Matola, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is 35 years old, unmarried, and has a 7-year-old son who is in school. Gloria only studied through 10th grade, and didn't continue because of her parents’ lack of financial resources. She lives in her own home with her son and helps to support her mother and her siblings financially by sending them money to cover household expenses. Gloria left her parents’ house in Matola to move to her own house in Boane. She has had her own business for more than 7 years and doesn’t have any other employees. She earns around 4500 Meticales a month, which she uses to cover household expenses. She also saves some money in her bank account each month. Gloria has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through her aunt, who also works with the institution. This is her 4th loan, for the amount of 12,000 Meticales. She plans to use this money to buy products (packs of used clothing, sheets, blankets, curtains and other items) in order to increase her stock of merchandise. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to put towards improving her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (packs of used clothing, sheets, blankets, curtains and other items)

loans.name: Soraya

texts.es: La Sra. Soraya se dedica a la Compra , Reacondicionamiento y Venta de Peluches de diferentes formas y tamaños, ella realiza la adquisición de los mismos por fardos en la conocida Feria de la Cumavi, su oficio consiste en reacomodar todos aquellos peluches que llegan dañados, colocandoles nueva fibra y labando el envoltorio, posterior a la realización de estas mejoras y otras, los peluches son envolsados y puestos nuevamente a la venta con diferentes precios de acuerdo al tamaño y las caracteristicas mejoradas de los mismos. Doña Soraya cuenta con créditos anteriores en la Institución donde demostro ser puntual en sus cuotas motivo por el cual se le otorgó este nuevo crédito, además de eso ella cuenta con domicilio conocido en la Villa 1ro de Mayo. Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Soraya buys, reconditions, and sells all different shapes and sizes of stuffed animals. She gets them in bundles at the well-known Cumavi Fair. Her work consists of reassembling all of the stuffed animals that arrive damaged. She puts in new stuffing and washes the outside. After making these improvements, and others, the stuffed animals are bagged and put up for sale again. They are different prices according to their size and the improvements that were made. Soraya has had previous loans with the Institución. She was punctual with her payments, which is why she was given this new loan. She lives in the Villa 1ro de Mayo. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Chame

texts.pt:
Chame A. nasceu no Distrito de Angoche, Província de Nampula, norte de Moçambique tem 43 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 17 e 07 anos, ambos vão a escola. Fez o curso médio em investigação agrária ha 17 anos. Vive na casa cedida pelos serviços com a sua família e sustenta seus irmãos em Nampula enviando algum valor trimestralmente para ajudar nas despesas de casa.
Saiu de Nampula para Boane para continuar com os seus estudos em 1988. Depois decidiu formar seu lar neste Distrito e trabalha como docente e quadro do Ministério da Educação ha mais de 15 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 7.085.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Ja teve empréstimo na cooperativa de crédito Procredito e decidiu não continuar mais. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é seu 4° empréstimo no valor de 11.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, blocos, areia e outros) para continuar com a obra de construção da sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 13.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na conclusão da sua casa e continuar com os estudos.
texts.en:
Chame A. was born in the district of Angoche, in the province of Nampula in the north of Mozambique. He is 43 years old, married, and has 2 children who are 17 and 7 years old. Both children attend school. He got a degree in agricultural research some 17 years ago. He lives with his family in a house provided by his work and helps to support his siblings in Nampula by sending them money to cover their household expenses. Chame left Nampula for Boane in 1988 to continue his education. He later decided to settle in the area and he has worked as a teacher for the Ministry of Education for more than 15 years. He doesn’t employ any help and he has a monthly salary of 7085 Meticales. He uses this income to cover household expenses and also saves some each month in his bank account. Chame had taken out loans before with the Procredito Credit Cooperative, but he decided not to continue with them. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through friends who have also worked with the institution. This is his 4th loan, for the amount of 11,000 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, iron, sand, blocks and other items) in order to continue working on his home construction project. His earlier loans were for 10,000, 10,000, and 13,000 Meticales and were used for the same purpose. He promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to finish his house and continue with his studies.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, blocks, iron, sand and other items)

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Angel A. C.  tiene 32 años, es casado,  tiene  4 hijos que se llaman  Abran de 10 años, Brayan de 8 años, Jonathan de 5 años y Valeria de 2 años,  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y pastoreo de ganado bovino.
Miguel Ángel  trabaja en la agricultura como principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son las papas, maíz, trigo, cebada, habas.   Vende los productos cada cosecha en la ciudad de Guaranda. 
Miguel Ángel  solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para la siembra de sus productos.  Su meta es de mejorar sus cultivos y así dar un mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.   Los desafíos que enfrentan son falta de ayuda al agricultor, ya que cuando llueve mucho se pierde la cosecha se daña los productos y no hay ingresos  económicos. Miguel Angel  manifiesta que en sus tiempos libres le gusta compartir con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel A. C. is 32, married, and has four children. Abran is 10, Brayan is 8, Jonathan is 5, and Valerie is 2. They live in the town of San Francisco de Rumí Pamba, which is 1½ hours from San Miguel Canton in the Province of Bolivar. He is a member of the San Francisco de Rumí Pamba Communal Bank. It is comprised of 25 members in all. Most of them work in agriculture and raising cattle. Miguel Ángel works in agricultural as the primary source of income for his family. The crops that excel the most in the area are potatoes, corn, wheat, barley, and beans. He sells the products from each harvest in the city of Guaranda. Miguel Ángel is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to plant his products. His goal is to improve his crops. That way he can give his children a better quality of life. The challenge that he faces is not having farm help. Another challenge is that when it rains a lot he loses the harvest, the products are damaged, and there is no income. Miguel Ángel says that he likes to share his free time with his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seeds and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es: La Sra. Emelinda es propietaria D. un vehiculo marca Toyota  cual lo hace  trabajar en la línea del nuevo palmar (Taxi trufi)  a patir D. las 15:00 D. la tarD. hasta las 10:30  todos los días, además la señora se dedica a trabajar como empleada domestica, su esposo es el señor Ciro el trabaja D. empleado en la zona franca  tienen 3 hijos y actualmentemente uno bajo su cargo que tiene 17 años este año sale bachiller, los otros hijos ya son independientes, comenta ella que su gran esfuerzo que le dedica es para volver a comprar otro  vagoneta y poder hacerla trabajar y asi poder tener un ingreso mas ya que su hijo pronto entrara a la universidad y necesitara dinero para sus estudios, es muy trabajadora cuando no viene su chofer ella se dedica a manejar su auto, con el dinero del credito realizara el mantenimiento a su vehiculo para que este no presente fallas al momento D. trabajar esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Ermelinda owns a Toyota car she rents out to a driver working for the Taxi Trufi Nuovo Palmar route (T.RU.FI – Taxi con Ruta Fija) from 3 pm to 10.30 pm every day; moreover, she works as a maid. Her husband, Ciro, is a clerck in the duty-free zone. They have 3 children and one in foster care who is 17 years old and will graduate from high school this year; she says she is working hard to be able to buy another vehicle to rent out, in order to get another income as her son will shortly begin university and she will need money for his education. She is a very hard-working woman, she even drives her car when her driver cannot come to work. She will use the loan she is requesting to keep her car in good conditions so that it will not break down while being used at work. She is very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain and repair her vehicle

loans.name: Mercia Mussa

texts.pt:
Mércia Mussa C. nasceu no Distrito de Maxixe, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique tem 24 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 1 filho de 04 anos de idade, vai a escolinha. Fez 12ą classe não continuou devido a insuficiência de fundos, teve que começar a trabalhar. Vive na casa de aluguer com o seu filho e sustenta seu irmão que vive com ela.
Saiu de Maxixe para Maputo com o seu tio a fim de continuar com os estudos ha 09 anos. Actualmente trabalha como docente, é do quadro do Ministério da Educação ha mais de 05 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 4.537.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária (BCI).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é seu 2° empréstimo no valor de 9.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, blocos, ferro, areia e outros) para continuar com a obra de construção da sua casa. O empréstimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt para bens de consumo. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na conclusão da sua casa e continuar com os seus estudos.
texts.en:
Mercia Mussa C. was born in the district of Maxixe, in the province of Inhambane in the south of Mozambique. She is 24 years old, is unmarried, and has a 4-year-old son who goes to preschool. She only studied through 12th grade, and didn't continue because of a lack of resources meant she had to begin working. She lives with her son in a rented house and helps support a brother who lives with her. She left Maxixe for Maputo 9 years ago with her uncle, in order to continue her education. She now has worked as a teacher for the Ministry of Education for more than 5 years. She doesn’t employ any help and has a monthly salary of 4537 Meticales. She uses this income to cover household expenses and also saves some each month in her bank account. Mercia has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through colleagues who also work with the institution. This is her 2nd loan, for the amount of 9000 Meticales. She plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, blocks, iron, sand and other items) in order to continue working on the construction of her home. Her earlier loan was for 10,000 Meticales for basic necessities. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to finish her house and continue with her studies.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, blocks, iron, sand and other items)

loans.name: 21 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
Elizabeth A. de 28 años, es casada y vive en la zona 21 de Octubre hace dos años, ella  tiene dos negocios uno de ellos es vender comida y otro es trensado de mantas y en esta oportunidad tiene planificado invertir en el negocio de comida el préstamo, ya que tienen mayor retorno.
Las demás integrantes de la Asociación Comunal 21 de Octubre que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Panamericana, tienen negocios como el tejido de aguayos (tela colorida), venta de cosméticos, venta de alimento seco y elaboración de masitas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is 28 years old, married, and living in the 21 de Octubre area for the past two years. She has two businesses, one of which is selling food and the other is the plaiting of ponchos. Currently, she plans to invest loan proceeds in her food business, given that the returns are greater. The remaining participants, members of both the 21 de Octubre Communal Association and the Centro Focal Panamericana, have businesses such as the weaving of multicolored cloth (colored fabric), cosmetics sales, dry groceries sales, and pastry making.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials.

loans.name: Alma Iris

texts.es: Alma Iris tiene 26 años, su actividad económica es el servicio de taller de carpintería. Por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar de la forma más humilde ella posee un negocio que es un taller de carpintería ubicado en su casa de habitación. Por lo que tiene mucho tiempo de hacerse cargo desde hace 8 años, realiza la compra de contado a diferentes proveedores pues es muy difícil encontrar muy buena madera para la elaboración de sus productos. Por lo que siempre ha invertido sus créditos en su negocio para que pueda salir adelante. Por lo que además ella le ayuda a sus padres ya que ellos no pueden trabajar por su avanzada edad. Solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es mejorar cada día en la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Alma Iris is 26 years old and runs a carpentry shop. She has always enjoyed working in the most modest surroundings, and runs her carpentry business from the house in which she lives. She has operated this business for a long time, spanning the last eight years. She pays her various providers in cash, but finds it difficult to acquire quality wood to make her products. She has always invested loan proceeds with the goal of succeeding in her business. Additionally, she is helping her parents who can no longer work as they are advanced in age. She is requesting additional financing for the purchase of primary materials. Her goal is to improve the quality of her products on a daily basis.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Segundo Luis

texts.es:
Segundo Luis R.  tiene 42 años, es casada,  tiene  4 hijos , se llaman Segundo de 24 años, Nelson de 22 años, Luis de 19 años, Jaime de 13 años.  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y pastoreo de ganado bovino.
Segundo  trabaja en la agricultura toda su vida como fuente principal  económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son: maíz, papas, trigo, cebada, mellocos.   Vende los productos en los mercados de San Miguel y Guaranda, también vende en la comunidad cuando llegan los comerciantes. 
Segundo  solicita el crédito para comprar abonos líquidos,  para pagar a los peones y para el transporte del producto.  Su meta es obtener productos de calidad y comercializarlos a precios razonables.  Los desafíos que tiene es que cuando el clima es desfavorable afecta a la producción y los precios caen, ya que el producto no es de buena calidad, Segundo si solicito antes un crédito invirtió en compra de insumos, Segundo manifiesta que en sus tiempos libres le gusta compartir con su familia y salen a pasear al rió.
texts.en:
Segundo Luis R. is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children who are called Segundo, 24 years old, Nelson who is 22, Luis, 19, and Jamie who is 13. They live in the neighborhood of San Francisco de Rumi Pamba about one and a half hours from Canton San Miguel in the province of Bolivar. The partner is a member of the rural group San Francisco de Rumi Panba which is made up of 25 members in total, of whom the majority work in agriculture and raising cattle. All his life Segundo has worked in agriculture, the principal source of income for his family. Among the crops that do well in the area are corn, wheat, barley, potatoes, and mellocos (a type of tuber). He sells the products in the markets of San Miguel and Guaranda, and in the community when the merchants arrive. Segundo requests the loan to buy liquid fertilizers, to pay the workers, and for the transport of the produce. His goal is to obtain quality products that he can sell at reasonable prices. The challenges that he has are that when the climate is unfavorable it affects the production and the prices fall since the product is not of good quality. Segundo solicited a loan before that he invested in supplies. He says that in his free time he likes to be with his family and they go out to walk by the river.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy liquid fertilizers, pay the workers, transport the produce.

loans.name: Recardina Fernando

texts.pt:
Recardina Fernando R. nasceu no Distrito de Magude, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 35 anos de idade, divorciada mãe de 3 filhos de 15, 10 e 04 anos, os dois mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 7ą classe não continuou porque ficou muito tempo doente. Vive na casa cedida pelos familiares com os seus filhos e sustenta seus irmãos enviando algum valor para ajudar nas despesas de casa.
Saiu de Magude para Boane com os pais 1987, a procura de melhores condições de vida. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 16 anos, tendo iniciado depois da sua separação, tem um empregado que ajuda no seu negócio. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária (Barclays).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é seu 2° empréstimo no valor de 9.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas, barrotes, cimento, ferro, areia e outros) para continuar com a obra de construção da sua casa. O empréstimo anterior foi de 9.000.00mt para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na conclusão da sua casa e oferecer melhor comodidade a seus filhos.
texts.en:
Recardina Fernando R. was born in the district of Magude, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is 35 years old, is divorced, and has 3 children who are 15, 10 and 4 years old. The two older children attend school. Recardina only studied through 7th grade, and didn't continue because of a long illness. She lives with her children in a house provided for her by family members and helps support her siblings by sending them money to help with household expenses. She left Magude for Boane with her parents in 1987, in search of better living conditions. She has had her own business for more than 16 years, having started after her separation, and has one employee who helps her with her work. She has a monthly income of around 6000 Meticales. She uses this money to cover household expenses and she is also able to save some in her bank account. Recardina has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through friends who also work with the institution. This is her 2nd loan, for the amount of 9000 Meticales. She plans to use this money to buy construction materials (metal plates, beams, cement, iron, sand and other items) in order to continue working on the construction of her home. Her earlier loan was for 9000 Meticales and was used for the same purpose. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to finish her house and offer her children a more comfortable life.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (metal plates, beams, cement, iron, sand and other items)

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Maria De Los Ángeles posee un negocio que es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde quince años. A pesar que sus condiciones de vida son muy escasas ella busca la forma de generar ingresos a su familia. Maria realiza sus compras de contado y sus ventas son al crédito y de contado. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio, además la señora es madre de dos niños de 9 y 12 años los cuales asisten al colegio  y están a su cargo. Su deseo es para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria De Los Ángeles has had a grocery store in her home for the last 15 years. Despite her living conditions being very meager, she still seeks ways to generate income for her family. Maria buys her stock items for cash and sells for cash and on credit. This is why she needs funds for her business. Besides, she is the mother of two children, who are 9 and 12 years old, both in school, that are under her care. Her wish is to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Frank

texts.es: El Sr. Frank vive en la localidad de El Torno en el barrio Naciones Unidas,  su esposa con la cual tienen un hijo se dedica a labores del hogar,  su actividad principal es la de moto taxista(transporte de pasajero urbano),  se encuentra en su  segundo crédito con la institución, el primero fue para comprar una línea de moto taxi(pertenecer a una asociación), ahora es para renovar su herramienta de trabajo, comprar una nueva moto,  el solo mantiene el hogar, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le brindo; su deseo es poder comprar una casa ya que donde el vive es de sus suegros.  En la foto posa acompañado de su esposa.
texts.en:
Frank lives in the Naciones Unidas district, in the town of El Torno; his wife is a housewife and they have one child. He works as a Moto taxi driver (transporte de pasajero urbano) and he is asking for his second loan with our institution. He used the first loan to buy a Moto taxi phone line (to become member of an association); he will use this new loan to renew his working tools and to buy a new motorbike. He sustains his family alone, and he is thankful to our institution for the help we are offering; he desires to buy his own house, as the one he is living in right now belongs to his in-laws. The woman with him in the picture is his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Hormiguitas Unidas Group

texts.es:
Petrona S. D. 42 años es casada y vive  en L. zona Nuevo Amanecer, hace 6 años, elL.  tiene el negocio D.  tienda D. barrio en su domicilio que le permite atender las labores D. casa.
Las demás integrantes D. L. Asociación Comunal Hormiguitas Unidas tienen variados negocios como L. venta D. ropa deportiva, tejido D. mantas, venta D. pescado y costura D. edredones. Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o capital fijo. 
Ellas se reúnen cada dos semanas en el Centro Focal Alto Lima.
texts.en:
Petrona S., 42, is married and lives in the Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) zone. She has had a neighborhood grocery store in her home for the last six year; having it in her home allows her to tend to household chores. The other members of the "Hormiguitas Unidas" (United Little Ants) communal bank have various commercial activities such as: sportswear sales, blanket weaving, fish sales, comforter sewing. They all need funds to acquire merchandise, ingredients, or for fixed capital. They meet every two weeks at the Alto Lima Focal Center.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Angela Del Rosario

texts.es: Ángela Del Rosario tiene 53 años su actividad económica es la compra y venta de calzado. Hace más de 21 años que se dedica a esta actividad, por lo que su negocio está ubicado en el mercado en donde a diario transitan muchos clientes, pues así es que diariamente ella consigue nuevos clientes, pues siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar sus ingresos y mantener a sus 3 hijos que dependen de ella. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de calzado de todo tipo. Su deseo es realizarle mejoras a su negocio.
texts.en:
Ángela Del Rosario, 53, is a footwear merchant. She has been in this line of work for over 21 years. Her business is located in the market where many customers visit daily; every day she gets new customers because she has always striven to improve her income and support her three children who depend on her. She is asking for funding to buy all kinds of footwear. Her wish is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted footwear.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto tiene 33 años, su actividad económica es la  elaboración y venta de juegos pirotécnicos. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar sus ingresos, pues desde muy joven ha tenido que trabajar para su 4 hijos que estaban a su cargo el se preocupaba por proporcionarle lo más necesario. Por lo que es muy popular por ofrecer este tipo de producto y además por tener un gran carisma. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima. El desea continuar con esta actividad y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto, 33, makes and sells fireworks. He has been in this business for over 20 years. He is always striving to increase his income because he has had to work from a very young age to support his four children that were under his care; he wanted to provide them with all they needed. He is very popular because he offers this service and because he has great charisma. He is asking for funding to buy raw materials. He wants to continue with this activity and succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fireworks raw materials.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La señora Maria Francisca tiene 56 años es madre de familia, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado a orillas de la carretera León-Managua en un poblado. la actividad económica de Francisca es la elaboración de artesanías en su casa de habitación, realiza la actividad de manera manual. Hace 16 años tiene este negocio porque tenía que proporcionarle a su familia una estabilidad económica y a sus hijos una educación, su esposo le ayuda para la elaboración de las piezas y luego salen a venderlas o bien llegan algunos  clientes a su vivienda. El financiamiento es para compra de materia prima y elaborar artículos de barro para su venta. Pues sus deseos son de tener dinero suficiente para trabajar con capital propio y dar una estabilidad  económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Francisca, 56, is a mother; her address is in a settlement along the León-Managua highway. She makes handmade handicrafts at home. She has been in this line of work for 16 years because she needed to provide her family with economic stability and provide her children with an education. Her husband helps her make the items and then they go out to sell them; sometimes customers come by their house to buy. She will use the funds to buy raw materials to make clay items to sell. Her wish is to have enough funds to work with her own capital and provide economic stability for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her crafts.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura, de 19 años, es una joven muy emprendedora, vive en casa de sus padres junto a sus dos hermanos menores y lo que mas desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Siendo muy joven tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y ser independiente, por ello se dedica a vender bolsos y carteras en el instituto donde estudia. Es así que cada fin de semana lleva su mercadería a ofrecer a sus amigas y con el paso del tiempo ha logrado ganarse muchos clientes, eso la ha motivado a seguir trabajando. Ahora en sociedad con su mama, quien se dedica a confeccionar estos bolsos, salen a vender este producto. De esa manera ha logrado trabajar más de un año, sin embargo su mayor dificultad; es no contar con el suficiente presupuesto para confeccionar variedad de diseños. Es por ello que desea implementar el taller de su madre y contar con variedad de telas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto se compromete a pagar sus puntualmente sus cuotas y está dispuesta hacerlo. El crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de telas en Jean y cueros en general, para atender la demanda de sus jóvenes compradores.
texts.en:
Laura, 19, is a very enterprising young woman. She lives with her parents and two younger brothers. What she wants most is to improve her quality of life. Although very young, she very much wants to get ahead in life and be independent. For this reason, she sells purses and wallets at her school. Every weekend she takes her merchandise to sell to her friends; with time, she has managed to secure quite a few regular customers and this has motivated her to continue working. Now, in partnership with her mother who makes the purses, they go out to sell them. She has managed to stay in this line of work for over a year now; however, her greatest difficulty is not counting on having sufficient budget to make a wide variety of styles. This is why she’d like to enlarge her mother’s workshop and have an assortment of fabrics. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She will use the requested funds to buy denim and leather to meet her young customers’ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and leather to make purses.

loans.name: Primaveras De German Busch Group

texts.es:
Dora C. es integrante de la Asociación Comunal Primaveras de German Busch, cuenta que esta con la familia de Pro Mujer hace 6 años aproximadamente, ingresó por invitación de unas amigas de su zona, ella se dedica a la costura de deportivos, contactándose con padres de familia de estudiantes que están en etapa escolar o colegial y les muestra sus productos de esta manera consigue clientes. Dora compra su materia prima como tela, forro e hilos de la ciudad de La Paz, ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar los mismos.
Las demás integrantes de esta asociación tienen variados negocios del área de producción, servicio y comercio. Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o capital fijo. 
Ellas se reúnen cada dos semanas en el Centro Focal German Busch.
texts.en:
Dora C. is a member of the Primaveras de German Busch (Springs of German Busch) communal association; she relates that she has collaborated with Pro Mujer for about 6 years. She became a member thanks to an invitation tended by some girl friends in the area. She sews sportswear. She gets customers by contacting parents of students that are in school or high school and she shows them her products. She buys her raw materials like fabric, lining and thread, in La Paz. She needs funding to buy these materials. The other members of this association have various commercial activities in production, service and retail. They all need funds to acquire merchandise, ingredients or to use as fixed capital. They meet every two weeks at the German Busch Focal Center.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw material.

loans.name: Eduardo Joseyrel

texts.es: El señor Eduardo 33 años, el posee un camión el cual es su fuente de trabajo desde hace 18 años. El  es padre de dos hijos varones los cuales asisten al colegio gracias a su esfuerzo y al de su esposa. Su esposa también le ayuda  como estilista  de belleza en su casa de habitación, juntos trabajan para salir adelante y mantener a su familia. El señor está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de repuestos para su camión, el  trabaja a diferentes compañías de carga y necesita mantener su medio de ingreso. Su deseo es obtener otro camión para generar más ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 33, has a truck that has been his source of work for the last 18 years. He has two sons that go to school thanks to his and his wife's efforts. His wife helps him meet household expenses through her work as a beauty stylist in their home. Together they work to get ahead and support the family. He is asking for a new loan to buy replacement parts for his truck. He works for various cargo firms and needs to maintain his source of income. His wish is to acquire a second truck to generate increased income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vehicle replacement parts.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 37 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive con su esposo y  dos hijos menores en su casa propia. Anteriormente apoyaba a su esposo en la sastrería, pero hace 2 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de productos comestibles en su bodega. Desde entonces cada fin de semana acude a los mercados mayoristas para adquirir y abastecer su bodega, siempre con el cuidado de comprar productos que estén dentro de la fecha límite, eso le da mayor seguridad a sus clientes. Este negocio le es rentable, además que le facilita el tenerlo dentro de su domicilio, permitiéndole trabajar todo el día sin descuidar de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es incrementar su capital de trabajo, para tener más surtida su negocio. Este es su primer crédito es con MFP y por tanto se compromete a pagar oportunamente todas sus cuotas. En su grupo espera contribuir con el bienestar de esta organización. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos comestibles y cumplir con la demanda del cliente.
texts.en:
Edith, 37, is a very cheerful and hard-working woman; she lives with her husband and two minor children in their own home. She used to help her husband in his tailor shop but for the last two years she has sold food items in her grocery store. Every weekend she goes to the wholesale markets to buy stock items for her store always being careful to buy products that are still within their “sell by” dates; her customers feel more secure this way. This is a profitable business and, having it located at home, allows her to tend to it without neglecting her family. Her greatest wish is to increase working capital so that she can have a wider selection of goods available. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She hopes to contribute to her group’s wellbeing. She will use the requested funds to buy food items to meet customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more food items.

loans.name: 17 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
Tejido de prendas de vestir como chompas, manoplas y otros es el negocio al cual se dedicaba la señora Julia C. que a sus 65 años sigue generando ingresos, ahora desea cambiar de negocio, tiene planificado vender comida con ayuda de su hija y necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos.
Las demás integrantes tienen variados negocios como la venta de artefactos, joyas, ropa, carne, cosméticos, y refrescos.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima. 
Ellas se reúnen cada dos semanas en el Centro Focal Los Andes.
texts.en:
Julia C., 65, knits sweaters, mittens and other items generating income that way but now wants to change occupation. She plans to start selling prepared meals with help from her daughter and needs funds to buy ingredients. The other group members have various businesses like the sale of artifacts, jewelry, clothing, meat, cosmetics and beverages. They all need funds to acquire merchandise, ingredients or raw materials. They meet every two weeks at Los Andes Focal Center.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Tomas Antonio

texts.es: Tomas Antonio tiene 48 años, su actividad económica es ofrecer el servicio de taxi. Hace más de 36 años que se hace cargo de este negocio, pues siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarle a su esposa e hijo lo más necesario. El dio inicio a este negocio por su Papa ya que fue él quien le enseño este oficio, mas tarde Tomas lo ocuparía como su medio de vida. Tomas tiene 1 hijo a su cargo es por el que se preocupa y trata de proporcionarle lo más necesarios. Es así que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de repuestos necesarios para su vehiculó. Sueña con tener otro vehiculó para que dejárselo a su hijo.
texts.en:
Tomas Antonio is 48 years old; he is a taxi driver. He has been in this line of work for over 36 years and has always striven to provide his wife and son everything they need. He started in this line of work through his father who taught him; later on it would be Tomas' means of support. Tomas has a son under his care; he tries to provide him with all that is necessary. He is asking for funding to buy replacement parts for his vehicle. He dreams with having another vehicle to leave to his son.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vehicle replacement parts.

loans.name: Damaris Del Socorro

texts.es: Damaris Del Socorro es una mujer muy emprendedora. Tiene 35 años y siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar sus ingresos. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos, hace mas de 5 años actualmente tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, además de tener este medio de ingreso ella imparte clases en donde trabaja todos los días diariamente ella transporta sus productos a su trabajo para mostrárselos a sus compañeros y los fines de semana sale a ofrecerlos a sus amigos y vecinos. El financiamiento es para la compra de cremas, colonias, perfumes, ropa interior y pinturas de todo tipo. Sueña con establecer una tienda en su vivienda y formar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Damaris Del Socorro is a very enterprising woman. She is 35 years old, and she has always been concerned about improving her income. She has been selling cosmetics for over five years. She currently has two children under her care. In addition to having this means of income, she also gives classes where she works everyday. She takes her products to work everyday to show them to her colleagues. On the week-ends she goes to sell them to her friends and neighbors. The loan is to buy creams, colognes, perfumes, underwear, and all types of makeup. She dreams of establishing a store in her house and educating her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Diana Laura

texts.es: Diana Laura A. y su esposo son una familia emprendedora dispuesta a salir adelante ante las adversidades que hay en la vida. Esta familia empieza un nuevo ciclo invirtiendo en un negocio de Video juegos donde ofrecen servicio de entretenimiento para niños, adolescentes y adultos. El negocio aun no se le define el nombre ya que es pequeño y se encuentra en su misma vivienda. El joven matrimonio tiene 3 hijos a los que piensan darles una mejor calidad de vida es por ello que desean invertir en este negocio para tener mas utilidad.
texts.en:
Diana Laura A. and her husband are an enterprising family that is prepared to get ahead in spite of life’s adversities. This family starts a new cycle investing in a business of video games. They offer entertainment services for children, adolescents, and adults. The business does not yet have a name because it is small and in their house. The young couple has three children. They plan on giving them a better quality of life. That is why they want to invest in this business to have more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock their business

loans.name: Zonia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Sonia tiene su negocio que es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Desde hace 20 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que el trabajo que realiza a diario es muy difícil por lo que todos los días tiene que levantarse temprano para realizar las compras y así aumentar su inventario y ofrecerle a sus clientes una amplia variedad de productos. Por lo que está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Sueña con mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sonia's business is a general store located in her house. She has had this business for the past 20 years and it is difficult. She has to get up early every day to go shopping and stock her store to be able to offer her customers a wide variety of products. That is why she is asking for this loan-to purchase the basic items. Her dream is to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Silvia Veronica

texts.es: La señora Silvia Verónica G. Chávez desde hace 6 años tiene una papelería y mercería llamada “Vero”, donde ofrece calidad y buen servicio a su clientela. Silvia es madre de 2 hijos por quienes  sale adelante. El negocio lo puso pensando en bienestar de la familia tanto económico como moral, pues prefiere darles una mejor atención a sus hijos y de la única manera es que ella este en su propia casa. Por eso pide el apoyo para poder surtir su negocio para seguir trabajando en el.
texts.en:
Silvia Verónica G. Chávez has had a store, Vero, selling paper and notions for six years. She offers her customers quality and good service. Silvia gets ahead for her two children. She established the business thinking of her family’s economic well-being as well as their morale. She prefers to give her children better attention, and the only way to do this is in her own house. That is why she is asking for help to be able to stock her business in order to keep working in it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: José Paz

texts.es: El maestro José Paz H. S. cuenta con un negocio de comida denominado “Pepes Hamburguesas” este es ubicado a las afueras de su casa en una carrucha, donde ofrece variedad de antojitos como los son las gringas,  hamburguesas y nachos con queso. Esta operación solo la realiza los fines de semana ya que el entre semana se dedica a dar clases en una escuela de Gobierno. Solo que ahora el necesita invertir en su negocio para así generar mas ingresos.
texts.en:
José Paz H. S., a teacher, has a food business called Pepe’s Hamburguesas. It is located on a cart outside of his house. He sells a variety of snacks like quesadillas, hamburgers, and nachos with cheese. He only does this on the week-ends because during the week he teaches at a government school. He now needs to invest in his business in order to generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Maura Cecilia

texts.es: Maura tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación. Maura tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan. Su actividad es una pulpería hace mas de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella inicio este negocio con fondos propios, por lo que anteriormente vendía ropa de manera ambulante, pero lamentablemente tuvo muchas perdidas y decide emprender otro negocio como es la pulpería, pues la mayoría de sus clientes son sus propios vecinos. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y así comprar granos básicos, arroz, aceite, frijoles, arroz gaseosas. Ella siempre sueña con obtener otro negocio.
texts.en:
Maura has worked with the Fundación for a long time. Maura has four children, and they all work. For over seven years she has had a mini-market. She started this business with her own funds. She previously sold clothes as a street vendor, but, unfortunately, she had a lot of losses. She decided to establish another business, the mini-market. Most of her customers are her own neighbors. The loan is for work capital to buy basic grains, rice, oil, beans, and soft drinks. She always dreams of getting another business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos Ortiz tiene una familia muy agradable a la que el desea dar lo mejor de sí.
El es padre de una niña pequeña por quien sale adelante para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida. Hace tiempo el adquirió su vivienda de interés social, pero por falta de capital no ha podido hacer mejoras, es por ello que recurre a esta institución para que se le apoye en su proyecto como pintar las paredes de su vivienda por dentro y por fuera para darle un mejor aspecto.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos Ortiz has a very nice family, and he wants to give them the best of himself. He is the father of a little girl. He wants to get ahead in order to give her a better quality of life. Some time ago he acquired a house through social services. But, he has not been able to make improvements due to lack of money. That is why he comes to this institution so that they will help him with his project of painting the walls on the inside of his house. He will also paint outside to give it a better appearance.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paint his house

loans.name: La Posta Group

texts.es:
El  presente grupo  se llama La Posta, la razón por la cual el grupo le puso ese nombre es por que el barrio se llama La Posta y seria más fácil reconocerlas con dicho nombre, todas viven en Pinotepa, Nacional, Oaxaca

Ángela R. L. es la representante  del grupo La Posta, ella es madre soltera, tiene 4
Hijos: Omar Emmanuel  Cortes Luís  de 22 años que estudia el Tecnológico, Guadalupe  Gisela  Cortes R.  de 19 años que tiene el nivel Bachillerato e Israel Cortes R. de 18 de años que estudio hasta tercer año de la secundaria. Angélica se dedica  a la venta de comida, con el fin de mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia, este negocio la ha motivado a trabajar desde hace tiempo, por que  le ha permitido que sus hijos sigan estudiando y de ahí mismo obtener para la alimentación de ellos.


Invirtió su  su crédito en la compra de materia prima  e ingredientes para la elaboración de comida como pollo, carne, huevo, jitomate, sal etc. Trabaja en  una cocina  para la venta de alimentos, trabaja ahí, por que es un buen lugar y considera que la venta de comida es un buen negocio, por que deja más ganancias, además esta motivada en realizar su actividad, puesto que dicho ingreso apoya  al buen desarrollo de su familia.

Angélica contenta cuenta que  trabaja muy a gusto con sus compañeras de La
Posta por que son  trabajadoras, honestas y todas  quieren salir adelante.
