INTEGRANTES	                   ACTIVIDAD
José David S. M.	  (Taller de Costura),
Josefa Divina  S. M.	  (deposito de Refresco),
Ángela R.  L.	          (Cocina Económica
Efigenia Ricarda  F. Hernández ( Antojitos),
 Ana Maria F.  Hernández	  (Antojitos),
Ciria T.  Hernández	  (Antojitos),
Telma Marín R.	          (Cocina Económica),
Tomasa Lorenza O. C.	  (Abarrotes),
Herma Hernández B.	          (Abarrotes),
Felipa R. L.                 (Cocina económica).
texts.en:
This group is called "La Posta." The reason why the group chose this name is that their neighborhood is called "La Posta," and it would be easier to recognize them with this name. All of them live in Pinotepa, Nacional, Oaxaca. Ángela R. L. is the representative of the "La Posta" group. She is a single mother with 3 children: Omar Emmanuel Cortes Luís, age 22, who is studying at the Technological Institute; Guadalupe Gisela Cortes R., age 19, who has finished secondary school; and Israel Cortes R., age 18, who has studied up to the third year of high school. Angélica works selling food, with the aim of improving her quality of life and that of her family. This business has motivated to work for a long time, since it has allowed her to provide food for her children and let them continue studying. She invested her loan in buying supplies and ingredients for preparing food, such as chicken, meat, eggs, tomatoes, salt, etc. She works in a kitchen to sell her food; she works there because it is a good place and she thinks selling food is a good business, since it gives her higher earnings. She is also motivated to work in this field because this income helps her family get ahead. Angélica reports that she is very happy working with her fellow members of "La Posta," because they are hard-working and honest, and all of them want to improve their lives. MEMBERS ACTIVITY José David S. M. (Tailor's shop), Josefa Divina S. M. (Soft drink depot), Ángela R. L. (Inexpensive meals) Efigenia Ricarda F. Hernández (Snacks), Ana Maria F. Hernández (Snacks), Ciria T. Hernández (Snacks), Telma Marín R. (Inexpensive meals), Tomasa Lorenza O. C. (Groceries), Herma Hernández B. (Groceries), Felipa R. L. (Inexpensive meals).

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying chicken, beef, pork, tomatoes, onion, chilies, oil, salt and other ingredients

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en la ciudad de Ferreñafe, conocida a nivel nacional por sus comidas típicas, se encuentra ubicada a veinticinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de 10 años a la reparación de motores de artefactos menores y también a la venta de respuestos como un complemento a su trabajo, el se inició en sus labores ayudando en un pequeño taller donde aprendió de su oficio y poco a poco, conforme fue adquiriendo experiencia, se independizó y decidió formar su propia empresa, actualmente ya tiene un grupo de clientes fieles los cuales siempre lo recomiendan con algun conocido, por lo que su negocio goza siempre de muy buena acogida.

José Luis desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas respuestos, de modo que pueda tener un stock permanente de las piezas que necesita para realizar mejor su labor, por este motivo el se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el logro de su meta trazada.

José Luis es un hombre honrado y con muchas ganas de superarse, el desea seguir implementando su taller conforme su clientela crezca para asi poder percibir mas ganancias y salir adelante. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien responsable y que siempre esta dispuesto a ayudar a los que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
José Luis is 36 years old and lives with his family in the city of Ferreñafe, which is known at the national level for its traditional foods. The city is located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 10 years he has worked repairing motors of small appliances, and he also sells spare parts as a complement to his work. He started out helping in a small workshop where he learned the trade; gradually he acquired experience and started to work independently and decided to start his own business. Currently he has a group of loyal customers who always recommend him to others, and so his business is well received by the public. José Luis wants to expand his business with the purchase of more spare parts, so that he can have a standing inventory of the parts that he needs to do his work. For this reason he has seen the need to request for the first time a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa that he will invest to achieve this objective. José Luis is an honest man with a strong desire to succeed. He wants to continue equipping his workshop as his customer base grows, so that he can increase his earnings and get ahead. In the neighborhood where he lives his neighbors and acquaintances consider him to be someone who is responsible and is always ready to help others in need.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy small parts to improve his business repairing small motors

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El señor Pedro A. T. desde hace 5 años se dedica al trasporte publico, esta es la manera que el percibe un ingreso para abastecer los gastos de su familia. El camión donde trabaja y traslada al pasajero esta fallando del motor es por ello que el pide el apoyo para comprar un nuevo y no exponer a la gente que traslada a un accidente. Pedro quiere dar un mejor servicio y así poder tener más ingresos para ofrecer a su familia una mejora calidad de vida
texts.en:
For five years, Pedro A. T. has worked in public transportation; this is the way he earns an income to cover his family's expenses. He uses his bus for his work transporting passengers, and the motor is breaking down. For this reason he asks for help to buy a new one and avoid exposing his passengers to the risk of an accident. Pedro wants to offer better service and thus have more income to give his family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bus motor

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE ECCE HOMO”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. FRANCISCA,  ella tiene 42 años de edad y tiene 5 hijos, la socia trabaja con comercio minorista, ella elabora muñecas de trapo y bolsos en macramé; Nuestra socia realiza bellísimos trabajos en tela  (muñecas típicas), su trabajo es muy reconocido que le viene a buscar desde Lima, Machupicchu, Argentina, le comprar al por mayor y ellos lo venden en tiendas exclusivas, Nuestra socia tiene un pequeño taller en su casa. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para elaborar sus muñecas y macramé.
   
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner belongs to the communal bank "Senor de Ecce Homo". She lives in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Francisca, she is 42 years old, and has 5 children. She works with retail trade, making rag dolls and macrame purses. She creates beautiful works with cloth (traditional dolls), and her work is so well known that people come from Lima, Machupicchu, and Argentina to buy from her wholesale, to later sell the products in exclusive stores. Our partner has a small workshop in her house and is requesting this loan to purchase materials to make her dolls and macrame. She is grateful for and values the support provided to her through this medium, and she is committed to repaying her debt in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to make her dolls and macrame

loans.name: San Martin De Umanes Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE UMANES”; Nuestros socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito de Iscuchaka provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. GREGORIA,  Nuestra socia tiene 53 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo,  Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia compra y vende productos agrícolas, su conyugue es agricultor y siembran papa, maíz, hortalizas, trigo, cebada, Nuestra socia también tiene animales vacunos y animales menores (aves de corral y chanchos), Nuestra socia vende los productos algunas veces en Quillabamaba en esta provincia netamente productora de frutas el producto de la socia es muy rentable. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para viajar y llevar sus productos a la provincia de Quillabamba.

Los socios alternan sus actividades con el comercio minorista ellos venden artesanías, ganados, animales menores, venta de chicha, de venta de productos agrícolas, Nuestros socios solicitan el préstamo para reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios.

Los socios  agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partners belong to the communal bank "San Martin de Umanes". They live in the city of Cusco, in the Iscuchaka district, Anta province, and department of Cusco. One of the partners, Gregoria, is 53 years old, a live-in partner, and has one son. She alternates between her domestic chores and retail trade, buying and selling agricultural products. Her husband is a farmer, and they plant potatoes, corn, vegetables, wheat, and barley. Also, Gregoria has livestock, such as cows, chickens, and pigs. Occasionally, she sells her products in Quillabamba, where they primarily produce fruits, and her products are very profitable here. She is requesting this loan to travel and take her products to the province of Quillabamba. The other partners carry out various activities in retail trade, such as selling handicrafts, livestock, maize liquor, and agricultural products. They are requesting this loan to reinvest in their different businesses. They are grateful for and value the support provided to them through this medium, and they are committed to repaying their debts in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To travel and take her products to the province of Quillabamba

loans.name: Horencia

texts.es: Horencia, de 56 años, es una mujer muy noble, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en casa de sus parientes. Hace más de 8 años, se dedica en la venta de productos de belleza, por lo que tiene que recorrer las calles de su barrio, con fin de sus clientes compren sus productos. Su negocio le resulta rentable cuando compra al por mayor la mercadería, durante la campaña de ofertas, pasada el tiempo, estos productos son vendidos a precio normal y eso le favorece mucho en el trabajo y en las ganancias. Su mayor anhelo es progresar su negocio, así como el de implementar la imprenta de su esposo, con el fin de que sus hijos algún día se dedique a ese negocio, ya que lo considera. Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar  puntualmente sus cuotas. En su grupo ha demostrado ser una socia muy responsable. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará repuestos para su maquina Offset, para que pueda trabajar eficazmente su esposo, piuesto que lo considera más rentable que la venta de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Horencia is 56 years old and is a very noble woman. She lives together with her husband and their two children in the house of their relatives. For more than 8 years, she has made a living by selling beauty products, for which she has to travel the streets of her neighborhood. Her business is very profitable when she buys the merchandise wholesale, during sale season. After this, she can sell them at normal price, which favors her greatly. Her greatest wish is to further her business, as well as setting up her husband's printing press, with the hopes that some day her children will be dedicated to that business. This is her twelfth loan with MFP, and she is committed to making her payments punctually. In her group, she has demonstrated herself to be a very responsible partner. With this credit, she will purchase replacement parts for her printing machine, so that her husband can work efficiently, given that they consider this more profitable than selling cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to fix her printing machine

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Carmen tiene 38 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y su hija de 15 años. Hace más de 13 años se dedica  en la venta de productos comestibles, por lo que tiene un puesto de venta en el interior de su casa, lugar donde hay mucha circulación de gente. Cada vez que va adquirir los productos para abastecer su negocio, su hija es quien la ayuda en esa labor, de esa manera evita ser víctima de asalto. Desde entonces trabajan juntas y se esfuerzan cada vez más para sacar adelante su negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su actividad, es que logra conocer mucha gente. Su mayor anhelo es incrementar su negocio con variados productos. Este es su diecisieteavo crédito con  MFP, por tanto promete ser cumplida con sus pagos como hasta ahora, ya que no le gusta tener deudas. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de productos para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is 38 years old, and is a very cheerful and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband and her 15 year-old daughter. For more than 13 years she has been selling food products; she has a food stall set up in part of her home, which is in an area where lots of people pass through. Each time she goes to buy products to supply her store her daughter helps her, so she can avoid becoming a victim of assault. Ever since they have worked together they have worked hard to make the business succeed. What she likes most about her business is that she gets to know a lot of people. Her main wish is to expand her business with a variety of products. This is her 17th loan with MFP, and she is committed to making her payments as she has always done up until now, because she doesn't like to have debts. With the loan she requests, she will invest in the purchase of products to supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more products to supply her store

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila, de 43 años, es una mujer muy serena pero trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos nen su casa propia. El negocio al que se dedica Lucila, es la venta de  maca, quinua, soya, chocolate, por lo que trabaja desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche, además prepara huevos fritos y camote frito, aperitivos que acompañan a estas bebidas nutricionales. Se negocio se ubica frente al mercado de su barrio, cerca de un paradero de autobús, por lo que le favorece en la ganancias, ya que hay mucha concurrencia de personas. Generalmente trabaja sola y durante los fines de semana sus hijos le apoyan en el lavado de vasos y en la preparación de pan con alguna fritura. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es atender y conversar con sus clientes, además de darles un trato cordial. De esa manera ha llegado a tener más de 5 años en este trabajo, sin embargo no logra vender todas sus bebidas. Su mayor anhelo es comprar  mesas y sillas, para la comodidad de sus clientes. Este es su diecisieteavo crédito con MFP y se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas, puesto sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para su negocio. En su grupo, es una socia muy responsable que vela por el bienestar de su asociación. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará un saco de arroz, y harinas de maca, soya y demás productos para la preparación de sus bebidas nutricionales.
texts.en:
Lucila, who is 43 years old, is a very calm but hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband and their four children. Lucila's business is selling drinks made from maca (a Peruvian root vegetable), quinoa (a grain grown in the Andes), soy, and chocolate, and she works from 5 in the morning until 11 at night. She also makes fried eggs and fried sweet potatoes as appetizers to accompany these nutritious drinks. Her business is located in front of the neighborhood market and near a bus stop. This helps her earnings since many people pass through the area. She generally works alone, but on weekends her children help her by washing glasses and preparing bread with some fried foods. What Lucila likes best about her work is waiting on and talking with her customers, as well as giving them friendly service. In this way she has run this business for five years; however, she does not manage to sell all her drinks. Her greatest desire is to buy tables and chairs for her customers' comfort. This is Lucila's seventeenth loan with MFP, and she promises to make all her payments, since she knows that this loan will be very good for her business. In her group, she is a very responsible member who watches out for the association's well-being. With this loan, she will buy a sack of rice, maca and soy flours, and other products used for preparing her nutritious drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purcase of rice, maca flour and soy flour

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia T. is from the village of Brgy. Uno, Katipunan. She is 33 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Sonia owns and operates a retail store selling a variety of different products such as shampoo toothpaste etc. in the local community. Sonia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Sonia joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Sonia is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her fourth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and support her child's education.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma T. is from the village of Zamora. She is 34 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elma owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Elma has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Elma joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Unidos Por El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
Ana A. tiene 30 años D. edad convive con el padre D. sus tres menores hijos , integra  la  Alcancía Comunal  Unidos por el Triunfo, ella se inicio ven la venta D. ropa D. forma ambulatoria  por el sector donD. vive , empezó con una pequeña capital, con el tiempo su ingreso fue mejorando ya que  sus ganancias  lo ahorraba para la  inversión   D. su mercadería como ( polos , pantalones, sabanas)   ha incrementado su venta  y ahora venD. también la venta D. zapatos y zapatillas también realiza los domingos en su domicilio la preparación D. caldo D. cordero  plato típico D. la sierra central del  Perú y los venD.  Este préstamo actual lo invertirá  en la compra D. su mercadería  como también en ingredientes  para la preparación del caldo D. cordero.

Las metas que se ha propuesto es  en  la compra D. un carrito sanduchero  para poder vender salchipapas y pollo broaster  meta que está segura  D. realizarlo,  y lo más importante el apoyo, educación y amor a sus hijos
texts.en:
Ana Maria is is 30 years old and lives with the father of her three youngest children. She is a member of the Alcancía Comunal Unidos por el Triunfo (United for Triumph Community Bank). She started selling clothes as a street vendor in the area where she lives: she started with a small sum of money, but as her earnings have improved in time, as she saved money to buy products such as T-shirts, trousers, sheets. She has increased her income, and now she is also sells shoes and slippers, and on Sundays she prepares and sells caldo D. cordero (lamb soup), a typical dish of the central mountain area of Peru. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy both garments and ingredients to prepare the lamb soup. She aims to buy a sandwich cart to sell salchipapas (sliced pan-fried beef hot dogs or sausage and French fries) and Broaster chicken, a goal she is sure to achieve, even if the most important thing to her is to help, educate and love her children.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy garments to sell and ingredients to prepare her dishes.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita P. is from the village of Canubay. She is 57 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2001, Teresita joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be her sixteenth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Arnie

texts.en:
Arnie D., from the village of Lapero, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, is 30 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Arnie owns and operates a general store selling daily food in the local community. Engaged in his business for three years, he earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Arnie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities and is now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his store.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy products and foods to sell.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda G. is a 44-year-old married woman who supports her family with her general store and with the buying and selling of livestock. She lives in Cabacungan, La Castillana, Negros Occidental, with her husband and their child, who is currently in school. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and livestock businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 15,000 Philippine pesos. Melinda is now borrowing Php 29,500 so that she can continue her general store and livestock businesses. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Melinda aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita P. is a 57-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in pig fattening, selling ready-to-wear clothes and being a beauty product dealer. She lives in Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental with her husband and their three children who are between 17 and 21 years old and are currently going to school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her pig fattening, ready-to-wear clothes and beauty products business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 8,000.

Conchita is now borrowing Php 25,000 so that she can use it as an additional working capital for her pig fattening and ready-to-wear business. This will be her 18th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Conchita aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta P. is a 61-year-old married woman who lives in Park 3, Bantayan, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by making hollow blocks, being a rice retailer and running a general store.

Violeta’s 67-year-old husband, Wenceslao, helps her with managing the business. They have nine children who are between 20 and 39 years old. Three of their children have their own families, while the other six have their own jobs and help their parents with running the business.

Violeta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in making hollow blocks, rice retailing and her general store business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000 from her business activities.

Violeta is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 22,000 was used to fund operations for her hollow blocks making, general store and rice retailing, which had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 14th cycle loan, the amount of Php 22,000, which she intends to use on her hollow blocks, rice retailing and general store. Violeta is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria P. is a 45-year-old widow who supports her family by engaging in an eatery business. She lives in Pader Aguisan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental with her four children, who are all between 14 and 23 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her eatery business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 9,000.

Maria is now borrowing Php 18,000 in order to expand her eatery business. This will be her 14th loan cycle from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step on her journey towards economic freedom. Maria aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.
